Reviews.Title: “Top location (literally speaking!)”
Reviews.Author: cgoldsch
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with spacious rooms on a very upscale part of San Francisco. Definitely recommended if the price is right (which can vary more than 50% depending on the time you decide to go). The hotel is at the top of a hill. Some rooms must have gorgeous views of the City (my view was okay). The streets next to the hotel, particularly Mason, are incredibly steep! Walking up back to the hotel is a workout, even if you exercise regularly. And yes, you should walk in SF instead of drive. Lastly, be mindful of the hidden costs: Internet, fitness center and parking are not included. My honest expectation for an upscale hotel is to have at least fitness center and internet included.

Reviews.Title: “Best Brunch!”
Reviews.Author: Jenn J
Reviews.Content: Whether you stay here or not, you can come in on Sundays for brunch and it is AMAZING. The hotel is impeccably decorated and the dining room looks like an old-fashioned dancing ball room. The rooms are spacious with views overlooking all of San Francisco. But my favorite part was still the buffet; I make it a point to go every time I'm in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Its a classic, with some quirks”
Reviews.Author: lhart_byt
Reviews.Content: San Francisco is a good looking city, and this hotel is a handsome old fashioned guy. The entrance is heavy on grand effect. You arrive bouncing up the city's famous hills and sweep into a honey colored marble interior....which had vintage cars parked in it randomly when we were there. It has a soothing breakfast room and bar in tasteful blues and whites and a random collection of pricey shops in the lobby. It also had an ATM which is handy for this part of town. I worried it was an all skirt and no knickers place (i.e. an all show hotel which would have dated rooms and fusty furniture in the rooms) but was surprised by recent room refreshments which meant they were classic but sharp looking. The bed was ecstasy. If you like them soft you will find it hard to prize yourself out of bed to explore the city. The bathroom was lovely with thick towels, short sleeve robes (I mention this because am I the only one that finds long sleeves a complete chore on robes?!) and good Lab products. It's not chic, it's not contemporary but it's really charming and staff are good. Nob Hill is slightly irritating as its a long up hill climb from either the city centre or the piers but the views are great and it's a proper San Fran experience to stairmaster your way up. Do try the Tonga room for kitch factor (it's ridiculous in a good way) and ask to see the suite on the top floor where JFK wooed Marilyn.

Reviews.Title: “faded glory”
Reviews.Author: stephen g
Reviews.Content: decided to try the fairmont, at the end ofour holiday instead of usual places like the grand hyatt or mark hopkins. the building itself is beautiful and the lobby area and laurel court are amazing. check in was friendly and we were soon up to the room in the main building. it was a reasonable size and the decor was old world to fit with the building. the view was disapointing, we could see a bit of the bay but mostly we were looking at another building. the main problem with the room was the cleanliness. there were bits of biscuit on the floor, the sheers were dirty and the window, on the ouside was filthy. we reported this and the head of housekeeping responded quickly and a deep clean of the room was sorted for the next day. they even sent us a bowl of fruit to say sorry. after the deep clean we checked the room again, the back of the toilet behind the seat, the sealent around the bowl, the sheers and the window were still dirty. the positives were the concierge who got us into a nice restaurant and the staff in the coffee shop cafe centto. the bell desk when checking out and leaving our bags were quite abrubt and not friendly. overall really disappointing given our expectations. if you want somewhere nice with a view and clean rooms, go to the mark hopkins or the grand hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: NelsonVNile
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a grand hotel with a great location on Knob Hill and nice, comfortable rooms. The lobby is stunning. The hotel has seen its share of history. The United Nations was founded here in 1945. The restaurants and bar are a bit pricey but there are many other options nearby. China town is an easy walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: kattrins
Reviews.Content: a wonderful hotel at the top of Knob Hill. Everything was perfect - from the moment I arrived. Staff went out of their way to make my stay perfect and I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “First Stay”
Reviews.Author: slotsgal
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my husband's 40th birthday we stayed for one night in the main building. The valet service was efficient but I think the rest of the staff busy with other guests luggage so they could not help us out. The lobby is beautiful and just as expected. The room assigned was bigger than anticipated but non-view. The flatscreen was a bit small for such a big room. The bathroom amenities are nice and towels soft. The bathtub did have a bit of standing water but not really a big deal. We found the staff at the bell desk to be friendly and helpful. The food at Laurel Court very good but expensive. Try the Fairmont beer! We had dinner at the Tonga room which was fun but again drinks very expensive. Make sure you make reservations prior or you will not get in. When checking out I was disappointed with the front desk clerk. There was no asking how are stay was and there was some charges on the bill that shouldn't have been there. Overall it is a beautiful historic hotel but very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down”
Reviews.Author: becky727
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights as the last leg of our honeymoon. We've stayed at Fairmont hotels all over the world before, and they had always exceeded our expectations. Unfortunately, the Fairmont San Francisco did not continue that trend. It started with our arrival on a Thursday around 4pm. A storm was blowing in rapidly, and our taxi driver unloaded our many bags into the driveway. (We were at the tail end of a 2.5 week trip that included our wedding -- so we had a lot of luggage.) There was not a bellman or a cart to be seen, and with the weather threatening, we couldn't just wait for one to appear. With great difficultly we brought all of our bags in through the single door (that needed to be held open -- how is this ADA compliant?) Once we made it to the check-in desk, we were told that we would have a tower room on the 4th floor. We had specifically requested a tower room on a high floor (and had let them know it was our honeymoon). When I asked about the view, and if we could get something higher, I was told that all tower rooms have excellent views and anyways that there was an amenity waiting for us in our room, so we couldn't change it. He then (possibly jokingly) asked if we had all of our bags, or if we had left any on the curb. He didn't offer to call a bellman to help us with our bags, and he didn't congratulate us or make mention of the fact we were on our honeymoon in anyway other than the comment about the amenity. He did mention that we should check out the Tonga Room during our stay, but that it was closed for a private party that night. We went up to our room, and while the view was very nice, it was very clear that the view would be incredible. Also, there wasn't an amenity waiting for us as the man at the front desk had suggested. I called down to the front desk to see if it would be possible to change rooms. I spoke with the Front Desk Manager, told her we had requested a room on a high floor and that we were on our honeymoon. She said she would look to see what options were available and call me back. When she called back, she told me there were fully booked and no other options were available for that night, but we could move the next day to a higher floor. She told us we should leave our packed bags in the room and while we were out, they would be moved to our new room. (FYI – the amenity – a bottle of champagne and two chocolate covered strawberries did eventually arrive with a nice note from the manager. This was very, very nice, but the only personal touch or acknowledgement of our honeymoon we received during our stay.) The next morning, we re-packed everything before leaving at 7:45am for a tour of Muir Woods (it was awesome - check out my other review). We ended up spending the whole day out, and didn't return to the hotel until 10:30pm. We went to the Front Desk to get the room number and key for our new room, and there was total confusion. We were asked if we had multiple reservations and where we had put our bags. The clerk made several calls asking if anyone had picked up or seen our bags. She disappeared to the back room several times. After about 20 minutes, she gave us our new room keys, sent us up to our new room, and assured us our bags would be right behind us. I was very skeptical (and really tired), but we went upstairs. The view from the 19th floor was AMAZING. And surprisingly, our bags did appear about a half hour later. I still have no idea where they were all day. While the view was great, the room (I believe 1900), was not. We were right by the elevators, and it was one of the most noisy hotel rooms I stayed in. The elevator sounded liked a helicopter and was constant. The HVAC system made a strange clicking noise that sounded very much like the door being unlocked (which was unnerving). The room was beautiful at first glance, but upon closer look could really use some updating. The veneer on the furniture was falling off. There was mold in the shower. We decided to check out the Tonga Room on Sunday night. The concierge couldn't get us a reservation, but told us we should just go down there. We did, and the host practically laughed at us when we told him we didn't have a reservation, and then promptly sent us on our way. We asked the concierge for another recommendation that would have a vegetarian option, and they were stumped. The only suggestion he could offer was the Nob Hill Cafe (which we had already dined at), so we told him we'd find something on yelp. On our check out day, we had a maid enter our room (without knocking) at 8am. Granted we didn't have the "do not disturb" sign, but 8am still seems really early! At 11am, we had to wait 45 minutes (and make a follow-up call) to have a bellman come help us with our bags. In summary, we were completely unimpressed with the service -- from the front desk staff to the bellman to housekeeping to the concierge to the restaurant host. I would have expected better from a Motel 6. There were several large groups at the hotel during our stay, and they dominated the common areas (and apparently the attention of the staff). I'm sure if you were part of one of the groups, your experience would have been much better. We were treated like an afterthought. In a city with a number of beautiful hotels, next time I would certainly pick one that caters to individual travelers and not just large groups.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: kladis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Nobb Hill for 3 nights prior to moving on to Napa. The Hotel has that old world charm and very impressive lobby. Higher level rooms have a great view of the city and even Alcatraz. I knew that the hotel was older actually 105yrs old and was expecting it not to be as nice, but it definitely proved me wrong! Comfortable bed, large bathroom and even larger walk in closet! The only downside is we had a difficult time regulating the AC in the room it was either too cold or too hot to where we needed to crack a window to cool it down. I highly recommend going down to the ground level cafe for a quick breakfast, they have amazing croissants and coffee, it was actually better than the full breakfast in the hotel restaurant and 1/3 the price.

Reviews.Title: “Rich in history, but poor in amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn007
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I toured San Francisco and stayed at The Fairmont for three nights. The room was lovely. The hotel is beautiful and so rich in history. It's obviously a place for the rich and famous. Speaking of rich and famous...perhaps there are amenities they get that ordinary tourists don't. But for the price we paid, I felt we were rich and famous for three nights. I would have liked to have had complimentary water available to us at check in, coffee and tea in the room (like The Trump in Chicago), and chocolates with turn down service. This is Ghiradelli country after all. I would also have appreciated access to a swimming pool and hot tubs (like The Trump in Chicago). Overall, this was a pleasant stay and I'm happy we chose this hotel for the history and comfort. However, if I visit San Francisco again, I'll look for a place that is not only comfortable, but rich in amenities. I have rated this hotel as very good based on the reasons given in the review.

Reviews.Title: “classy”
Reviews.Author: ISmilitarytraveler
Reviews.Content: very old world, classy hotel. great view of the bay (Golden Gate and Alcatraz) from the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Loses a point because of NOISE”
Reviews.Author: AJ_Canvey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the final leg of our honeymoon, and picked the hotel for it's central location. With two tram lines right outside the door, it was dead easy getting around San Fran. If you don't mind walking downhill, Union Sq and Market St are only ten-fifteen minutes away. If it's morning, stop at Lori's on route as the breakfasts are great. We found the concierge and bell staff to be really charming and helpful. We booked Alcatraz through concierge... I don't think we'd have got in otherwise... it sells out ages in advance! We ate at the Tonga restaurant in the hotel on our final night and had a really fun time. The live band were fantastic. The food is good but the portions are huge so share plates. The Mai Tai has been rated something like the best in the city or world or something... and it really is! However... noise was a huge issue. Whether that was being able to hear every word of conversations in the next rooms, being woken up due to a commotion in the corridor at 2:00 a.m. or not being about to get off to sleep until 1:00 a.m. due to a do in one of the function rooms two floors beneath our room. We did raise this problem with the front desk who told us the DJ should be finishing at 12:00 a.m. but the music went on for longer than planned. Overall, a good stay though.

Reviews.Title: “SF weekend”
Reviews.Author: mememeinsc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently celebrated our 20th anniversary with a weekend stay at the Fairmont San Francisco. While pricey, it was a delightful experience. There is an air of relaxed elegance that we found charming and very comfortable. Our 6th floor room had an ok view of the Mark Hopkins across the street. The linens and bed were extremely comfortable. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and even cracked a bottle of champagne on the rooftop garden one afternoon. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Short Stay at a Legend”
Reviews.Author: Mohammedyu
Reviews.Content: I reserved two rooms for one night using the hotel's website. I arranged for airport pickup from SFO. I was staying in San Francisco for one night before moving on to Monterey. Usually, an Old World hotel like this one tends to sit on its laurels and charge premium rates for lackluster rooms, service and facilities. The Waldorf Astoria comes to mind. However, the Fairmont was an exception. The front of the hotel from outside still looks impressive, as does the lobby area. I found the rooms commendable also. Yes, there is no coffee machine in the room -- but sometimes I think that's a plus factor -- there are plenty of places around the hotel to get a good cup of coffee. The staff was also very helpful and friendly -- the concierge helped me make some limousine/car service arrangements without a hitch -- the service that they use was very professional. I had breakfast included in my rate and had the morning buffet. It's not the typical feeding trough you would see at many places. Much more smaller scale, but more than sufficient to cover breakfast. Overall, I was expecting a lot worse and I was pleasantly surpised.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: OliveOylTampa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont San Francisco (Nob Hill) for several nights. The hotel has the old world charm you'd expect from hotels years past; elegant, grand and beautiful decor. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful; the rooms were a nice size (bathrooms were a tad small) and bed was comfortable. This hotel was pretty centrally located (you did have to walk up some incredibly steep hills to get there - spend the money and take the taxi after your first time walking!) but a beautiful location. The outside is a tad understated but when you walk in the front door the grandeur awaits you. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: gary h
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the fairmont for four nights and we payed extra for "Skyline view" as we were put on the 6th floor the only view was a couple of low building roofs. The grand interior does not make up for the poor performance as a hotel , no tea and coffee making facilities in the room they want you to pay room service. The aircon is very noisey. The good point is the staff are very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms, but great atmostphere”
Reviews.Author: roughrob
Reviews.Content: It feels harsh rating this place as average because it has such a presence and rich history within the city. My only reason is because our room was very noisy, both from the thin wall with the adjoining room and a gap in the door that you could easily fit a couple of coins through, perhaps next time I shouldn't be such a cheapskate and upgrade - but compared to other Fairmont properties this room just didn't have the quality feel. The hotel does deliver on service and the lounge is a joy to relax in, we also found the location to be perfect. Despite the mediocre room we still felt a sense of excitement walking through the lobby each day all of the staff we dealt with were welcoming and genuine.

Reviews.Title: “First-class service and elegant accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Friend77778
Reviews.Content: Visited the Fairmont San Francisco for a 4-day conference and our stay was excellent in every way. The service was fantastic -- Staff (front desk, concierge, bellmen, housekeeping) was consistently helpful, courteous, friendly and went out of their way to meet every need. Our room was beautifully decorated and furnished, bathroom was spotless and the bed was very comfy. I was concerned that with all of the niceties, I would find extra charges on my final bill, but that was not the case. Also spent a fun evening in the Tonga room listening to great live music and watching whole families get out and dance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy M
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights as part of a driving tour. Nice room, comfortable bed but surprisingly small for US, great products. Ask for a room with a view and if that fails have breakfast in the Crown Room. Really grumpy bar man but good service in Tonga restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A Tower Suite Review”
Reviews.Author: Crescoia
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a 6 night stay in one of the famous tower suites, although we only stayed 3 nights. The reason we checked out early is also the reason I can’t give this hotel five stars. The tower suites are magnificent suites, my only issue with them is that while they are not all created equal, they are all priced equal. When booking we requested a high floor which was important to me, in part because it is a nicer view in general, and also because I had a particular photo time lapse project of the bay and the bridge in mind. They had us on the 6th floor, one of the lowest floors with a tower suite. I had hoped having a 6 night stay might give our high floor request some preference, but that was not the case. We were earlier in the afternoon, and I offered that we could check our bags and come back later if they are still getting some of the higher floor rooms ready but that wasn’t the case. I then hope to salvage something from our stay by asking if we could take the 6th floor room for a few nights and transfer to a higher floor later in our 6 night stay. Our very friendly check in agent spent a lot of time with us but said that all the higher tower suite rooms were ‘locked’ and he couldn’t switch any of them around. After talking with a manager he even got the keys to our suite and a very nice upgraded suite in the main building to offer us a choice. The upgrade suite was huge, even larger than the tower suite, but basically on the same equivalent floor, so it didn’t improve the view which is what I was hoping for. Since all the higher suites were locked we didn’t really have a choice, it was the 6th floor or nothing. Our 6th floor suite was still very nice and had all the amenities of other tower suites except the view, we did not have a view of the Golden Gate Bridge. My own estimation is that you would have to be on a floor in the teens or higher to get a good view of the bridge. With 23 floors in the tower this would probably include over half of the tower suites, but definitely not all of them. While I’ve long been aware that not all hotel guest are equal (some requests were able to ‘lock’ rooms for all 6 days while my reservation was not able to), it would seem very reasonable to price different rooms differently. I would have paid more to get a room that met my requirements, and ended up feeling overcharged for a room that did not. With that basic complaint out of the way let me list all the great aspects of the hotel that still merits it getting a four star review. ARRIVAL Let me start with the booking process. If you’re contemplating booking this hotel, and are not already a member of their President’s Club, just sign up. It is free, and starting with this stay you’ll get complimentary high-speed Internet, complimentary use of the on-site gym (both are services they charge for here to the chagrin of many reviewers) and express check-in. Arriving in the portico is quite an experience, the front of the hotel is covered with a detailed Terra-cotta exterior draped with flags from around the world, and mammoth Corinthian marble columns. The lobby was stunning. Renovated to accent its 1907 design and grandeur, the floor is alabaster marble, and marble columns and gold accents would make any silver magnate feel at home. I already mentioned how friendly the check in agent was spending over a half hour with us trying to accommodate our request. But everyone we met from housekeeping to the Laurel Court staff was extremely pleasant and helpful, a very worldly and well trained staff. THE HOTEL The hotel really is the Grand Dame of San Francisco hotels. It may show its age (usually in a good way) in some parts, but it has been renovated regularly and is a first class hotel by any measure. If you insist on a very modern hotel the Four Seasons or the Mandarain will likely be more your cup of tea, but if you appreciate classic hotels like the Del Corando, The Grand Hotel, or the Stanley, you’ll love the San Francisco Fairmont. Just as important the service is what you would expect from a top hotel. The walls are decorated with pictures of celebrities that have visited over the years and range from Obama to Truman. The rooftop garden is a very pleasant surprise. It really is the hotel’s own little oasis complete with a fountain, palm trees and benches in the middle of one the world's busiest cities. Lastly if you like history and get a chance poke your head into the Venetian Ballroom. While a who’s-who of celebrities once entertained here, I liked to stand and envision being one of the lucky few who sat at a table and watch Tony Bennett audition ‘I Left My Heart in San Francisco’ in this very room. This would not be anyone's idea of a budget hotel, but if budget is your primary concern you’ll probably end up staying somewhere other than Nob Hill. CONCIERGE I had seen travel programs that indicated the Fairmont had Tom Wolfe, who was the first concierge in the nation, but assumed he would have been long since retired. Not so... he is here and has been since 1973. When we ran into him on our way out one morning he very graciously stood for a picture with my wife and myself. Yes, everyone here was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ripe off.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler49er62
Reviews.Content: Revisiting our honeymoon hotel from 20 years ago. Was promised they would do everything to have our stay special. Apon arriving, found the room we requested unavailable. With apology, an inspection of two rooms settled in room on the 9th floor..11 floors lower than what we had requested. Just alright with that, continued to enjoy our weekend getaway. After parking our car in the hotels garage we found out without notification from staff that parking was $62 per day. Continuing on trying to enjoy our anniversary weekend we tried to log on the wireless Internet that was offered but wasnt told that there would be a charge of $14 a day. So at this point we are wondering if we could wash our hands, use a towel, or even use the toilet without being charged. So unless you are willing to blow your money or here on business ready for your company to blow their money, I would not recommend this hotel. The room was common, the bed below standard, the tv small in today's world. The best features of the room was the view and the bathroom. Unfortunately you didn't get the view in the bathroom. So maybe if they can change that so that the bathroom could be the main room with the view it wouldnt feel as bad to be ripped off. So in summary, in the words of The Fairmont Staff this is the city and other people are happy to pay for whatever the staff tells you to pay. I guess we will not be coming back to the CITY, at least here at the Fairmont. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: SCgigi_12
Reviews.Content: My first time at the Fairmont and was not disappointed. I was there for business and had everything I needed. Good service and nice accommodations. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “still wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MFHLouisville_KY
Reviews.Content: Elegant hotel on Nob Hill convenient to everything. Rooms in tower (TOWER) on a clear day and from higher floors have one of the most beautiful views in the world. If you can swing a suite, the view is even better with the corner window. Trolleys (California and Powell Street) intersect behind hotel outside garage. No concierge floor, as in some other Fairmonts, but of minimal significance. Use Starwood a lot (and lover their SPG program) but cannot bring myself to try St Regis, W, or The Palace because of the view and overall ambiance in the Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “First Fairmont Visit”
Reviews.Author: spinecutter
Reviews.Content: This is an elegant and extremely customer oriented hotel with a spectacular location though if you plan to walk to too many places where good hiking shoes. The hills leading up or down from the hotel are a touch steep. The rooms are magnificently comfortable, the staff helpful and courteous, and the food in the Tonga Room was wonderful. The gym is also quite adequate. I would encourage you to join the Presidents Club of the hotel as it then gives free standard access to internet and to the gym. Ready access to Union Square shopping, and some lovely little cafes down the street for meals if you want to eat out of the hotel proper.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for the grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: BILLYSE21
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot on the hill with the 2 cable car lines running outside,use the cafe cento entrance/exit to save the walk round the block. Great service particularly the front desk. Rooms lovely and a great bathroom, really enjoyed my stay. Join the presidents club (free) for free wifi and use of the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jene74
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a conference and the hotel was absolutely beautiful! Very historic and charming and very clean. Our room was huge. The service was also fantastic and everyone went out of their way to help. I would highly recommend it. The Tonga room in the hotel is really fun as well. The Hotel is not far from many points of interest, but it is at the top of Nob Hill so if you plan to walk to those places, be prepared to walk back up a very steep hill or hail a cab. The Street Cars will also drop you off at various points of interest though and they run right by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in the city!”
Reviews.Author: texasswerve
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to San Francisco 7 times in the last 2 years due to our son being in college at Berkeley. We have tried many of the top hotels in the city and have found our new favorite! Everything was absolute perfection from check-in to check-out. Our room was beautiful with a gorgeous view of the city. The bar downstairs in the lobby was a wonderful place to gather and relax. All of the staff were very friendly and had that can do attitude. The location is perfect within walking distance of most portions of the Financial District, Nob Hill and Union Square. Even though it's within walking distance of many attractions, it is very quiet! Not anything like staying right in the heart of Union Square or off of Market Street , both of which are very noisy! So if you like a beautiful hotel with wonderful service in a quiet location, this hotel is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel ... Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CJMTraveler
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an elegant alternative in San Francisco, be sure to check out the Fairmont. Set in the Russian Hill area, it's easy to get to all the tourist attractions but set away from a lot of the craziness of the city. Hotel features large, well-appointed rooms. Plenty of food and beverage outlets to choose from if you decide to dine in the hotel. Polished, professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Charm with tower rooms for fabulous bay views”
Reviews.Author: CatherineLeonia_NJ
Reviews.Content: San Francisco needs no hype from me. Wonderful city filled with fun neighborhoods and friendly people. The Fairmont Hotel on Nob Hill is traditionally charming and grand with good service, piano bar pleasant, great location -- quick but steep walk down to Union Square. Convenient cable car stop at corner of hotel. Toured all the favorite spots. Buena Vista, Cliff House for sunset over the Pacific and ferried to Sausalito (terminal shops very fun, offering interesting small businesses, nice change from chains and usual novelty shops on pier.) Muir Woods amazing especially road to reach the park!

Reviews.Title: “Full of character”
Reviews.Author: C---cumber
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in Nov 2011, just as the Gingerbread house was being built. It is fascinating and you see how much work is put into it. The lobby area is extremely grand and welcoming. We stayed in a standard room and found this to be comfortable with all standard amenities. I think happy hour at the bar was from 5-7pm and offered some fab cocktails. I didn't have too much interaction with the staff but they were helpful when called upon. The location is great although after a day or evening out and about it can be tough walking up the hill to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont was fair at best”
Reviews.Author: 09cas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont for a conference. During check in and check out the front desk clerks were very rude and not the least bit friendly. The room I was given was smaller than average with huge ceilings. I found multiple hairs on the sheets upon my arrival. The lobby was grand and nice. I returned to my room one afternoon to find three messages on my machine claiming I ordered breakfast which I did not. Wildly strange because when I called down to check on it they had no record of it either. Upon checkout, they attempted to charge me $20 for a USB Flash Drive which I did not take from the refreshment center. That's always nice. Parking was $61/night which is a little steep. Restaurant on site wasn't much. No vending on site. If you want a Coke you have to purchase it from the gift shop before 10 pm and they charge $4 for a 20 oz. Coke. The hotel is simply too rich for my blood and I would never choose to stay their on my own. The hallways are dark. Mattresses and pillows left much more to be desired in the way of comfort. The doors are paper thin. You can hear everything in the hallways and vise versa. In the mornings you can certainly hear the hot water scream through the pipes to service the rooms above you. However, other than hotels outrageous prices it is not any fancier than any other hotel I have stayed at. Historic charm for some but it just felt like an old outdated house to me. Oh yeah, there is no swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Classical Room”
Reviews.Author: Allan S
Reviews.Content: Beautiful classical room but not very comfy... Was invited to stay here courtesy of Amex. Given a beautiful classical suite. Amazing Views. BAD bed.... Apart from that everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, just wish they had coffee makers in the rooms....”
Reviews.Author: skeezixtoronto
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Fairmont recently. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The front desk staff were welcoming, the concierge went out of his way to be helpful, the waiters in the bar made us feel at home. The room was lovely -- we stayed in the historic building by choice -- clean and spacious, with nice views of North Beach and the Coit Tower. The Nob Hill location was perfect, and walking up the hill at the end of each evening made us feel a little less guilty about all the fantastic food we'd been eating in San Francisco restaurants. Our stay was relaxed and comfortable. Other than one thing, we could not have asked for more. The one problem: we couldn't understand why they didn't have coffee makers in the rooms. It's such a standard hotel thing, so it is really bizarre that they've chosen not to provide this one amenity. It was actually annoying. They did have free coffee and tea in the lobby in the morning, but that was a hassle compared to the ability to make a fresh pot in one's room. I'd love to have given the hotel an excellent review, as opposed to very good, since we did have such a nice stay. But coffee makers in the rooms is such an obvious thing that they could be doing, and the fact that they haven't just leaves me scratching my head.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: nyo2007
Reviews.Content: ...but also in need of a little updating. It's very old school elegance, I think it's a beautiful place to stay. I love the Nob Hill area, I lived in SF for 10 years but never spent much time in this neighborhood. It's close to Union Square, but be warned the walk back is all uphill. The Tonga Room is also located in the hotel, and Top of the Mark is right across the street at the Mark Hopkins. We snagged a special holiday rate and stayed a couple weeks before Xmas. The hotel had a huge tree in the lobby and a giant gingerbread house display, it was very festive.

Reviews.Title: “As expected but very expensive for food and drinks”
Reviews.Author: phadreus
Reviews.Content: This is obviously a great hotel but we felt that 4 drinks for 79 dollars was a bit much given the amount we paid for an pretty good (but not the greatest) room. The best value is the Cafe on the bottom floor - reasonable and very good for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Weekend on Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: mikeyyz
Reviews.Content: After a journey up to the top of Hob Hill, you know you’ve arrived somewhere special. We were planning a special weekend to celebrate an anniversary, and after a recent visit to SF where I wasn’t convinced that we should stay in the SoMa and Union Square areas. The Fairmont San Francisco is only a few blocks away, but feels a world apart. The stunning building is a beauty to see, especially lit up at night! Walking into the majestic lobby felt special every time we returned to the hotel – lots of history was made here! There was no line for check-in, and it was friendly and efficient – we were off to our room within minutes. We stayed in the Tower Building, a short walk from the lobby but home to some of the best views in the hotel, as it extends more than 20 floors – much higher than the historic building. If you have the option for a discounted upgrade during booking or check-in, it’s definitely worth it to upgrade to this tower since the views are extraordinary from atop the hill – much better than anything I’ve experienced at the Westin, W, or St. Regis during previous stays in the city. I used one of my Fairmont upgrade certificates for this stay. The rooms have great bathrooms – we like the new Rose toiletries that Fairmont has switched to. The living areas are traditional and well-furnished - representative of the “casual luxury” that Fairmont is known for. The bed was extremely comfortable. The fitness centre is well equipped with modern equipment – and a steam and sauna. I would have liked for it to be open past 7pm on the weekends, but we had evening plans anyways! Signing up for free with Fairmont’s Presidents Club program gets you free Internet and the option of getting a reebok gym outfit to use during your stay. We had a great breakfast at Laurel Court on Sunday – it was reasonably priced at $30 and I was happy that they had gluten free options! If you feel like an adventure, go down to Market Street to Dottie's True Blue Cafe - where we went on Saturday. I'd agree that it's the best breakfast in San Francisco, but it's a pretty sketchy area - we were harassed by at least 5 people walking down the street. We arrived by 8am to avoid a 1+ hour wait. The Tongo room in the basement looked like a really unique place to dine – we didn’t get a chance to make it down there. For a special dinner, head 2 blocks away to Keiko a Nob Hill – one of the best meals of my life and very reasonable for the quality of food you will get ($85 for 7 course tasting menu) A lot of people mentioned the parking costs, so I planned to return my rental after dropping off luggage, but Avis nearby didn't allow after-hours rentals. If you have a rental car and arrive too late to return it before the morning, there is garage just one block up California which is $34 for 12 hours. But once you get past 12 hours, almost everything I saw for parking is $50+

Reviews.Title: “Lobby still amazing, rooms not like they once were”
Reviews.Author: vagabond2010
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is really regal and impressive, however the rooms need some tlc. We changed rooms twice due to lack of cleanliness and amenities. Once we were settled into our third room things improved. The service was very spotty. The front desk staff seemed to be tired of listening to people complain and hardly ever smiled. We will not be returning to the Fairmont San Francisco in the future.

Reviews.Title: “If walls could talk...overall great stay in this historic location in majestic San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: kit628
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for business in March. I did encounter some negatives, as other reviewers pointed out- $65 overnight parking, expensive breakfast/room service, no coffee in room unless you request it. But, I planned for this...requested coffee in the room the first morning after my arrival, didn't order room service or eat the breakfast buffet. We rented a car for one afternoon from enterprise on Mason street just a few blocks away to avoid the $65 overnight parking, and walked to most other places if needed. But what makes this Hotel exceptional is the history, the grandeur, the location perched at the top of Nob Hill, and the Fact that every u.s. president since Harry Truman has stayed there. The service was good from the moment I pulled in. The hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of Union Square, even though you may have to walk up and down the hills to see the surrounding sites. If you have time, meander through the hallways near the Tonga Room where they have old pictures and restaurant menus of the hotel from the 1920s through the 1960s. Don't forget to check out the outdoor garden. Take a morning stroll and get some great pics of the city. We will definitely return, The positives outweigh the small negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Kieiffsst
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our honeymoon .... What a disappointment. The room was Distinctly average, no free wi fi, no free water, no tea/coffee making facilities. (had to ask a surly receptionist for this) not impressed by the lack of amenities or level of service received. ( a smile doesn't cost much) would visit San fran again but would not stay at the fairmont!!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Luxury is still the best!”
Reviews.Author: s n
Reviews.Content: High up on the hill overlooking San Francisco is this grand dame of San Francisco. This is where "I left my heart..." was first sung. I loved everything about my stay at this hotel and hope you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: stephanierae92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Fairmont for an overnight weekend getaway with another couple. Customer service at the hotel was fantastic from the minute we pulled into valet. Restaurants and shopping were all a short cab ride away from the hotel. When we checked into our room the robes were missing from the bathroom, but housekeeping was quick to bring them to us. Overall, great stay! I loved the historic ambience of the hotel and the feeling you get just knowing it has been there for over 100 years. Pretty cool if you are into that kind of thing.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the City”
Reviews.Author: kaycee2117
Reviews.Content: Fairmont SF is a beautiful hotel located on top of a hill. We usually walk around during our vacations and did the same in SF. We walked to the shopping mall, Chinatown and to Fishermans Wharf during our 3 day stay in the city. Be warned it is very hilly so just wear comfy shoes or opt to take the bus/cable car. Hotel has an amazing lobby - everything is very grand. Room was spacious and comfy. Only thing was when we checked in, we walked our room and a vacuum was blocking the entry way. A housekeeper was in there still cleaning up. She told us she was almost done cleaning so we waited in the hallway with our bags for about 5 mins. Not a big deal, but we found it odd that they gave us a room that wasn't ready yet. Not too many restaurants within walking distance, but there is Nob Hill Cafe with very yummy food. good for lunch. Downside is there's no swimming pool/sauna/hot tub located on premise. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and won't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous View!”
Reviews.Author: ljmzta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont to celebrate our 23rd wedding anniversary. I booked a tower suite after reading the room/rate differences thinking that would be best for us. I opted for $25 extra for a higher floor if available at checkin and $20 more for early checkin seeing that we arrived at around 11am. The front desk gentleman and the bell service were very polite and helpful with our needs and questions. We were booked in the Tiburon Suite which was amazing! The room was huge with a corner view of the city, we could see the bay bridge as well as the Golden Gate from the 20th floor. The room came equipped with a telescope so you could read even the street signs far below and plan our route to Chinatown. This view was so wonderful that I never turned on the 2 flat screen TV's, opting to only enjoy the beautiful city instead. The bathroom was nicely appointed in marble and granite. The towels were great, the robes were great, the bed was comfy. Their were 2 air temp control buttons in the room, 1 for the living room and 1 for the bedroom. There was a mini bar which we did not use but no fridge to add our own items. If needed, I'm sure the hotel would have brought us one. We dined in the Laurel Court Restaurant and Bar twice, once for dinner and once for breakfast. The staff was engaging and very polite. The food was very good on both occasions. For breakfast one day I sent my husband to the El Centro cafe for pastries and coffee and it was good also. We used the Hertz service to get a rental car for a day to head out to wine country. I thought the gas rates were crazy, gas costs $1 higher in San Francisco than home but that was not Hertz or the Fairmont's fault of course. They brought the car straight to the hotel garage and we had to return it to a place 6 blocks up the street and catch a taxi back,(don't poke fun of me for not walking 6 streets, it's all up a steep hill!) it's a shame they didn't offer a ride back to the hotel considering what we paid for the rental car ($127 including gas.) Don't park at the hotel because they want $62.50 per night for parking! The lobby and the walls of photos and history were beautiful and interesting. This is one of the nicer places I've stayed (not counting the S. Pacific for obvious reasons). I would definitely recommend it to anyone coming to San Francisco. If you come here, join the club ahead of time, we were granted free wifi and access to the work out facilities though we never used that work out room. Membership is free. We did experience a 4.0 quake while sleeping on the 20th floor at 5:33am. It didn't even wake us. We found out about it by text 30 minutes later from my mother in law.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: alm0st50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Fairmont Hotel to celebrate a special occasion. We were very disappointed! We had been looking forward to our stay after staying at a lovely Inn in Yountville where the service and food were impeccable. Upon arriving, we had to ask twice for a bellman to help us with our luggage. The check-in clerk was friendly, however, recommended a very touristy restaurant, after we specifically asked for a non-tourist place to celebrate our special occasion. We then asked 2 concierges to help us with restaurant reservations. They were not helpful at all considering this is supposed to be a world class hotel. One was new and had no experience, the other wasn't interested in helping us nor did he seem to know much about SF restaurants. We were shocked at the lack of service provided. We ended up doing everything on our own and even got in to a restaurant that both concierges said we'd never get in. The guest room itself was small, stuffy, and smelled bad. The bathtub had hair in it. We went to the Tonga Bar however, didn't stay. We just wanted to have a glass of champagne and it was too crowded and noisy. Our brunch the next morning for 5 was good and the service at Laurel Court was also good. Upon check-out, the blond European woman was unfriendly and rude and just handed us our recent without smiling or saying anything. Overall, this was a big disappointment and we wouldn't stay here again. The hotel just felt dreary and uncared for. I have been here before and this was nothing as I remembered. Hope they can take care of the problems and bring it back up to it's former standards. It is a great location and used to be the grande old dame of San Francisco. What a pity!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and facilities ; lack room amenities”
Reviews.Author: joeqatar
Reviews.Content: Hotel in located walkable distance to the city centre and with easy access to all kind of transportations. The staff is great and attentive and available for any assistance. Two restaurants with great choice of menu ; the breakfast area is quite large and with scrumptious menu. Slight negative side is everything is chargeable in the room; wifi, drinking water and so on.

Reviews.Title: “Very historic, warm and charming.”
Reviews.Author: DanTheTravelerFromNC
Reviews.Content: If you like the older, historic charm of San Fransico, then this place is for you. Just a few blocks from the Wharf and China Town, this place has great amenities and provides a great taste of the area. Great food and wine and the service was great. The onsite Hertz counter helped a bunch.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty standard luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigdiddy
Reviews.Content: If you are staying for pleasure i think the hotel is in an excellent spot. For business it is a long walk down the hills to the office buildings. I thought they did everything up to quality standards, but nothing over the top. Just a solid hotel for typical SF prices. Well appointed and tasteful. Clean spacious rooms (mine anyway). Large clean bathrooms. The lobby bar was nice although the tiki room or whatever was closed for an event. The valet did take care of a shoe shine right away when asked. Would definitely visit again for business, not sure i would pay the prices though if traveling for personal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: travel_nut_1960
Reviews.Content: Normally when I visit SF, I stay with friends. This visit I wanted to spoil myself and splurge on a nice weekend at a grand San Francisco hotel. At 106 year old, The Fairmont is the Grande Dame of San Francisco and was the obvious choice. I wasn’t disappointed! I reserved a main bldg 2 room suite for a 3 day weekend get away, Feb 24-27. I found the rates reasonable for what you got and the location, for a suite I paid $390 + 55 tax per night. The hotel upgraded me to a Tower Suite on the 23rd floor. The views were incredible. No hotel in San Francisco can come close to views from The Fairmont Tower. Period. Views of The Golden Gate, Alcatraz, Coit Tower, The TransAmerica Pyramid, the Bay Bridge and the entire skyline. Sunrises and sunsets are amazing. Each room has a telescope to see the sights. From my suite I could even see what people were drinking at The Top of The Mark. The suite was huge, beautifully decorated with a gorgeous marble bath. Everything in the room was in perfect order. I was able to check in early at noon and check out 2 hours late with no problem. Geoffrey, at the front desk was fantastic. The entire staff was friendly and eager to help. The lobby is incredible and the roof gardens are a sanctuary in the city. Every morning, I ate the breakfast buffet in the Laurel Court Restaurant. The food was very good with a lot of variety. The omelet chef even remembered what I liked after the first day. All my local friends joined me at the hotel for breakfast. At $30, it’s a bargain and convenient. I doubt you could find brunch for less. Plus I never ate lunch because of my big breakfast. I also had room service twice for a late supper; the food was fast and tasty. The cost was no more than going out to eat and so much easier when your tired. I also took advantage of the spa and had a great massage. It’s nice to spoil yourself. If you haven’t been to SF, it is expensive. Everything is. If you don’t need a car, don’t bring one. Parking is not cheap. However the in/out valet parking at The Fairmont is cheaper than other Nob Hill hotels. The in/out privilege means you won’t pay extra to actually use your car. You can rent a car for a day trip at the hotel or off Union Square for less than the price to park one. Cabs are generally available and reasonable but they can be hard catch away from the hotel district and slow to come when you call. You can reserved a Town Car though several services (like Quicksilver or Ubercar) for not much more than a cab and you have a guaranteed ride in style. Also get a Munipass so you don’t pay $6 each time you ride the cable cars. You can catch all 3 cable car lines at The Fairmont, the only place in town they all cross. Take the California Cable Car down to the Ferry Building (the view is incredible) to shop and the catch the F line trolley to Fisherman’s Wharf or to the Castro. Location is so important when you travel; The Fairmont is close to everything. The Fairmont is beautiful grand hotel from a different time where the staff takes pride in this grand icon of San Francisco and the privilege of working there. In a nutshell, I had a perfect stay, loved it and can’t wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Small room”
Reviews.Author: DLBroyles
Reviews.Content: Room was small but had everything you could need. View was disappointing as it was of lobby roof and windows of other bedrooms. Lobby and other common areas of the hotel were beautiful and kept up really well. There is also an outdoor space on the second floor that has great views of the city and is a beautifully landscaped area to take a walk and enjoy the city. Ate at the Tonga Room downstairs and we had a great time. Atmosphere and food were great!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great for the $$.”
Reviews.Author: HKaidms
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 2 nights in the tower suites with city facing views. Paid approximately $300 per night NOT including daily parking fee....I'll get to that. Overall it was a pleasant enough stay. The location was great. The lobby was beautiful. My check in was fast and easy. We got there very early and feared we wouldn't be able to check in for a few hours but they let us get our room at 11am. I think this exception was made bc I signed up for the "President Members" program or whatever it's called before my trip (it's free -do it if you are planning on staying at a Fairmont Hotel). My room wasn't as big as I thought it would be but according to seasoned San Fran travelers the Fairmont has some of the bigger rooms in the city. Even so, felt a tad cramped but this wasn't a big deal. Grief #1 - we had dinner reservations in town first night and needed a cab to take us there. Got down to lobby 20 minutes prior to reservation. It took the doorman exactly 20 minutes to get us a cab. A lined approximately 16 people deep formed (and I was close to the front of this line) and the Fairmont staff failed to get additional doormen or staff to assist the mounting line in getting their transportation. For a hotel with this type of service reputation I would assume management would act to triage the situation such as this. Sadly, nothing was fixed and the lone doorman was left fighting to get guests cars from the parking lot, greet arriving and returning guests as well as trying to flag down Taxis all at the same time. Needless to say we were late for our dinner but gladly our reservation was still honored. Grief # 2 - my wife and I went to the Laurel Court bar for a pre dinner drink the second evening. Making sure we didn't make the same mistake as last time, we arrived in the lobby a full hour prior to our dinner reservations. Well, wouldn't you know it took about 15 minutes to even place our drink order. Mind you there were only 5 other patrons in the bar....total. Next, after we got our drinks it took another 20 minutes for our waiter to even check on us. By now we had to get our check. Thankfully the check arrived quickly. I guess they wanted us out of there rather than serve us. I would have had another drink had the waiters cared to check on us. But I guess they were pretty busy chatting to each other behind and around the bar instead. Oh well. Grief # 3 - this one I can't really complain about but I am including it here for your education. It will cost you about $60 per day including taxes. Thankfully I had done my research first but had I not it would be safe to say I would have been a bit upset. This parking fee is a tiny little footnote that is hard to discover when booking a room here at the Fairmont. All in all I would say that while nobody at The Fairmont was mean, quite the contrary actually, I would classify some aspects of the operation as unprofessional. You can have a winning personality and a never ending smile but when you fail to take care of a paying customer it's still unprofessional. My only staff compliment goes to the parking garage attendants who were extremely professional and helpful at every moment. I found myself calling upon them for my car and going straight down to the garage instead of the front because my car was always waiting and they always had great recommendations and were very helpful and prompt. Kudos to whomever manages that part of your hotel operation. Otherwise, I received service overall comparable to a Holiday Inn. Wish I had paid Holiday Inn prices. Im not a traveler who complains about costs otherwise inwould have added Greif # 4 to $80 breakfast pricetag for 2 at Laurel Court restuarant at the Fairmont (i get over it bc it's an "upscale" hotel). But i do expect a certain level of professionalism to accompany the costs rather than just everyone being so nice. But hey, the location is great and apparently the rooms are bigger than most other hotels....so I've been told.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ThatGirl_77627
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at The Fairmont... The hotel was beautiful and everyone was very helpful. We enjoyed the beautiful view from our room and we loved being able to walk the streets of San Francisco. Our room was very clean.. The Tonga room was great, but we didn't like that it took so long to get in and really didn't like that we had to pay for the band since we were staying at the hotel. Our only complaints were the cost for hotel parking -- we had to pay $54 a night, plus 14% gratuity and tax. I felt that was ridiculous. Also, paying gratuity on every meal at the hotel (for just my husband and myself) was a little much. We spent $74 on breakfast buffet for 2. In the future, we will check into things like this before making any decisions on hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel away from the bustle of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Trojan4Life
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the weekend before Valentine's Day for a little getaway. I usually stay closer to Union Square but decided to change things up and choose the hotel that Anthony Bourdain stayed and featured on his new show the Layover. The location of the Fairmont Hotel is about 5 blocks from Union Square "up the hill" and about 3 blocks from Chinatown. Checking in was a breeze and the hotel was very elegant. The room was a good size considering it is in San Francisco. There are two main elevators to get to your room and was quick and efficient despite it only holding 10 people per ride. When I made reservations, I was given the option of "early check in" which was an additional $25. This allowed me to check in at 10am rather the regular 3 pm which I would recommend anyone visiting SF to do so. Unfortunately, being that this hotel is quite old and a lanmark, the plumbing seems like it was stuck in the 1920's. The bathroom in our room didn't flush very strongly and efficiently and resulted in it clogging up on our departure date. Nonetheless, I would recommend staying here if its for a special occasion and would like a good work-out walking to and from Union Square and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “NYE at the SF Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: YRP_21
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Fairmont! We actually got a great price and it really didn't disappoint! My wonderful hubby surprised me with tea time in the Laurel room, which is still my favorite tea time in San Francisco. The harp player wasn't there that day, but the food and tea was still amazing! Definitely nice for a nice romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved that I could open my windows, and it was quiet!”
Reviews.Author: SaraFV
Reviews.Content: There were also blocks so i couldnt open them far, I'm sure for safety reasons. My room was clean, although slightly worn rug and furniture. The bed bath linens were clean and in excellent condition. The room was an interior room, so it faced a courtyard, and it was not noisy, which was fabulous. Many locations' reviews had noise complaints. The service and dining, as always at the Fairmonts, was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service really lacking”
Reviews.Author: JLP1989
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were quite excited to stay at the Fairmont San Francisco. We have stayed at Fairmont hotels in Canada and have never been disappointed. However, i must say that the only good thing about this hotel is the lobby. The customer service was very poor in the restaurant and lounge. Our room was cozy, but had no view of anything because it was an inner room. The walls were paper thin - so thin we could hear exact conversations on the other side of the wall. We were especially disappointed that the room had no complimentary water or coffee or tea. When we had coffee in the Laurel Court Lounge we were charged $12 for two lattes and lousy service. I will never stay at this hotel again. Instead, when we head back to San Francisco, we will stay at one if the Hyatt hotels, which never disappoint! I think the Managment of this hotel could learn a thing or two from Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Dan R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best places I have ever stayed in. Service was great, no problems with a request for a late check out and really no problems at all. It is a pricy hotel, but in this case you get what you pay for. If you have a chance, check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AustinTraveler78759
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three night in February and just had a great visit. The valet, the front desk, the concierge and the operator were all very very helpful and upbeat. The room was fabulous with two queens and a great view of the Financial District and beyond to the East Bay. The concierge's dinner recommendations were spot on and not the usual chains, but smaller local venues. The only two suggestions I could have is to improve the personnel and facilities of the gym and also to have coffee available in the room. Two minor complaints that couldn't overshadow an otherwise perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice but old”
Reviews.Author: daya9
Reviews.Content: We were in Fairmont in February 2012 and had a room in the tower with a beautiful view on Alcatraz. We had paid 360 $ just for the room without breakfast. The location was not the best, it is not very central, it is on top of the hill, blocks away from union square. The Lobby is beautiful and was at one moment years back a 5 star hotel, but for the room rate the hotel was a bit old and needed some renovation. The breakfast for 30$ per person was not of a high quality. There is a cafe cintra in the hotel, where you can have better coffees and plain good bagels.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and perfect for san francisco”
Reviews.Author: indiantrotter
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with brilliant location. Nice spacious rooms with big bath area and a walk-in wardrobe! The staff was friendly and the reception is warm. Opt for the tower rooms if booking in advance and register for the Presidents club for complimentary internet access. I would recommend this hotel for business / leisure travellers to San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BRnurse
Reviews.Content: Great location and accomodations with beautiful view. If your thinking about staying somewhere else because it's cheaper, don't. I'll only stay here in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Fading Glory”
Reviews.Author: kazkey
Reviews.Content: The lobby is still magnificent and oozes history. The views of the Bay from the tower rooms are the best in SF. However, this is not an inexpensive place to stay and the service ranges from inattentive to downright incompetent. The bathroom was actually quite nice, but the room overall just felt sterile and a little past its prime, as did most of the hotel. Location is a posh neighborhood, but there really is not that much within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “As one would expect.....”
Reviews.Author: SandwedgeonRye
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference the night of January 19- outstanding desk staff, outstanding room and a panoramic view of SF from the BofA building to Civic Center. The only issue- the restaurant staff the following morning (several older gentlemen) assumed I'd have the breakfast buffet. When I ordered from the menu they seemed to be put out. Overall a very fine property.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: reesepieces2002
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our California vacation at the fantastic Fairmont. I am not a huge San Francisco fan because I find the city rather depressing when the weather is lousy (grey and cold in early Sept) and it's rather dirty with a lot of pan handlers, etc. So to return after a day of touring to the gorgeous lobby and peaceful room, was a real treat. I loved the sense of history and grandeur in the hotel. Everyone who worked there had a smile on their face and the service was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: fiona c
Reviews.Content: We loved our time in The Fairmount, we were on our honeymoon and when we checked in the guy behind reception was lovely and upgraded us!!! The view from our room was superb and our bed was huge and comfy. We did not eat in the hotel, but the lobby and overall the whole hotel we thought was lovely and clean. Would love to return to this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont SF: Classic history with great service and restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: oceanwine
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 10 plus hotels in San Francisco and I have to say this is one of my favorites. Its a great overall location on Nob Hill. This hotel has awesome doormen who valet and goes help with taxi's. The Fairmont is over 100 years old and just looks amazing inside, very cool lobby. On the weekdays this hotel hosts a lot of business conferences which I do not find as a bad thing for tourists. The only thing the hotel is missing for families is a swimming pool, but your in San Francisco with so much to do and its made up for with the Tonga room. The Tonga room has the best Tiki drinks this side of Hawaii. Kids with love the Tonga room as well has there a rain and a thunder storm. Check out the hotels website or see it for yourself, you will be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!!”
Reviews.Author: msfunk
Reviews.Content: I was in town for the football game and stayed at this beautiful hotel for a couple of days. Situated at the top of a hill and right next a trolley car route made this hotel not only attractive but convenient as well. Just head down the hill and you're at Union Square for shopping and dining. Our room was on a high floor in the new tower. We didn't have a view of the Golden Gate Bridge but it was nice just the same. The room was spacious and the bed was heavenly. The bathroom amenities were very nice and a great size too. Everything was clean and well cared for. The lobby was spectacular to say the least. The coffee shop was really good but far from the lobby. The Tonga Room Restaurant was closed so I didn't get to check it out. I heard it was pretty neat to see with a live band over the water! Overall this hotel is classic elegance. I fell in love with it the moment I walked into the ornate lobby. I will definately visit again!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful lobby but very thin walls- too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: ArtnLaura
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very expensive usually but we got a deal so decided to splurge. It is located on Nobb Hill, near all the action of down town shopping and great for walking most places if you like hiking (hills are steep and hard on knees). That being said, we were disappointed in the stay mostly because the walls were so thin that we heard music and talking in the room next door as well as talking in the hall all hours of the night, and sirens driving by the window in the am hours. For such a top rated (by trip advisor) hotel we expected better! Bedding was very nice except maids did not change sheets and we stayed for 3 days! We ate at the famed Tango Room for $100 plus dollars for 2 and didnt think that was anything special either.

Reviews.Title: “FIVE STAR”
Reviews.Author: Victoriaangel1
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in San Francisco. The service was unbelievable! What ever you want! If they don't have it.. They will get it! They aim to please. Loved staying here. Balcony rooms are beautiful and spacious!

Reviews.Title: “Another Tremendous Fairmont Experience!”
Reviews.Author: pickle07
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights with a friend for a quick blitz of San Francisco. We were expecting just to sleep there, but found the Laurel Court lounge most convenient to relax in. Bell Desk staff were so attentive upon check-in that we had no questions or other requests. Our room was spacious enough with a well appointed closet. The bed was AMAZING with clouds for pillows. We ordered in-room breakfast for nine AM one morning and it showed up at 9:00 AM. Greatly appreciated when anticipating that first cup of coffee! Location was great with easy access to cable car. Anthony Bourdain had recently reviewed the Tonga Room, so if you're planning on having dinner there, BOOK NOW! Unfortunately we didn't have time to wait in the line-up for a quick drink. No complaints regarding service, room or location! :)

Reviews.Title: “Historic property with great ambience”
Reviews.Author: anamcara1004
Reviews.Content: If you don't say, "Ooh!" then you first walk into the lobby, I would be very surprised. Very lush and opulent - I felt like I should have had a corset & a hat with a large plume. The service was tremendous and my room was quite lovely. Spacious with enough room to work. I slept pretty well too. I think the main things to keep in mind with The Fairmont is that the views are unparalleled being that it is at the top of Nob Hill. And that you better be in pretty good shape if you don't want to take a taxi everywhere. I walked up and down Nob Hill, am in average shape and both were strenuous. Down strenuous to not fall over; up b/c it has to be close to a 45 degree angle. I had to take short breaks after every two blocks going up (on the steepest sections). That being said, there are always taxis around. I didn't try any of the in-house dining or spa, unfortunately so I can't speak to those. But overall, I had a very nice visit and I'd love to stay there again and try more of the in-house amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, lives up to the 'Snob Hill' jibes”
Reviews.Author: C G
Reviews.Content: The 5th and final hotel on a 2-week California roadtrip. Meant to be a luxurious end to our stay, but it was the biggest disappointment of the trip. Not outright bad, just a big disappointment. Firstly, we were greeted by a very rude valet parker. I prefer to self-park, not just a cost thing, but I still have all my faculties, so am capable of parking my car myself, plus I prefer the convenience of self-parking - come and go as you please. At the Fairmont, it's valet parking only, at the cost of $62 per day (the most expensive in the neighbourhood). At least they don't charge extra for the greeting we received from the valet - the rudeness comes for free! When we checked in, they didn't have the room we expected. When we had booked 6 months earlier and enquired about a family room, we were told to book a twin, which would have 2 queen beds, so would be OK if our 2 daughters were happy to share a queen bed. When we arrived, the receptionist said that not all twins had 2 queens, some had much narrower beds and this was all they could offer us. We requested a more suitable room, but we waited so long with no word that we gave up and headed out to explore Union Square (we only had limited time in San Francisco). By the time we came back that evening, it was too late to move rooms, so we accepted the solution of a rollaway bed for one of our daughters and stayed in the same room. Big mistake, as the guy in the adjoining room kept us up all night. The following morning, I spoke to the old guy at the concierge desk (reception was busy with checkouts), who promised to sort things out while we were out sightseeing - by arranging another room and/or speaking to the noisy neighbour - but when we returned that evening, nothing had happened, the front desk was completely unaware of our complaint. We persuaded them to arrange another room for us but, when we walked in to the room, there was a lady already there, just beginning to unpack her luggage! So back to square one. Throughout this, the front desk manager was determined not to give us a room that was in any way better than what we already had, which was why our options were so limited. It was only when I started to cause a scene - as my frustrations finally boiled over - that she at last found us a suitable room, this time in the tower. The room was ba lot smaller than our previous room, but much less tired, with 2 queen beds and with no noisy neighbours. So after more than a day of frustration, we at last had the level of room we thought we'd booked. At this point, the front desk manager suddenly became friendly and offered us something by way of apology, such as a bottle of wine. This wasn't really our priority, but she told us to think about it and let her know. The next day, we returned from our Alcatraz trip (and climb up Nob Hill) in need of refreshment. Therefore, instead of an expensive bottle of wine, we just asked reception for a pot of tea and a couple of cookies for our daughters. The manager from the previous day was not around and had not told her colleagues about the offer of apology, so the guy on the front desk was reluctant to help us. When he did eventually agree to send a pot of tea to our room, it took over an hour, because he forgot to tell the room service people. So any goodwill that this small gesture of apology should have generated was lost. We have stayed at many 5-star hotels and the staff usually make us feel like kings. Here, they made us feel like dirt, so we began to understand the 'Snob Hill' jokes of the tour guides. None of our complaints were treated seriously until I lost my cool, and I shouldn't have to do that on holiday. Nothing was ever passed from one member of staff to another, the communication was just dreadful. I would recommend sending the staff to some of the top Asian hotels, then they would really know the meaning of customer service. Now for the positives: (i) great location, if you like walking, it's 30 minutes to Fisherman's Wharf (at least with children), around 15 minutes to Union Square and convenient for the Hyde-Powell cable car; (ii) great views if you're in the right rooms; (iii) tower rooms a bit newer than the older wing; (iv) even if the rest of the hotel is tired, the lobby is very nice, especially at Christmas time.

Reviews.Title: “nice surroundings but annoying fan system”
Reviews.Author: KarlOA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Calcuta suite - beautiful but the noise from the internal fan system was extremely annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive lobby interiors if you're into old world gilded architecture”
Reviews.Author: IceQueen2013
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in is average for the price. It is gilded with gold curtain rods, gold curtains, marble floors in the bathroom. But basically it smelled old, and just slightly creaky. The building outside is impressive but the interiors are a bit dated. If you like golden age design, then this place is for you. Otherwise, pass it up. We prefer modern interiors, so we were not impressed. The service however, is 5 star. So also expect to pay 5 star. Valet @ $60++, but worth considering the uphill walks to the hotel from every street that leads to it. It really is at the top of Nob Hill. Impressive views of the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, friendly people.”
Reviews.Author: Sators
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are very friendly and welcoming. The rooms and accommodations are top notch and simply makes this hotel a worry free relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a View!”
Reviews.Author: chalessa
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. I didn't know what to expect when I booked an over night stay in the city. Walking into through revolving door was like something out of a movie set! The furniture in the lobby was beautifully arranged and the decor is fabulous. I was greated several times before getting to the front desk to get my room key for the 24th floor. Loved the it had a second bank of elevators and even the view from the hallway was fab! The room was almost royal, with plush bedding and a large window view of the San Fran skyline. Though the price point is a bit expensive (it got a Groupon deal), it is trully worth the stay. I also found out that the Bachelor filmed one of its episodes there!

Reviews.Title: “All of the luxury you would expect at a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KiwiExplorer87
Reviews.Content: Great service, great food, brilliant xmas decorations and perfect location in the heart of a beautiful city. Couldn't fault a thing, enjoyed the gym etc

Reviews.Title: “An Awe-Inspiring Picture of Historic San Francisco !”
Reviews.Author: MukeshSurabhi
Reviews.Content: " The grandeur of the hotel coupled with its reputation for impeccable service promises a truly memorable experience. " This is what is quoted in Fairmont Hotels website, and i vouch for every word they have said on their property and it is such a delight of having stayed there and celebrated in a city of SFO a romantic saga for our 11th WEDDING ANNIVERSARY which was taken care of by the Hotel with a lovely champagne and choco diped strawberries.......... Still watering in my mouth and the savories they served was amazing. Be it the location, Service, Value, and updated rooms with all modern facilities while keeping the old charm of Historic outlook. its perfect place to stay in SFO and experience the goodness of its glory charm and there is no excuse of poor standards. would love to come back and stay again and would not even bother for surfing for other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: HobokenGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: On a recent November stay at the Fairmont we were upgraded to the Crocker Suite. Wow! The living room was spacious, elegant and very comfortable with phenomenal views of Alcatraz and the bay; the vintage-looking telescope was a fun touch; you could zoom in on the boats on the bay. The bedroom was nicely put together in tranquil colors with a huge picture window, king bed, all the necessary amenities and plenty of closet space. The only – minor – downside was the bathroom. It was very large but it lacked vanity and counter space so it was a little awkward for two people to share. We set up the ironing board at one end of the bathroom and used that to store some of our things. Service at the Fairmont was excellent. The lobby lounge bar was a nice place to meet friends for a drink and the Tonga Room was a hoot with funky tropical décor and a rainstorm. The terrace on the lobby level is a lovely oasis in the city. If you can handle the hills, the location is great for walkers otherwise the cable car or a taxi will get you up and down the hill. All in all a great choice in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury. Good location, great views. Definately you get what you pay for.”
