Reviews.Author: Boysalsa
Reviews.Content: Right at the top of the hill, but only a few blocks from Union Square and great shopping. The rooms were great with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Bathrooms included separate shower and bath. Room had a desk and amazing view if the city. Staff were great and helpful. I was there as part of a conference and the food we had was very good even when catering for a lot of people. If you are staying there, it's worth getting a travel pass for the trolly's as it's a steep walk from union square, but a great location to explore from. The Tonga Room is a must visit with great entertainments and drinks, even if our not staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: ggke
Reviews.Content: As expected, a good location to walk down to Union Square, or take any cable car. The main building is a bit dated, but the tower is a bit newer. Our family of four with two young daughters stayed four nights. The downside is that there is no pool. Also, parking is a bit pricey, so we returned the rental car and took taxis when necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Needs cleaning”
Reviews.Author: dramdavies
Reviews.Content: While the Hotel still does have a faded glory charm, there is absolutely no excuse for poor standards of cleanliness in any hotel, certainly not a premier priced hotel such as the Fairmont. The amount of dust on the baseboards is spectacular (do not look behind the beds, it is too scary), the soap scum collected in the sink moulding was impressive as was the interesting collection of life under the rim in the sink. This is not acceptable in any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chilly San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Canada209
Reviews.Content: We traveled in august to San Francisco and were greeted by very chilly weather with strong wind and foggy days. It did clear out eventually and we enjoyed the city but we really loved this hotel. It is one of the most beautiful hotels we ever stayed in and true to the old fashioned Fairmont style. The lobby is magnificent, the rooms are beautiful and the view of the harbor breathtaking. We had the buffet breakfast in the morning, which was lovely but expensive. All in all we loved the hotel and it's location. We would not hesitate to come back and love the whole Fairmont chain. All the hotels we stayed in are worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “An 'old dame' still holding up atop Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: RKT163
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights there recently over the New Year into 2012, with room assigned in the original (old) wing and glad I was there. High ceiling and extra wide hallway for sense of space and originality apart from today's contemporary but often squeezed hotel layout. Spacious 'double double' room with deep, rectangular walk-in closet 'room' for your luggage and hangers good for a year's clothing! On 5th floor yet literally overlooking Nob Hill. Very efficient, good and friendly (not because they were pretentious) FO / Concierge staff service . However, beware of the electronically controlled minibar and the 'extras' placed in a e-controlled tray next to the TV. It is neither kid-friendly nor adult-frinedly in sense that kids attracted to that or accidentally knocking off items sitting in that tray will end up having parents paying for it and will for sure get a lecture or penalty of sorts from the paying parents - once item is off from the tray base for minutes, the item charge will automatically be billed to the room even if you put it back later on (after x no. of minutes nothing will help reverse that not unless you reason with and prove it to the front desk that the original package still exists intact). I asked HSKP to remove that tray without success / action response. Vanity counter far too small for a luxury hotel. Could not have renovated to include a separate shower. Bedding into wobbling state as apparently far too many heavyweights have been sleeping in those beds over the years without hope of a replacement mattress. Like many hotels in the U.S. but particularly those in SF and LA, they appear to be either ignorant or "couldn't-care-less" about Asian travelers / customers as nothing in this hotel or similar class reflect any measure of thought to Asian guests needs especially the menus anywhere in the hotel. Otherwise, a comfortable experience in a great location though one must be prepared to walk some steep slopes up and/or down for those mere few blocks to the city centre core where a world of fascinating shopping, dine-outs and attractions await!!

Reviews.Title: “Beuatiful building but rooms need a little work”
Reviews.Author: Adam C
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful old building with great views from the high floors that face externally. My room was nice but had that smell that old places do sometimes. Also, the toilet seat in my room looked like it was 100 years old (peeling, scratches, discoloration). I would have expected better from a Fairmont. When I called to complain, the person on the phone seemed sort of put out and never apologized. It was replaced the same day though. Otherwise, the service in the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: malibugypsy
Reviews.Content: My favorite part of staying here is always the view of the bay from the 23rd floor. Some friends visited us, we had tea downstairs and then just sat for hours in our room watching the fog roll in, the hawks flying below us, chinatown lighting up as evening fell. it was Christmas, there was a gingerbread house big enough to walk in in the lobby, including a working train. The beds are divine, the toiletries are the best, the location is great. Just be sure to ask for that bay view.

Reviews.Title: “another great experience at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: bubuNewyork
Reviews.Content: My family loves the Fairmont hotels. We stayed in their hotels in Banff, Bermuda and now SF. In SF we stayed 3 nights over Thanksgiving break. It is one of the few hotels that gives you connecting rooms (not 100% guarantee but 99%), which for us is a must because we have 2 children under 11. This time it didn't work out that well the first night... BUT to their credit, starting the 2nd night and for the rest of our stay, they upgraded us into a suite for free. That is a great customer service! The location is very central, service and breakfast are very good, the view from the rooms is fantastic. I also love the "old style" interior decoration. Their restaurant tonga has great food and is very kids friendly (decor, service & music)

Reviews.Title: “Classic Fairmont, location not that good”
Reviews.Author: MrSharma
Reviews.Content: - Stayed for 14 nights - Good, clean room - Good view of the bay from the room - Located somewhat away from Union Square, Market Street - Close to Chinatown (walkable, though it's a climb back) - Free WiFi with a membership of the Fairmont President's Club

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont San Francisco - Fabulous in everyway”
Reviews.Author: Juanita46
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at The Fairmont San Francisco this past November. What a beautiful place to stay, with great service from everyone. This hotel is situated on top of a hill, that is no surprise as San Fran is full of "top of the hill" views. They were building their gingerbread house during our stay-amazing. The grand staircase was stunning. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Concierge staff went beyond what was expected of them. China Town, Union Square, great shopping, North Beach restaurants are all within walking distance. Would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to San Francisco. Most enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classic service in a beautiful old style hotel”
Reviews.Author: aphillips61
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Fairmont for the last 4 years and definitely find it extraordinarily good. We do have our perks as members of the President's Club but the service and attention are still well worth the price. Breakfast is wonderful and the rooms are just perfect with all the goodies one would like such as current films on demand which makes staying in on the evenings and watching a good film just great. In addition, the location is super, just atop Nob Hill. We love it and shall consistently return.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Charm”
Reviews.Author: richterradical
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed with another couple at the Fairmont for NYE 2012. The hotel had everything you could ask for with the service to match. Black tie to casual jeans cruising the lobby and shops. We stayed in the balcony suite which was fantastic and really made our trip. They put our friends next to us essentially turning our room into a 2 bedroom suite. the balcony is huge with incredible city views and staying in was almost as desirable as going out. Tried Tonga Room but it was too busy and they are reservation sticklers, not too into that place. If with your parents or family it's a great, lively diner. If with friends, head out to the city and soak it up.The old rooms were part of the charm.

Reviews.Title: “Good views and old world charm!”
Reviews.Author: Maverick013
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Fairmont for 3 nights on 3 week summer trip in the states. When looking at the Hotels I found it very difficult to choose in San Fran, so I went with the Fairmont for the views as it was my wife's birthday that weekend and cannot go wrong with a good view for a special occasion. Well the good views of the bay are specific to the room you choose, (see room recommendation) I would recommend this Tower signature suite as it is a good size and had a fabulous bay view. Things to consider with the Fairmont are that is not ultra luxurious in terms of modern terms but is more of a grand dame, and has lots old world charm. I have read that some people say the large hallways are spooky but I think it gives the hotel all it's charm and if you realise this at the time of booking you cannot go wrong with this hotel. Housekeeping was great noticed no problems during our stay. We valet parked our car which is expensive at $50 a day but that is consistent with other hotels in San Fran, that said the valet staff were excellent and very helpful. We were still on UK time zones so I did coffee runs each morning to the onsite illy coffee store which is great and very convenient. Is located on on a very steep hill which is very pleasant to walk down but going up could be a problem for some. Has a tram stop right outside the coffee shop at the one corner of the building which is very convenient and should negate the need to walk up the hill as the trams are really great. Book here if you are looking to be removed from the hustle, also if you are are not on tight touring deadlines. Also do not expect all the new bells and whistles expected newer 5-4 star hotels. Join Fairmont programme for free wifi and possible upgrades. I will be returning soon already booked for June 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, VERY CLEAN, STAFF VERY HELPFUL CLOSE TO CHINA TOWN UNION SQUARE,”
Reviews.Author: iritb
Reviews.Content: Best location, very clean, staff very helpful, booked trips with them, concierge is great, close to China town, union square, and shopping, rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Haka C
Reviews.Content: At a hotel of this supposed caliber, guests should expect a certain level of amenities and services. I was shocked to find that the fitness center in a hotel with 20+ floors and hundreds of rooms, is not complimentary to guests. When I asked the front desk staff and concierge how this could be possible, they explained the fitness center is outsourced. It's obvious the staff in the hotel could care less as they say they get this complaint often. I would not recommend this hotel to any business traveler. The hotel is suitable for families with children (who are constantly running and screaming in the lobby all day and night). You cannot find a respite in this corporate hotel with a thin veneer of polish from a century ago.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...treated like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: traveljack1
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for NYE 2010 and had a wonderful time. We were exhausted upon our arrival due to the time change from EST to Pacific. We arrived during the late morning for check in and as President Club members we were treated like royalty. The bellman had already moved our bags to our room and suggested we stop at the concierge desk to find a place for dim-sum as we were starving. We stopped at the room to change clothes and left for dim-sum. I cant remember the name of the restaurant, but left stuffed to the gills and very impressed by the outta the way place that did offer dimsum and drinks right on the edge of Chinatown. As a matter of fact the Concierge(the very experienced one with the gold keys) was phenomenal. He was never short on great suggestions for dimsum, french pastries early in the morning or just an umbrella for my long walk through to Pacific Heights! The hotel was still decked out from the Christmas week with the Gingerbread house and entrance to the restaurant was gorgeous as was the rest of the hotel. Additionally, and even more fun was watching the house staff deconstruct the candy and cookie house on New Years Day! It was akin to watching construction and heavy equipment. Just chilled in the lobby and that was nice for quite a while. We also decided to be treated like queens on New Years Day and decided to get room service. The service was great and the food was too! Room walls were surprisingly thin so we got an earful of someone elses romantic evening, but otherwise hotel is gorgeously decked out for the holidays and as Presidents club members they rolled out the red carpet! Would stay again as room was spacious, comfortable, and with a great view at the top of the hill of the bay and the GG bridge. thanks SF Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “A Christmas treat”
Reviews.Author: KingsMountaineer
Reviews.Content: We came for one night after seeing the Messiah at nearby Grace Cathedral. The lobby was beautifully decked out for Xmas with a huge, two story gingerbread house, a glorious (though fake) tree, and nice lights over the reception area. It had a lovely holiday feel. The halls were decorated with pictures of celebrities who had stayed at the Fairmont--they were fun to look at although a bit reminiscent of The Shining. We were placed in a room on the 18th floor that was large, comfy and clean. On the down side, the bar service was slow and we were also disappointed that there was no bar food available after 10:00 when the concert was over. We were fortunate to have had spectacular sunrises and sunsets that made the room particularly romantic--I guess the Fairmont can't promise that to all customers.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be a bit more customer sensitive”
Reviews.Author: Damichan
Reviews.Content: I just don't get hotels like this. We were a party of five and arrived after a flight from DC at 11.15. We were informed that the bar had closed and that if we wanted a beer we had to use our mini bars in the rooms. We were told there was a bar open three blocks away. The barman was still there but simply refused to serve us. Eventually we managed to get someone to serve us as a group in the lobby on room service. The rooms did not have any coffee making facilities. In my world, a hotel of this assumed international calibre serves its customer needs by keeping the bar open for their use and by providing coffee making facilities. What is even more galling is that they were very proud of a huge gingerbread Xmas decoration, the cost of which could have probably paid for the additional wages for the barman for a year.

Reviews.Title: “Near Union Square-Away From the Hustle & Bustle”
Reviews.Author: Susan D
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont in Nob Hill is close enough to walk to Union Square or, if the hills are not your thing, to take a short cablecar ride there. Nob Hill is historic and feels like a neighbourhood where locals live. It's near enough to the shopping and restaurants in Union Square, but removed enough so that you don't encounter the noise, people traffic and bustle of downtown. There are churches, parks, historic buildings, and neighbourhood haunts to explore. There is also a historic pay-what-you-can guided walking tour that starts outside of the Renaissance and ends at the Fairmont itself. It's informative and gets you to look up and around the neighbourhood. The Fairmont is grand, without feeling cold, austere or trendy. Stay in the North Tower if you have a choice of rooms. I asked for a complementary upgrade as a loyalty program member, and graciously received an upgrade to the North Tower after sending out good vibes and a warm smile or two. The rooms look out onto the rooftop garden. I saw a wedding there my first afternoon. There is a business centre in the main building with computers and printers, but nothing extensive. You can print out your boarding pass and surf the 'Net, which is enough for most travellers' needs. I didn't visit the restaurants, although I did walk by. There is a gym, which looked small but adequate. I definitely suggest signing up for the loyalty program, as you'll see benefits such as free WiFi, complementary newspaper, and the ability to "rent" workout gear during your stay. There is a little Italian bistro within walking distance (I forget the name, but a concierge may be able to help) and a great little breakfast place that serves sandwiches right across from the cablecar museum (a slight walk down a steep hill near Chinatown). There is also a coffee shop right around the corner at the cablecar stop that serves Illy coffee/pastries. I took the cablecar from Union Square to the hotel upon arrival, but chose to walk to/from Union Square during my stay. In terms of noise, I've stayed in the Financial District, SoMa and Nob Hill. For my own preferences, I like Nob Hill because it's removed from the activity of Union Square. The Financial District is good for restaurants, but can be a bit of a hike to Union Square for the shopping. SoMa is very close to the activity, although some streets require attention to your surroundings. The Fairmont staff at reception were effective, knowledgeable and quick with the check-in/out, if not a bit cool. However, I had no problems and found the housekeeping, front desk and other staff kept the atmosphere feeling clean, safe and well run. I've stayed at The Westin in SoMa, The Grand Hyatt in the Financial District, and Le Meridien in the Financial District. Although the overall cost of air/hotel dictates where I stay, if price were not a factor, I'd choose The Fairmont hands down. I didn't rent a car, but understand that valet parking in general is expensive and the Fairmont is no exception in that respect. However, if you're not renting a vehicle, public transit and walking are very good alternatives. You can take the BART from their airport straight into Union Square, then take the cablecar right to the Fairmont's front steps. I suggest walking up 1 stop from the cablecar turnaround at Union Square because the line up oftentimes snakes up the block. The drivers only fill up the car 3/4 at that stop so that they can continue to pick up passengers along their route. If you walk up at least 1 stop, you have a chance of getting on. It didn't hurt to look a bit in need of mercy while holding my travel-sized backpack. :) Nob Hill is very safe at all times throughout the day. Union Square is fine when you are aware of your surroundings and follow your gut. You may encounter very obvious signs of homelessness throughout Union Square, with one street seeming fine and the very next one sending off red flags to avoid it. Like any big city, be aware and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel.....convenient yet quiet.”
Reviews.Author: MrLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: Although I'd lived in the SF Bay area for many years before, this was the first time I'd actually stayed downtown for more than a day; 3 nights at the Fairmont. I'd done a great deal of reading up on the different hotels downtown that would be convenient for me to get around, yet quiet enough to get some sleep at night. I'd read many other reviews about guests being woken up or kept awake in the middle of night due to the homeless yelling, people partying and getting drunk, traffic, etc. which got me a bit worried. Not so at the Fairmont! Nob Hill is a beautiful area and the Fairmont is a large and very grand old historical landmark hotel. What amazed me during my nights there was the total silence....I truly slept like a baby!....I'd also add that the incredibly comfortable beds, sheets, and pillows made it doubly wonderful! I stayed in a Tower room can say that they keep the place very clean and well maintained. I never had time to check out the gym, but I heard it was off site, which is a bit of a negative for me. I don't think there's a pool either. What I liked is it's location....far enough from the hustle and bustle, but close enough to walk to Union Sq. or Chinatown. I actually enjoyed the walk, but trekking back up the pretty steep hill may be a bit of an exercise for some. Then again, the trolley is right outside and there are plenty of cabs waiting, so it's very convenient. Talking about the trolley....this may be the first thing you hear in the early morning that may wake you up, but it's not that bad. Be careful of the little cafe (Cento?) located on the Powell St. side of the hotel. Yummy pastries, teas, and coffees.....thank goodness for the steep hills you can work it all off later! Since this was my first hotel I'd ever stayed at in the downtown SF area, I can't say that I'll be back right away as I'd like to try others too, but it's definitely on my KIV list.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an update”
Reviews.Author: Lauren502
Reviews.Content: The lobby area of the hotel was nice, but that's where it ends. My room was small and I am pretty convinced it used to be some type of storage closet. When I went in other rooms of the exact same type, they were much larger than the one I was given. The TV was all the way to the left of the room and not even close to being in front of the bed. The decor was dated and dark. The shower was so powerful that half of the water ended up all over the bathroom floor. I've never seen anything like that. Lastly, the ballroom we were working in must have been next to all of the garbage for the entire hotel because it smelled like trash in there. The Tonga Room in the basement is a site to see. It is cheesy, but really neat. Also, we had a chance to go up to the penthouse. It was amazing and the views were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: 298Lolita
Reviews.Content: I have always loved the Fairmont during Christmas time .I have been going here since I was a kid.so for a rare overnight getaway from the kids we of choose the Fairmont. We came on a weekday and the crowd was perfect and not too busy. As always the lobby was decorated beautifully.The gingerbread house and the traditional huge Christmas tree were spectacular. Upon check in we decided to get an upgrade for a room w/a view .The total came to almost $550 w/tax. The room was spacious,bathroom had a beautiful tub and the panoramic view was to die for. Just a couple problems.. We did notice that an electrical outlet cover was broken and half of the plastic was missing. Just a little eyesore and so simple to replace but no big deal. We then opened up the refrigerator/honor bar and noticed that the previous guest had left behind some half eaten fruit in a ziplock bag (which was stuffed on top of the canned nuts) not very appetizing to say the least. There was also crumbs left inside the cabinet. On our way down to dinner we let the receptionist know and she apologized and said it would be cleaned immediately. Ok great . We returned several hours later after having wonderful dinner downtown Our room at night was lit up by the beautiful city. lights and was truly breathtaking. My husband once again decided to go in the honor bar there it was ...the old bag of fruit. Yuk! housekeeping never came to dispose of it.I understand housekeeping can miss something but to not fix the problem is not acceptable. Did housekeeping even get the call from the front desk?? They never did come to clean it up and after complaining again at check out we were told sorry again . A little too late .I sent off a note to the management and have yet to hear back. I expect a little more from The Fairmont. To walk into my room and for the room to be clean and if there's a problem I expect to have it addressed.Too bad our memory of that beautiful room w/a view is clouded by the memory of the rotting leftover fruit in the fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: Neeta T
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at The Fairmont Hotel, and no doubt it's a breathtaking building, almost like living in a castle! They'd also really done a great job on decorating for the holidays! I ordered the Spa Breakfast my last morning there and LOVED IT! I wish I could go back just for that! Last thing I loved was being able to brag that Obama had stayed at the same hotel! What I didn't love? They didn't have coffee in the room? I was really surprised to experience that. I can't remember the last time I've stayed at ANY hotel where there was no coffee service in the room. Also, the free wi-fi didn't work, which was annoying since I was pressed for time, and wanted to upload some docs for work before running out the door and couldn't. Lastly, while it's an impressive structure, it will take you about 10 minutes to walk out the front door of this hotel, since there's no exit from Tower 2, where I was staying, directly to the street. You have to go back to the main building and exit through the main entrance, which is kind of annoying.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: LB879
Reviews.Content: Always.i come here every six moths and always the bets experience, so far. One only complain. Room 552 has the bathroom which is really cold!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room!”
Reviews.Author: ocean35
Reviews.Content: Excellent! Stayed here two nights for work. Fantastic lobby, nicely decorated for Christmas. Corner room on the 16 floor with view of the bay. President's club members get treated nicely. Very nice Fairmont quality bathroom with separate shower. Did not eat here at all, so can't comment on that. It's a hike to Union square, but doable and fun at night after a day of long meetings. Like always, the missing coffeemaker is the only let down.

Reviews.Title: “LAST PORT OF CALL ON WORLD TOUR.”
Reviews.Author: Burton595
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as our last port of call on our world tour and we were not dissapointed. Lovely grand approach to the reception, especially impressive this time of year with Christmas decorations.Good rooms in old part of hotel, although restaurant did lack some atmosphere. Staff a little distant, did not expect that of America. Location of hotel not for the faint hearted if walking is a problem, its at the top of Nobb Hill which is very steep!, you have to rely on Cable Car or Taxi, excellent views. Food and drink expensive, especially in rooms. Good all round hotel for short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Eddiem5
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Fairmont.. It was for my wife's 50th and we took the kids.. The location is just wonderful, near cable car lines, China Town, Union Square, etc... The food was great, the room service on time and hot, hot and the bell service was just great... Would stay here again for sure...

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: teinegirl
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is wonderful. The lobby was absolutely beautiful with all the Christmas decorations. Checking in was a breeze and even though we checked in early, our room was ready. Our room was in the tower and very spacious. We stayed here five years ago and if anything, it has gotten better. The service throughout is top notch. The breakfast was so good that we ate there every morning. That is really something for me as I usually just have coffee and maybe some cereal. The Fairmont made our three-day stay a pleasure. By the way, they are dog friendly. I'll remember that on our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: iscreenwriter
Reviews.Content: Opened an SF branch for my business and chose to make this hotel my home. Great lobby, gift shop is perfect for last minute items. Rooms are nice and beds are very comfortable. Not to mention best views in the city! Can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Home in SF”
Reviews.Author: Murphntuck
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Gift shop and great lobby. Best view in the city

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Hotel in San Francisco Just OK”
Reviews.Author: marlene616
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs an overview. It used to be beautiful, and wonderful hotel, but the last few years have really changed it. It really needs to be re-done. The rooms are old and smelly, and the lobby is just old and not attractive. The staircase is still beautiful but thats about it. There are not toiletries in the rooms like tooth paste, You need to get in touch with the Concierge. They have a pleasant roof garden, and pretty views. You need to take a cab to the shopping areas, its too far to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alohacraig
Reviews.Content: I stay at this legendary hotel at least once a year. This is my favorite hotel in SF. Nob Hill location great suites and a outstanding sfaff. Make sure you you have the Pancakes Oscar in the morning.... They are the best....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a real San Francisco landmark”
Reviews.Author: TheAviatorUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont for a business meeting in November 2011. When in San Francisco previously I have usually stayed at one of the Fisherman's Wharf hotels but decided on this occasion to try something different. The first thing that hits you is the lobby- extremely grand. Check in was fast, friendly and efficient. My room was huge - on the corner of the 3rd floor with views out on two sides, towards the Bay and the city. It had two king sized beds, a walk-in wardrobe bigger than some hotel rooms I've stayed in and was spotlessly clean. Even better, it had an iron / ironing board (a personal gripe of mine is when hotels refuse to lend you one for "safety reasons" but will happily rip you off for ironing). When wanting to book a restaurant via the concierge, the guy at check- in spotted I'd been waiting for a while, called me over and did it himself. Great service. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel when staying in San Fran, but be prepared for a fair walk down what felt like a vertical street to get to the city centre....

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tatyana Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel three nights in the end of August. We drove to SF from San Diego, so it had been a long trip and Fairmont was our final destination. Before coming to the hotel, we dropped a rental car at the SF airport and took a cab to the hotel. When we arrived and got out of the car, we were told byb the concierge that he will get our bags from the cab and would bring them to our room. In half an hour or so the concierge brought our bags, and half an hour later I noticed that two bags were missing. One bag had our evening outfits (dress, suit, shirts, etc), and the other bag had all toileteries. We immediately ran downstairs and informed the concierge that we were missing two bags and he said that they will need to watch a video tape to find out what cab company we used and to identify a cab. We sat in the lobby for an hour hoping that they will find our bags, but noone came to us. We asked a for a manager, but he was unaware of our situation, so we had to repeat what happened. Each time we asked about a status of our lost bags, they were not aware, as if Fairmont staff doesn't communicate to each other. It was already late evening, no bags, we were tired, and the hotel staff didn't even offer us ANY toiletries - we had no tooth brush, no tooth paste, soaps, flosses, perfumes - all was gone. Only after I approached a concierge (1000's time) and almost broke in tears he brought some toothbrushes and toothpastes. Whatever... Note: NOONE yet apologized to us, nor anyone was updating us of their search results. The next morning we had a planned trip to Alcatraz - imagine that we were in a terrible mood. By that time we already told the staff approximate name of the cab that brought us, but they kept telling us that they were investigating. Apparenttly, the video tape was blurry so they could not see clearly the cab number (what is the purpose of such video tape then??). However, at least they could see how many pieces of luggage were taken out of the cab trunk - which proved that we weren't lying. But their favorite version was that we forgot the bags in a rental car. I clearly remebered checking that we didn;t leave anything behind when we dropped a car in the airport. We tried to reach that cab company but without success, as it was just hard to find a person to talk to at the cab company. In the early afternoon we didn't hear back from them yet (!!) and my husband called and insisted on speaking with a head of Fairmont security. He told him about everything (again). Security guy said that he would look into it. When we came back into the hotel - around 2-3 pm, noone told us anything again, I bumbed into a concierge who left our bags in the cab - not even a sight of apology - "I understand mam...We are doing doing everythiong we can...". Happy end: when I finally decided to go shopping for a dress, because we were going to a wedding next day, and got in a cab, I got a phone call from security informing me that they found these bags. When I picked them up I was told that a cab brought them back (apparently hotel had nothing to do with finding these bags). I was sooo happy to get my staff back that I didn't even say anything, but later we realized that NOONE apologized or offered anything complimentary (at least a free drink - as a token of apology) to us. NEVER again I would stay in this hotel. If anything like this happens, you feel humuliated because you almost have to beg for their attention, everything is "high road". I understand that staff happens, but it is just soo hard to deal with people who does not accept their responsibilities. It also tought me a lesson that we should not trust anyone with my things! You agree, that it contradicts with the hotel reputation if you refuse the help of the concierge and bring your own bags to your room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: aunteenie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location for a conference in February 2011. During my stay, I found nothing exemplary about the property or the staff, but it was on my last night that the Fairmont's true colors really showed. At about 7:00p, I left for dinner and could hear a dog barking in an adjacent room. When I returned from dinner at 10:00, the dog was still barking. At 11:00, I called the front desk and they answered the phone, "Are you calling about the dog?" I explained that I was and that I could only assume that the dog had been barking for 4 hours. At 11:30, I heard loud banging in the hallway. I peeked out my door to find the hotel staff pounding on the door fo the room where the dog was. Freaking ridiculous. It was maybe 30 more minutes before the staff decided to remove the dog from the room. Upon checkout, I attempted to voice my concern about the night's activities and was shut down. I also wrote a letter to the manager that was never responded to. I don't think it's unreasonable to have high expectations for the Fairmont... it was completely underwhelming and an interesting anecdote for my introductions to both San Francisco and a Fairmont hotel. I would never stay at one again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but could have been so much better”
Reviews.Author: pineapple_coconut
Reviews.Content: For a five star property, we expected a lot. Perhaps our expectations were set way too high after coming straight from the Bellagio in Vegas to stay in the Fairmont. We stayed here in November 2007. This hotel is really "old world glamour", the lobby is very chic. When we got to our room, we were disappointed as we were allocated a room with a connecting door with a view of the courtyard, something which really annoys my fiancé. The bathroom also was quite small. We requested a change and they moved us to a room at the front of the hotel so it had a much better view. The only thing was the toilet in the bathroom had a bit of a wonky flush - it didn't really work properly. They had to send someone up to fix it. The breakfast was disappointing as it was very small and ridiculously expensive for what you got. We had breakfast there the first morning but we didn't eat there anymore. I was actually shocked at the price of the breakfast. We were disappointed because of the small little issues so I hope they have improved since then.

Reviews.Title: “Very average room... Not best location”
Reviews.Author: MWTuff
Reviews.Content: I was a tad disappointed with this hotel.... Lobby= beautiful... Actually stunning.... But to to room, which was supposed to be big enough to fit a portable bed if we decided we (friend & I) didn't want to share a bed, as they had no twins available... But getting back to room size, we could barely fit extra rack for suit case let alone another bed....as for Location, well it's a lovely view, perched on top of "snob hill", but makes exploring a chore because the road to it is soooooo steep (had to take heels off walking down as it's that steep!) so not a handy, easily accessible location.... I would have perfered bottom of hill near Union Square, cheaper, less impressive lobby... Service was ok but hardly worth the $$$ for the tiny room... Oh did I mention window in room looking at wall?

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: JohnPaul77
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights in October. The hotel is old, but in a good way. You can feel the history of the place. The room we had looked out over the bay and the North Beach area which was stunning at sunset and sunrise. I would imagine some people would find the rooms a bit dated, but the hotel is over a hundred years old so we felt it just added to the overall vibe of the place. Our room had everything we needed, the bed was extremely comfortable and the shower was superb. The lobby and main hotel bar is stunning and probably hasn't changed since the hotel was built. The bar is a really great place to sit and have a quiet drink at night and there is the Tonga Room bar/restaurant in the basement which is a bit tacky but good fun. This was our first trip to San Fransico but we thought the location was ideal. Its a nice straight walk downhill to Fishermans Wharf and a similar downhill walk to the Union Square area. The walk back up to the hotel is obviously a bit more of a challenge but the Fairmont sits on a street which is serviced by the trolley's and you can easily get a cab so it wasn't a problem. I personally loved this hotel because of the history of the place and its location. If you don't mind rooms which are not ultra modern then I'd highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Thought the rooms would be much more glamorous”
Reviews.Author: kjtraveler2008
Reviews.Content: I normally travel to SF for business monthly and typically stay at the Hilton in the Financial District. They were booked so my assistant booked me at the Fairmont; I was actually excited to try a new hotel especially one as luxurious as the Fairmont. Everyone in my office said it was one of the best hotels in SF. When you walk in you would think that it is completely high end and really beautiful. I was smiling while checking in already feeling as though I was on vacation instead of a work trip (minus my husband of course). When I got to my room it said Damascus suite and not all the rooms had suite signs on them. I got really excited. When I walked in I realized it was one of the handicap rooms so spacious but didn't really have enough furniture to make it look full. The walls were bare and the bed was small....not what I'm use to but certainly more than I need for a work trip. The bathroom had no counter top- which I hate, I had to leave all my bathroom items near the TV, this could just be because it was the handicap accessible room which is understandable. The shower had a loud screeching noise that never let up so it certainly woke me up in the morning. Other than that nothing much to complain about. I'd probably not stay there again b/c they are perched on the hill and I of course didn't have a view of any sort and it's a trek down to the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Luxury”
Reviews.Author: DrBob-cs
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights with my wife in the tower (newer) wing of the hotel while on business. The room was large, quiet, with a very comfortable bed and lovely linens. It was what I expected of a luxury hotel, except it had only four small drawers in a dresser for clothes, the bath had only one sink with very little space for toiletries, and the desk was small with only two electrical outlets, not enough for a computer and two cell phones. Food at breakfast was average for a large hotel, nothing to get excited about. The hotel is in a residential area atop Nob Hill, one mile and 400 vertical feet from the financial district, the shopping area near Union Square, and the Embarcadero. This means there was very little within walking distance. No one attending our meeting wanted to climb 400 feet back up to the hotel after going down to Union Square. The streets leading to the hotel are very steep, and the cable cars are an expensive $6 one way. A taxi is cheaper if two people are going together. If you are driving, remember parking is expensive, and we heard several complaints that drivers and even pedestrians are ticketed for minor violations.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel in truly pristine condition”
Reviews.Author: W_on_the_Road
Reviews.Content: Really impressive hotel. Head and shoulders above the hotel across the street, in my opinion. Spotlessly clean. Gorgeous property.. seemingly old world and brand new all at once. Was especially impressed because I didn't like the first room they gave me, and they immediately moved me -- I thought they'd be hesitant because I was paying their bargain basement rate. Not so -- they moved me right away. Only negs -- no coffee maker in the room, and during peak hours, there was like a 25 minute wait at the coffee shop in the hotel. Also, like many hotels in SF, rooms over the main entrance are noisy because all of the bellman use this loud whistle to call cabs for people.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: cfilmcat
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at the top of Nob Hill. The area is quiet at night, yet only at 10 minute walk to China town, Union Square and the Ferry Building. All the cable cars run by as well.I will always try and stay here. It is hard to get a room, usually fully booked

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Sophisticated - Spectacular SF Views”
Reviews.Author: SF88
Reviews.Content: Plenty of hotels to choose from in SF, but the Fairmont really gets it right: serious quality in the bed linens, decor and attention to detail in the rooms. If the budget allows, spring for a Gold Level room - breakfast, snacks, hors d'oeuvres and drinks in a private, concierge level lounge. My last trip, we had a corner room with City views: quality bed, linens, seating and desk - the bathrooms are a bit dated (sorry Fairmont), but in every other aspect the rooms are splendid. Not hip and chic (aka pounding music in all the public spaces) and many of us locals miss the Tikki Lounge; but there are so many bars/restaurants within a 5 minute walk or cab ride, you truly are spoilt for choice. Highly recommend the big buffet breakfast - amazing choices and will set you up for the whole day. This is a fairly big hotel, but the service levels are excellent: my last trip was staying there after a business event, and they even let me check in at 2pm to drop off bags. Fairmonts are always good, but this one really excels - even though we're local to the area, it is a great place to stay for a weekend 'away' - easy walk to Union Square and the shops (downhill!) - and don't feel bad about splurging on a short cab ride back at the end of the day - everyone does it. Or take the Cable Car.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome balcony room”
Reviews.Author: hmdespo
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights for our anniversary in the city at the Fairmont and booked the balcony suite. Found a discounted rate on hotels.com but it was still very pricey. Balcony rooms are not too common in San Francisco so it was a treat. We enjoyed cheese and wine on the balcony and would return to this room again. We were also able to check in super early (11:00 AM) before heading to the Giants game which was great as we did not have to rush back or leave bags in the car, etc. One important item to note about this room and why I have given it four stars is when we booked the room we booked a King bed suite as we are very tall and apparently there are only queen beds in all of the balcony suites. Super important detail depending on your travel companion or height. That was the only drawback (and the hills) of the hotel. This is an old hotel so you should be aware of that when booking. That lends to the charm and everything is updated anyhow. The bathrooms are clean but small. The location is great as we walked to Union Square and the the edge of Chinatown. We decided to have dinner at the Tonga Room which I have not been to since a high school prom and we enjoyed fantastic service, great drinks, dinner and music. The atmosphere was fun as there was dancing and both families and couples. While there are numerous fancy restaurants in San Francisco the "rain" over the lagoon (pool) with the boat filled with singers cant be beat for a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: dcrouton
Reviews.Content: Spent four days in August at the Fairmont. The location was pretty convenient. It was at the top of Nob hill but near major bus and cable car lines. I did not appreciate the hills but the cable cars and buses really took the pain out of walking up. As for the hotel things were really good. We were able to check in early with now problem. The concierge helped us with some directions and reservations. The rooms were extremely large and well appointed. No issues their. What gets me about the entire Fairmont chain is the need to charge extra for WiFi. These days it should be standard. For business it is not a big deal but for tourists it is an extra unnecessary charge. I would recommend this hotel if looking for a nice stay in a hotel. While it is short walking distance to China town and Union square invest in a muni pass to avoid the up hill walks.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: KrystalEdwards
Reviews.Content: We just arrived at the hotel for our stay, this is the third time we have stayed at the hotel. We we arrived at noon the line to check in was 30 minutes long so we dropped our luggage and headed out to enjoy the city! When we came back to the hotel we were in great spirits and checked in at the front. The man checked us in (Scott) had absolutely no personality and was not amused by our excitement to be in the main tower of the Fairmont. Once we got into our room we got settled and went to get ice, however our ice bucket had water and a diet coke, which tells me the room was not cleaned properly. I called down to the desk and the lady was, once again not very amused and asked if I wanted to be connected to the house keeping manager.(really?) how about, "I apologize and will have that taken care of for you" strange. Now I sit here and a room service rep comes and doesn't know what to do with our ice bucket. I am just not impressed and hopefully out stay will improve. Wait it just got better! One glass in the room to make a drink! I suddenly feel that I am at a ramada inn.

Reviews.Title: “Regency Suite”
Reviews.Author: kitty811
Reviews.Content: Pros: - amazing room upgrade (from a standard in the main/older building to a suite in the newer tower) - huge living room large enough to entertain 20 guests - very comfortable bed (firm w/feather bed and down comforter). perfect! - great views of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. Telescope in room to get close and personal... - large, updated marble bathroom w/separate soaking tub, shower and toilet in another room. excellent water pressure in shower/toilet. Cons: - no in room coffee/tea. had to call room service for a cup of tea, but service was nice Can't wait to return but will splurge for a suite.

Reviews.Title: “My home in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: RKW206
Reviews.Content: I first stayed here with my parents almost 60 years ago. Now I stay here once or twice a year and still love it madly. Staff is the equal of any hotel in the world, consistently bending over backwards to ensure a great stay. Laurel Court bar is a fine place to hang out. And the Tonga Room...you would have to be a very cranky person to not be happy and well fed in the Tonga Room... Room service food is excellent. Wi-Fi & Ethernet is strong. Parking is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly...”
Reviews.Author: Kent A
Reviews.Content: It is a shame the owners have allowed this magnificent property to decline to the state I found it in. The good: Great location, decent sized room, big walk-in closet, professional and friendly staff. The bad: Stained carpet and furniture in my room, dirty in the corners, tired decorating and peeling paint and wallpaper, small bathroom, slow elevators and not enough of them, plus they are dinged and scraped up. The ugly: Expensive hotels are known for nickle and diming their guests and this one is no exception. Everything extra costs extra, like the excercise facilities, internet service and no coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont holiday”
Reviews.Author: klsmackay
Reviews.Content: Four days in the Fairmont in San Francisco with the most wonderful view over the city, 21st floor. A truly beautiful hotel in the mould of Gleneagles or the Balmoral in Edinburgh and all staff were fantastic especially the reception and cocierge desk and all doormen who made our stay so memorable. Cant wait to return as we plan to visit in 2014. The Mackays St Andrews Scotland

Reviews.Title: “History atop a hill”
Reviews.Author: Steve_and_Jocelyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed for business for 3 nights the first week of November. Beautiful old hotel, in pristine condition, tastefully done and very grand. The location is convenient to Union Square, trolley cars nearby. Late evening and early morning, I could hear the bells clang from below, which was incredibly charming to me. The room was lovely, great view, wonderful bed, quiet, wished the internet was free but alas... Did I mention the view?? I was in the new Tower by the way corner room. They told us at the front desk when making a reservation, ask for rooms ending with 10. (example 1010, 1110 etc...) These are the end rooms and corner spaces. Staff at the hotel were all courteous and mature. Everything is pricey ala Fairmont. My only complaint is that there was no coffee available in the lobby after 7am. Variety of guests: tourists, business, surfers, etc... Would love to stay here again, though I doubt I would select this venue for vacation more a business setting for me.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm at the crossroads to the best of San Fransisco”
Reviews.Author: adoola
Reviews.Content: Rooms were in need of a little TLC, but overall our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. The lobby is absolutely stunning and the reception staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. And what a location, some of the best of San Francisco is within walking distance (though save enough enerfy for the walk back up the hill!) - North Beach, Fishermans Wharf, Chinatown, Financial District etc. - or hop on a California Line cable car. Parking is expensive (about $60 per night), but there are cheaper public parking lots within 1 or 2 blocks of the hotel. We found the Grace Cathedral parking on Taylor Street to be the cheapest at $27.00 max. per day - the garage is open Sunday through Thursday from 6:30 a.m. to midnight and Friday and Saturday 6:30 a.m. to 2 a.m. (you can park overnight, you just won't' have access to your vehicle outside of the opening times).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmt1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for my 50th birthday trip with my husband. From the minute the taxi pulled up to the front entrance I was in heaven. The decor is elegant but not so fancy that you don't feel comfortable sitting in the lobby to wait for your car. All the staff seemed friendly and helpful. Our room #2207 had the most amazing view of the city and the bay and we were fortunate enough to have clear weather for 2 of our 3 days there. The hotel is located in a fairly central area and we found it easy enough to get around using the public transportation. We did take a cab a few times when the thought of climbing got too much! We ate breakfast at the hotel one morning and that would be my only slight complaint. I ordered from the menu and was happy with my frittata but my husband had the buffet and it was lukewarm at best when you're paying $70 for breakfast w/out tip you don't want lukewarm food. One thing to be aware of is Caffee Cento listed as a breakfast option is actually accessed from the street as well as the hotel and although the coffee and food was good it is very, very crowded and the lines are long and there is not really any seating to enjoy a sit down breakfast. That being said there are plenty of other places to eat in the area so it wasn't a problem,

Reviews.Title: “Someday I'll live here...”
Reviews.Author: miniorange
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont San Francisco is historic hotel charm with superior customer service (and the lobby smells amazing!). I have been fortunate to enjoy the hospitality here several times and each visit the Fairmont exceeded my expectations - large windows with sills large enough to curl up in and read a book, a bed so comfortable I took mine apart to see who makes it - and location, location, location. Blocks from Union Square, Dottie's True Blue Cafe, North Beach, The Wharf... and filled with Nob Hill's own cafes and attractions - check out the labyrinth in the cathedral across the street. Chinatown, only blocks away, offers dining and shopping like you won't find at home.

Reviews.Title: “Old but elegant”
Reviews.Author: richchar
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you want the feel of San Francisco's grandeur and a locale that cannot be beaten - at the top of Nob Hill, two blocks from Chinatown, a trolley ride away from the Ferry Building. There are places to go in every direction. It is an elegant, old hotel that has mostly kept up its grandeur, though a tad tired in hidden corners. The room and views in the Tower were spectacular. We overlooked the city skyline and often just opened the drapes and stared. The bathroom was wonderful - a grand and luxurious shower, marble tiles, elegant features. The room itself was large, grand, elegant. At the same time, the rug looked worn and needed repair, and the room could have used a comfortable chair and more drawer space. Service in the hotel is as grand as its reputation. The concierge was always pleasant and helpful. The front desk people were friendly and responsive. You knew you were in a place of pride, and it really felt good to be here. We were here for a conference, and the room price was surprisingly affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Girls' Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Bobcat 12
Reviews.Content: A girls' weekend is always a great time, but our time at The Fairmont made it so much more wonderful! It is a beautiful historic hotel with a lovely lobby and common areas. We were upgraded and had a corner room with a great view of the city. The room was huge and had a walk- in closet! The bathroom was functional....not lots of vanity space, but plenty of outlets in other places...so it works! Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Talk about on- time service...we ordered breakfast, as well as bell desk services and they were not even one minute off.....unbelievable! We had cold oatmeal with breakfast and it was cheerfully removed from the bill. If there is a down-side....it's a steep climb from shopping back to the hotel...but it ia a good calorie burn! Parking was included in our rate...but can run up to $55 with taxes...just good to know to factor in! Would be happy to go back for our next adventure!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable classic”
Reviews.Author: Thomas R
Reviews.Content: I'd always wanted to stay in the Fairmont ever since my salad days as a "casual" worker in SF. The opportunity came with a recent conference and I decided to bring along my wife for a three-day stay. Stately and well-kept is how I'd describe the building and it's lobby. "Classic" and clearly of a different time are the rooms. The service is toward the top-end, friendly staff who try (and succeed) in being helpful in many ways. The grand lobby is just that: grand. The bar can seem a bit dark and cold but once tucked into your own cocoon on a banquette, it makes sense. A little peeve is the "touch-me-and-you-will-pay" display of bottled water and goodies meant to tempt you. Likewise, I wish hotels like this would just include the internet charge in the room instead of adding the $13.95 daily fee. Nevertheless, if another conference offers the Fairmont at a reasonable rate, I'll return.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: thefriedlands
Reviews.Content: Undoubtedly on one of the best locations in San Francisco, the Fairmont at the top of Nob Hill is a stately hotel with old world charm, but modern conveniences. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive to all guests' wishes. The food in the hotel's restaurants is excellent and up to the Fairmont's standards. Not only is the food delicious, but so are the beds!

Reviews.Title: “"Nice stay"”
Reviews.Author: Coastview4
Reviews.Content: Nice pleasant stay,friendly staff,beautiful lobby area and clean room.No upgrades or anything even though it was a birthday and wedding anniversary present trip (It would have been a nice gesture).Tonga Bar entertainment band was "different" to say the least. Not sure though why the hotel are still holding $200 on my credit card as I had no hotel charges and checked out almost a week ago . . . .

Reviews.Title: “Easy, opulent, and perfect”
Reviews.Author: doctort
Reviews.Content: A complete review with video is on our site EatPackGo.com - Suffice to say that this hotel has the perfect location. The unknowing San Francisco traveler will note that the hotel is at the top of Russian/Nob hill - those of us who know SF, know that you want to be here- because it means you can get anywhere you want to in the city- easily, without the traffic that those who stay along the bay. Do not try to walk up the hill to this hotel- take a cab. And cabs from the hotel are easy- without long lines. Want to check in fast, join the Fairmont Hotel's President club, and with that you get great lines, and better service. This is a grand hotel, that goes out of their way. You can see our example in our video blog at EatPackGo.com

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont San Fran”
Reviews.Author: ToonTownFarmer
Reviews.Content: spent 4 days for a business trip. 2nd time there and just as good as the first. rooms are very nice even though hotel abit older but that is the unique attraction. very clean, great service, nice beds and pillows. Someone told us everything is downhill from the Fiarmont and they were true - its a good hike uphill to the hotel no matter which way you go - yikes my poor feet. staff is great, bar was fun. their recommendations for food was OK but do some of your own research as we veto most of their suggestions. would be back anytime and we have stayed at so very excellant places over the years

Reviews.Title: “Classically Beautiful with a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MissFranberry
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Fairmont a couple of times in the past 15 years and I am always impressed by their stellar customer service, comfortable rooms, and classically beautiful design. A nationally recognized historic hotel, The Fairmont is mostly up-to-date with great beds and a decent amount of space (for Queen and King rooms). We had no complaints during our 4-night stay except for their business center which is run by someone else (print-outs were costly). The location of this hotel is super convenient for walking to Union Square, Chinatown, and other popular SF locations-- and if you're up for it, it's a good walk all the way down to the Ferry Building and Financial Districts, too. Several cable car and Muni lines are located across the street from the hotel making this a good place for those looking to explore the city without driving. Good for business, pleasure, solo trips, and couples. Do note that the property does sit on a hill.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel but some things lacking....”
Reviews.Author: paulstevo1978
Reviews.Content: Firstly there is no denying this is a fabulous looking old style hotel. A little away from union square and atop a large hill which is a tough walk but the payoff is the great views down the hill! Downside for me was the service..... After travelling for 14 hours we found no-one at reception at 8pm to check us in and waited 15 mins to be checked in without an apology.... In addition service at the bar was slow as there was a large party in so we were almost last to be looked after. The concierge and porters though were very helpful and knowledgeable. Lack of complimentary wifi and tea and coffee in room also not great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dillyma
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont for two nights on a business trip. I found it to be an absolutely lovely hotel. The lobby is very beautiful, as are all the public spaces. This is a grand old hotel and takes you back to another era. I had a room on the 10th floor in the "tower" section, which had a fabulous view of the city. The room was spacious and well-decorated. I found the bed to be very comfortable. Loved the bathroom - big room, separate toilet and large glass shower. Very nice! The staff was also very friendly and helpful. We stopped at the conceirge desk the first night and they were very helpful in directing us to a restaurant within walking distance. The only drawback was that the thermostat in my room would not go any lower than 65 degrees. It was warm while I was in San Francisco, and I like it chilly at night, so that was a small issue for me. I would definitely stay at the Fairmont again, and would recommend to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury San Francisco Old Marvel!”
Reviews.Author: simonr78
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont San Francisco is a truly remarkable historic property, a fantastic luxurious stay made the trip to this wonderful city even more special, from the moment we entered the lobby it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Fabulous Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: Ian M
Reviews.Content: We've travelled to California every year since 2006 and for the five past years, we've stayed at the San Francisco Fairmont. What more can you say about a place that's already regarded with so much fondness and affection? From the moment you enter the fabled marble halls until the time that you check out, you will have a Hotel experience like no other, anywhere in the world. This is luxury with a massive big "L". We've been very fortunate in that every year we've had a room in the Fairmont Tower which allows you the most spectacular of views over the Bay - every morning as you pull back the drapes, feast uyour eyes on the panorama of the Golden Gate Bridge, Russian Hill, admire the Coit tower, and the two-tiered Bay Bridge, and don't miss (how could you?) the small jewel floating in an azure sea, the island that is Alcatraz. There is no view like this anywhere else in the world. The bedrooms are spacious, clean and like the whole hotel, very well maintained. The restaurant and bar area which sit adjacent to the massive reception halls have been revamped and redecorated over the past twelve months and are comfortable and relaxing. The Fairmont breakfast is a must - don't miss out. All kinds of berries and other fruit by the bowlful, toasts, croissants, bagels and breads of every description, smoked Maryland bacon, to go with freshly cooked eggs cooked by your personal chef on demand. Even the grapefruit juice gets 11 out of 10! Overnight valet parking is expensive but it's essential and the staff there are efficient and very helpful. You're at the top of California and Mason, and the SF trams tinkle their way up and down the hill all day (a single fare is $6) and you never have to wait long for a ride. You can walk down to Union Square in ten minutes, but get the tram back up! Shopping stores abound - Sax, Macy's, Bloomingdales, Apple, Levi, Nike, Tiffany and many, many more - they are all just minutes from the Hotel. We can't wait to come back 2012 - San Francisco is our favourite city in the world, and the Fairmont Hotel is one of the very good reasons for that!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, grace and a glimpse of old San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: CoachDave37
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Fairmont Hotel on Nob Hill many times during the Christmas season. We love the City at Christmastime, and the Fairmont offers reasonable rates on its rooms in both the modern tower and also in its historic main building. The rooms are always clean, everything works, and the views from the tower are incredible. The rooms in the main building are large and very convenient to the main lobby. Service has always been great, whether for room service, retrieving our car, helping us with our bags or checking out. I joined the Fairmont President's Club a few years ago (it's free), and as a result, we get free WiFi. That alone is worth joining, but we also have received discounts on rooms after we have stayed at various Fairmonts. Anyway, the Fairmont San Francisco was one of the few large buildings to survive the 1906 quake and fire, and its lobby still reflects the ornate style of 1906 San Francisco. And at Christmastime it can be quite spectacular. For a trip down memory lane, the Tonga Room is still alive and worth a visit. It brings back memories of the 1950s, or if you weren't alive back then, it gives you a glimpse of what was avant garde 60 years ago. All things considered, the Fairmont San Francisco is a wonderful hotel and a great place to stay when visiting the city!

Reviews.Title: “Fair"NOT" in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: barca212
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other Fairmont properties, this one is a real disappointment. First, the location on top of Nob Hill is not convenient. One has to take a Trolley Car to the top of the hill unless you feel like climbing up a steep hill. Second the rooms are really dated! I was lucky enough to have a room on the 22nd Floor of the Tower with a great view of the city, but that still did not make up for the absolutely dismal decoration and stodginess of this room. So I can only imagine how much worse it would be if one was in a room without a view and natural light. Third, and the major failure of this hotel, is its staff. It is seems like they are doing you a favor by answering a question or serving you a drink. The conceirge might as well not be there. So unhelpful and always recommending what is right around the corner and complete tourist traps. I used the wonderful apps on my i-phone to find much better places than what was recommended by the hotel's conceirge team. All in all, this is an overpriced hotel that is way past its glory. Don't bother dropping your money on this property. San Francisco has so many wonderful hotels and in much better locations. I regret having stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Dame in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: peonyinlondon
Reviews.Content: Set at the highest point of Nob Hill, the Fairmont is a glorious tribute to a bygone era. Dripping in luxury, the lobby is one of the few which makes me feel like I should be in good clothes in order to pass through it. This would be a perfect venue for a wedding, especially if the ceremony were held in the cathedral just across the way. In terms of modern comfort, however, I was very much missing my in-room coffee maker and I get angry when I'm charged for daily internet use. The minibar prices are beyond outrageous, as are the prices for room service breakfast. It's easy enough, however, to get down to the bowels of the hotel, where you will find a great little coffee shop with very reasonable prices. Go figure. The beds are a little soft, but new and comfortable. The views, especially in the newer tower, are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “On top of the hill”
Reviews.Author: MATTNottinghamUK
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, reasonable price for a big city...I think about $220. We are a family of 4 so $50 each is well worth it. Join the Presidents Club online....its free, you will then get complimentary wi-fi. Its quite a walk to Pier 39 about 40 mins, an even tougher walk coming back its all uphill. The alternative is the cable car but for the four of us for one very squashed 10 minute trip it was $32. There are plenty of small pharmacy/grocery stores within a couple of blocks downhill towards the shopping centres, its certainly cheaper to buy breakfast and coffee than at the hotel. Would I stay again? yes I love the Fairmont Hotels but maybe I would look towards Fishermans Wharf a little more for hotels there. Fishermans Wharf was a little gem..we loved it. The Tower rooms were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fun 5 Night Stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: dld8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont San Francisco for 5 nights ovet the Labor Day weekend and had a great time! Enjoyed the property - was upgraded to a tower room that had unbelievable views of the San Francisco Bay. Room was a nice size and comfortable. Loved grabbing a cup of coffee in the AM, getting back to my room to sit and watch the city wake up. Went to the Tonga Room Happy Hour - so kitschy and fun! A must visit when in San Francisco , loved the Mai Tais and the tropical rain storms every half hour - had a smile on our faces throughout Happy Hour! The front desk staff was great - provided a couple of restaurant recommendations that were excellent. One was MyMy for breakfast - , lunch and was great! Ended up there twice because our lunch was so good. Also ate twice in the dining room which had excellent service, very good food - must say a little pricy - but was worth it! My reason for 4 stars is that 2 out of the 5 nights I had to call to get my room cleaned. This is after I was out and about all day and arriving back to my room after 4-5 in the afternoon? One of the evenings I had to wait downstairs while they cleaned my room. Although in Fairmont fashion, the manager did buy me a glass of wine while I waited. Still was a hassle especially given that it happened twice. Also think their concierge services are mediocre. Was having a hard time on the MOMA website - wanted to attend the Stein Exhibit. Called down to the concierge to explain my issue and could she assist with getting tickets? Her response was that getting my tickets via online was my best bet......didn't I just say was having a difficult time on their website? Really did enjoy the Fairmont, will stay again on my next trip to SFO - hopefully they won't be so busy that these few glitches will not occur again

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive prices”
Reviews.Author: Matt C
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Fairmont San Francisco on a business trip for 7 nights, the total hotel bill (room only) was $1800 and that was on a reduced rate! The hotel lobby is one of the most impressive I've seen with its huge marble columns supporting the high roof, comfortable antique looking sofa's and impressive décor. The staff are all very friendly and helpful (should think so for the price) and the hotel definitely has the wow factor. The rooms are big, the beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are also marble tiled; my room had a big glass box shower which was amazing. I was situated on the 17th floor of the "tower" block in the hotel which I think is the newer part. The view from my room was equally impressive overlooking the San Francisco bay area. Everything about the hotel is massively expensive and I would recommend saving a few pennies by eating and drinking outside the hotel. The hotel is located right at the top of nob hill and takes about 20-30mins to walk to the peir39 area which has some half decent restaurants. Its also about a 15min walk to the main shopping areas of SF so it is well situated for exploring the city. I would not recommend this hotel unless you have a lot of cash or your business are paying the bill (like for my trip). Its very impressive but also very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: kittycarr
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont was a beautiful hotel. The lobby was stunning and our conjoining rooms were very clean and pleasant. It was very nice and the staff were very friendly. The only thing was if you want to use WiFi you had to pay $13.95. Apart from that everything was fantastic.b

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful, absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: plodders
Reviews.Content: What can I say, the Fairmont was exactly what we expected and more. Having read some of the reviews we were slightly concerned however any worries we had disappeared in an instant. The Hotel is beautiful, magical in fact. It was the last two days of our stay in San Francisco and my husband had always wanted to stay at the Fairmont so we booked it. When we arrived we were told our room had been upgraded to a suite on the 16th floor. WOW! We couldn't believe that they had done this for us and the room was out of this world, immaculate and beautiful. We had views of the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz and the city. The Hotel is located on a hill so the views are amazing. For our first evening we ate in the restaurant and the food was excellent and the waiter made our evening perfect because he was so polite, friendly and professional. For our second evening we ate in the Tonga Room, not an experience we would want to repeat. I am surprised the Fairmont converted what would have been a beautiful swimming pool to such an oddly themed restaurant. However, this is only our view, after all it was busy and has been there a long time!! If you want to stay in an elegant, stylish hotel with polite and attentive staff, in a wonderful location, stay in the Fairmont, it is truly wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: 00_traveller_00
Reviews.Content: The building is very impressive and the lobby is stunning. The decor and piano playing provides a very upmarket feel. However, I paid almost $500 (including all the extra taxes and charges), which is far too much. I was amazed to find out that that price excluded breakfast, wifi and the gym. After complaining I was told that I could register to the presidents club for free, which gave free wifi and gym access. It is a good location, but being at the top of a hill really took its toll. Unless you are pretty fit, you will need to get taxis to/from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but well situated, convenient and smart”
Reviews.Author: mjfisher
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel, but extremely large as you would expect for a city hotel. Our room was big and very pleasant, we have no complaints about that or the cleanliness. The service is good, we found the front desk staff very helpful as was the concierge and the cleaning staff certainly kept everything immaculate. I think a previous reviewer said find a deal - that's a good plan! It is in a very good location so we didn't hire our car until we left San Francisco which I would recommend, you have no need for one in the City as the cable cars are close by and there are plenty of cabs. Much better not to have the hassle of driving so you can better enjoy this beautiful city. Last time we went to San Francisco we stayed at the Westin St Francisc in Union Square, but I preferred The Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service & very dissatisfied”
Reviews.Author: Jeff1234567
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot especially in the US I often try and stay in a fairmont as u until now have had excellent experiences. However at this hotel it felt like an inner city airport hotel in which we were kept awake all night with the noise! At over £300 at night I expected more won't be so quick to opt for or recommend a fairmont in the future. When I complained got the feeling they had better things to deal with!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the main building - newer, larger rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ehan31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is my go-to when visiting San Francisco. Positives: - It has a pretty convenient location that is accessible by taxi or cable car if you want. (Parking your car is $ as with all other hotels in the area). - Accommodations are excellent. The rooms are clean, the beds are really quite heavenly, and the rooms in the main tower are spacious. (The smaller, more dated rooms in the other locations of the hotel have equally nice beds and appointments but the bathrooms are much older and the rooms are significantly smaller. Not a big problem if you're going to be out and about most of the time or if you are only here a night, but paying full price, I'd try to stay in the newer rooms.) - The concierge is very helpful and friendly. - The city views are beautiful. Negatives: - Food here is pricey, but it's a Fairmont and it's San Francisco. I didn't eat at the hotel except for a breakfast that was included anyway. The buffet was quite nice quality food, but I wouldn't pay full price for it. There are better places to eat in the city. - Parking, as stated above if you're driving. - Room size if you're staying in the older rooms (specifically the bathroom) Bottom line: If you need just a place to crash don't spend the money. If you are going to enjoy your time, like the finer things but don't want to pay exorbitantly, and prefer a bed that isn't a concrete slab, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not my taste”
Reviews.Author: Adam R
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel to be quite nice. Very classic, old school feel. Extremely ornate lobby. The room itself was nice, pretty roomy, high ceilings, good sized desk. My bathroom was pretty big. I also had a nice view of the bay. This location isn't my favorite, while it's close to everything, nothing is easily walkable since it's at the top of Nob Hill. If you like very traditional hotels, you might enjoy this place, but between the location and the style, I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jm12341
Reviews.Content: On the first day we were placed once floor where all other rooms seemed to be used by people making a film.
