Unfortunately filming started at midnight and carried on until early morning. It was a struggle to change rooms. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are very compact and hard to negotiate. On one occasion we arrived back at 6pm to find the room had not been cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a little stuffy & overpriced”
Reviews.Author: lucl2000
Reviews.Content: The rooms were ok but overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss!”
Reviews.Author: Elphenstone
Reviews.Content: Great location for us, but climbing up nob hill may be an issue for some. The rooms are dated, but are generally pleasant in appearance. The hallways are not to the same standard and reveal a high degree of wear. Wear in our room was also an issue. The bed was worn to the point that there was a dent from countless people sleeping in the same spot. I kept sliding away from my partner into this dent. The shower didn't work properly. There were multiple broken globes in our room. The main issue it this hotel is cleanliness. Our bathroom had skum on the floor. The drinking glasses were not cleaned and had lipstick on them. There was an ice bucket in our room full of stagnant water. No complimentary tea/coffee in your room. Complimentary tea/coffee in the lobby before 7am only. What a joke. In the hall outside our room there was an area where something had been spilled with lots of crumbs on the floor - very obvious (see photos). This was not cleaned up for 3 days! It was still there when we left and can only assume given the standards of cleanliness is still there. The other disgusting thing was that room service plates etc that are put out are left sitting in the hall for long periods also. This is a big detraction. So in summary - not a high end hotel. Enjoy the magnificent lobby because thats as good as it's going to get. We complained about some of the things above. Others we couldn't be bothered with as we were otherwise busy enjoying the holiday and didn't want to be disrupted even more.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Fairmont so far”
Reviews.Author: KelseyH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far my favourite Fairmont that I have stayed at. My mother and I went, this was the first time I had ever been to San Fran. We are members of the Fairmont Presidents Club so the room that we were first given was beautiful, but didn't have a very good view. My mother was set on having a view of the city, so after about half an hour we were upgraded to a corner suite in a completely different section of the hotel. The only thing that was slightly irritating was that the elevators to the tower, where we were staying, were not directly in the lobby. You had to walk through a bit of a maze to find them. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Fran and ask for Tom at the concierge to book you dinner at Perbaco (not sure if the spelling is right). This was the best Italian food that I have had outside of Italy. Tom was the best concierge I have ever met, he got us into some restaurants for the week that we were there that normally have a 3 or 4 month wait list. I can't wait to go back to San Fran again, I would definitely stay at the Fairmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Winchell
Reviews.Content: Like so many others we had high hopes staying at this hotel, however, we were disappointed. The lobby and public areas are spectacular and well maintained. Service (front desk staff) and attention to detail in general are weak. We were welcomed unfriendly and booked in a smoker's room which we had not requested. Upon returning to the front desk, we were informed that there were no other rooms available. We did not back down and surprise, surprise they suddenly had a different room. Their WIFI never worked properly and after informing the front desk they had me contact an IT specialist with whom I was on the phone for 15 minutes. I think that such a problem ought to be solved by the hotel and not by the guest; in any case the WIFI never worked properly. The staff at their restaurant is very friendly. I am pretty sure that there are better hotels in SF for the price that the Fairmont asks.

Reviews.Title: “On top of Nob Hill of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Carl40Switzerland
Reviews.Content: Old style hotel with very good service level. My room was a bit worn out but the reception area has style. It is nicely located up on Nob Hill and it is easy to go down with the cable cars or walk to either China town or shopping at Union Square or down the Fishermans Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappoining!”
Reviews.Author: 1879fulham
Reviews.Content: Had high hopes staying at this iconic hotel. Only stayed the one night on business (a Saturday) but let's just say left feeling very disappointed. The foyer and public areas of this hotel are indeed spectacular and are very well maintained. However when you get to your room (deluxe room on the 7th floor) you are cruelly let down with a room that has absolutely no view with minimal light. Disappointingly attention to detail also seems to suffer somewhat with the net curtain dirty and also significantly torn, and there were also quite a few areas in the room that had major cracks and flakey paintwork. It is clear that the hotel spend their money on maintaining the public areas and then cut corners on the guest rooms (certainly from my expeience this time anyway). I have stayed at other Fairmont hotels in the past staying at their Santa Monica hotel and the two they have in Bermuda. None of them really come close to the San Francisco site and location but all of them far exceed on the guest room experience by a mile! I guess the major question is would I come here again particularly with my wife and the honest answer is a resounding NO! For the price there are better experiences in San Francisco out there.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, incredibly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TiggerHere
Reviews.Content: The foyer is indeed beautiful, but the positive experience for me ended there. The food is medicore and overpriced, with mandatory gratuity even for the self-serve breakfast buffet. There is a mandatory $5 for the live music in Tonga, whether you like it or not. Parking is $50+ per night. The whole facility is past its prime: almost all meeting rooms need new paint, our room on 5th floor had dust and cobwebs all over the ceiling and walls, and the bathroom had mold growing in one corner. Service was average, certainly didn't go out of their way to be helpful. We moved to Grand Hyatt for a clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lesleyLeominster
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a short stay at the Fairmont in San Francisco what a beautiful hotel, loved every minute there friendly staff very helpful, room was so comfortable and clean we asked for high floor and were not disappointed would love to return there some day.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay at Landmark Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cleisha
Reviews.Content: I treated a friend for a night at the Fairmont for her birthday. There were three of us staying in a double queen room. It is much like several 4 star hotels we have visited, nice linens, good toiletries, great view, and comfortable beds. Note that you will pay $52 for parking. The service was equal to our stay at the Wynn in Las Vegas. Well attended and the staff was very pleasant. The only complaint I have is that we had to wait nearly two hours for our room when arriving at 2pm. Take note that even if the staff tells you there is early check in, you may wait. We sat in the cocktail lounge while waiting and had signature drinks which were very tasty and pricy. After visiting SF many times it is worth at least one visit but is a little overated.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in the city!”
Reviews.Author: 1WorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Really nice. Took a cab from Powell St BART station to the Fairmont. It's a classic hotel. Really nice rooms, awesome lobby, and restaurant. I liked the terrace garden. Overall a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely great service and unbelievable views”
Reviews.Author: Joseph D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent seven full days at the Fairmont to celebrate my birthday. When we arrived our room was not ready but were told that they could give us another room in the older part of the hotel. The desk clerk, Rich, told us that we had a great room on the 18th floor of the tower and that it was worth waiting for. (Hint to the hotel manager - double Richs' salary and only allow him 1 day off instead of 2 ), it's much better when he is behind the desk although everyone was nice and helpful. The room was definetly worth the wait. Views of the bay and of the city and the room was spotless every day. We ate breakfast every morning in the Laurel room and had the buffet which was included in our package. Really worth it and the food was delicious. Everyone of the staff there was friendly but special thanks to one of the servers, Ben (Hint to the hotel manager - Double what you pay Ben and only give him one day off) Like I said everyone was nice and friendly but Ben gave it extra effort. Then there was the Caffe Cento. A pretty long walk from our room but worth the trip. The coffee was really good and the service was good, especially when Linda was there. She had no idea that we were even staying at the hotel and went well out of her way to help us with service and with a question we had about purchasing some coffee cups from the caffe. (Hint to the hotel manager - double what you pay Linda and have her train all new servers). Now on to the Tonga Room. If you stay at the hotel you can pop your head inside to see what it looks like and maybe even have a drink, but once you see the rain effect you can leave. The food and service left a little to be desired. (Hint to the hotel manager - turn the Tonga room back into an indoor pool) Service and food not so good. If you want better chinese food go to China town but have the hotel make reservations at the R & G Lounge restaurant and ask for the first floor seating. Good food and decent prices. Another recommendation is Johns Grill near Union Square. Food is really good and the ambience was fanatastic especially if your a "Maltese Falcon" or Bogie fan. Nice soft music added a great touch. Then last but not least the Tadech restaurant. A short cable ride on the California line and you're there. No reservations are taken but it's fairly large but you may have to wait a little, but worth it. Great food and service. This was our first time in San Francisco and at a Fairmont Hotel but it won't be our last. If you are planning a trip there be sure to sign up for the President's Club. It's worth it for the extras you get. Then there's the last hint for the Hotel Manager - please put coffee pots in the rooms. Something most travelers have gotten used to expecting.

Reviews.Title: “If you like mold and dirt, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Nominator
Reviews.Content: This time, the doctor booked a balcony suite in San Francisco and hoped for stunning views and a nice grand hotel room. As a first advice, if they offer you "the beautiful Malaya suite", do not take it! Because you pay for the balcony, but you don't get one. The so called "balcony" is covered to 85% in glass, so it's more like a winter garden. As you can see from the outside of the hotel, this balcony is the only one that's limited in that way. But this didn't even make the doctor write this review. He was even willing to not complain about the muffy old room that was quite dusty and should have been remodeled over a century ago... No, what was really embarrassing, was the winter garden/balcony itself. First of all, the balcony had not been cleaned for quite a while and just due to this fact, it was no joy to be out there. The armchairs on the balcony where full of old stains and even mold! So if you wanted to sit down, a muffy, dirty, moldy armchair was set up to your comfort (as you can see on the pictures I uploaded). When I went down to the front desk, to complain only about the armchairs, I didn’t get an apology, but I was ordered to go back to the suite and wait for housekeeping to bring new chairs. After 45 minutes of waiting, I went down again and asked how long housekeeping would need to bring up new chairs, because I didn’t want to spend the whole evening sitting in the suite. Shortly I was told that they told housekeeping to speed up. Again I waited for over 30 minutes, until housekeeping called just to tell me, that they have no new chairs or any other alternative. So for the third time I went down to the front desk and I was offered… nothing. Instead, I was told to “take it or leave it”. So I decided to check out immediately, without even staying a night at the Fairmont. As the pinnacle of bad service, they didn’t offer me help by the bell desk, so I had to carry my luggage all by myself down into the garage. I do not know, what you expect, when you check in at a grand hotel, but this was the lousiest service I ever experienced. What embarrasses me the most is the thing that the personal didn’t seem to be surprised by the fact, that they have moldy chairs and an unsatisfied customer. Overall they just didn’t care. I even contacted Lucas Schumacher (that’s the one who asks for contact when you write a review like this on tripadvisor) and that was no good either. He apologized, of course, and offered to make the San Francisco Fairmont management contact me, but guess what, they never did. I take that as the last proof that they really do not care about the customers they have and strongly advise you, not to book at a Fairmont hotel if you’d like to enjoy proper service. Thanks for reading and apologies for my bad English.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Public Areas is What Makes this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loungesong
Reviews.Content: We live in San Francisco and attended a wedding at the Fairmont. As a treat to ourselves we also stayed the night, in room 434 (old tower). Hotel snobs and Four Seasons aficionados will not be impressed by the rooms. Although we had a nice view towards the Financial District, the window, bedroom and bathroom are small by modern standards. The weather was considerably warmer than usual for SF and the air conditioning was not completely up to par to keep the room comfortable. The bathroom has pretty standard amenities and was small for a hotel at this price point. I wouldn't say the room was sparkling clean. The closet furnishings were dusty and some of the furniture was pretty beat up in places. The bed, however, was very comfortable, and we had no complaints about noise. Most of the sheets seemed pretty new except for a very shabby worn out bottom sheet. With all this being said, the grandeur of the public spaces...the lobby, restaurants, ballrooms, etc. is where this hotel shines. There are always people dressed up--coming and going to some special event that really adds an exclamation point to your own experience here. This is a great hotel to use as a rally point for a group in town for a special event or an anniversary. The upkeep of this property must be nightmarish and I'm sure that's where a lot of your nightly rate goes. The valet (20 minutes to get car), check in (15 minutes with only 2 in front of us) , room service (50 minutes for a 1AM pizza), and breakfast buffet (20 minutes waiting with only 1 party ahead of us) were slow for the price. You can really feel the "union" nature of the staff here. They've been here forever and pretty much perform only to their own personalities. At the same time sometimes I tire of the painted smiles other properties insist on. The breakfast buffet at $30 was better than I expected. The Tonga Room has last call just after midnight which surprised us since it was still quite busy. I would not recommend this hotel for business travel as the services are not really set up for speed and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “A 5* Hotel - living on past glories perhaps?”
Reviews.Author: badgerfrombristol
Reviews.Content: We were originally intending to stay in another hotel near Union Square, but were advised by our travel company of some potential disruption due to strike action. So we had the chance to switch to another hotel - and managed to get what we thought was a great deal - 3 nights for 2 at The Fairmont hotel. Five stars no less, so we thought we were on safe ground. On arrival the staff were pleasant enough, we were shown to our room and within 15 minutes realised we would get no sleep at all - the adjoining room was occupied by a screaming baby. We asked to be moved - and duly were - no complaints there. However many of the rooms have connecting doors - hence you can hear much of what goes on in the next room. On our last night we were 'entertained' by our neighbours playing load 'house' music at 2pm - and on the whole noise was a big problem for us. At 4-5pm you got woken up by what sounds like delivery lorries. At around 7-7:30 pm you get more noise from the staff starting to clean adjoining rooms - very noisey and loud - do they not realise there are guests who might actually be resting? This is a 'historic' hotel - but its not modern - and I would expect to be able to get a decents night sleep in a 5* hotel. Won't be back here anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Belfastgal1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon. Received a free upgrade for our honeymoon to the top floor with stunning views of the city. Room was beautiful, lots of space and very clean. The bathrooms were gorgeous too. Staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. We had to ring reception for a doctor which they sorted out for us very quickly and later on that evening the manager rang to check that we were ok. Really did go above and beyond what was expected. Love it here, would highly recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Character, location, but at a price”
Reviews.Author: bauwens
Reviews.Content: Grand old name, at the best geographical location in San Francisco. Character and history. We enjoy going for traditional places with history. So we loved our two day stay. Got a room on the fifth floor of the old wing, with a view up California. One has to recognize, however, that this comes at a price. A bit of a gap between the heavy door and the frame; plumbing and doors occasionally a bit noisy. Although windows are single pane (same at the Hyatt Fisherman's wharf BTW), and I heard at least one motorcycle in the morning, in the end it turned out to be OK and we did sleep with no problem. Older plumbing worked very well. As to location, it's nice there sitting right on top of the hill, which is why the Fair daughters picked that place up. Some may not find it convenient, since going more or less anywhere will entail walking a couple of blocks up/down the steep hill. OTOH, both Chinatown and the shopping area are very walkable. We even walked to Japantown, but then we are not afraid of a bit of a walk. If going to Fisherman's wharf, the choice is the cable car, which is fun, or a cab. I hesitated between ranking it four or five. Ideally I would have given it a 4.5. Not quite 5 because of these details.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jccatlady
Reviews.Content: It took us 6 hours to get checked in and we were told no adjoining rooms and yet there were. The hotel was beautiful but I dropped a piece of jewlery and found the corners of the room and edges of the carpet to be pretty nasty with bugs and fuzz. They could do better with house cleaning in the rooms and the conference rooms. Located very centrrally and we were able to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Still the grande dame”
Reviews.Author: Tyger41
Reviews.Content: She is still the most magnificent hotel in San Francisco. I prefer the old part. Yes, it is a splurge to stay here. But from the moment you enter that lovely lobby, you are welcome. Little wonder that it was one of Clarence Darrow's favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Our yearly anniversary get away”
Reviews.Author: G-Whz
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here for our anniversary yearly, love the balcony rooms in the original hotel, lovely views and just has that old type yet luxury feel. The beds are great and the bathroom are just wonderful. Usally book a package that includes room service (breakfast) nothing like eating in a robe looking out through the balcony drinking hot coffee on a brisk morning in S.F. This hotel is not cheap, but if you were worried about money, you wouldn't be reading this review. Spend the extra 100 dollars and have a wonderful rather then enjoyable weekend in S.F. The location is great and the service is wonderful !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A++++”
Reviews.Author: cumberlandga
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff are wonderful. We were thrilled with the location, staff and room. Our needs were met with a smile and the staff went out of the way to make sure we had all the info. we needed to take in the sights of SF. If you even looked confused in the lobby, a staff member would ask what they could do to help. We ate at the Laurel Court for breakfast and I loved the fresh fruit smoothies on the buffet. The hotel has it's own garden and we had fresh fruit in the room that was delicious and locally grown. We were in the newer towers with an exceptional view when the fog wasn't there to obstruct it. No fault of the hotel, just summer in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: georgia5213
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this lovely location 4 evenings in late August, 2011. We were staying in this city while attending a convention downtown. The location within the city made it extremely easy to visit all the sought after sites. The trolley car stops were just outside both sides of the hotel. We enjoyed eating breakfast in the Laural Court Restaurant, lunch in the Caffe Cento and dinner in the Tongo Room all the food was beyond compare. I really enjoyed reading about the history of the hotel. Our room was wonderful and the bathroom was supurb.

Reviews.Title: “I left my heart or was it my savings in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: CruiserDeluxe
Reviews.Content: It was anniversary time and as we have for 38 years, my wife and I spent it in San Francisco. Over the years our anniversary pilgrimage to SFO has always been looked forward to. We travel to "the City" as those of us in California often call San Francisco for a weekend of fun and exloration. Upon arrival at the Fairmont we were greeted by William one of the Valet attendents. He couldn't have been more helpful. Our check in was quick and efficient. We even got an instant upgrade (Presidents Club you know) from a room in the original hotel to a larger room in the tower. The room couldn't have been nicer with two exceptions. No robes (the ladies like the robes) and placement next to the elevators was not so great. Maybe we would have been better off in our smaller room in the main building. Since we were there to party what's a little whooshing sound coming from the elevator shaft. Breakfast on Saturday was very nice. $68.00 for two people. Don't you just love hotel food prices! Scrambled eggs and toast and of course coffee was extra. I don't blame the Fairmont as all the big city hotels do the same thing. It's just the principal. No inroom coffee was a bit bothersome as my wife really needs her coffee in the morning as do I. They have a small coffee house outside the hotel and down a hill called Cafe Cento. Fair prices and decent breads and rolls. That's where we had breakfast on our second morning at the Fairmont. Saturday evening we went to see Beach Blanket Babylon a decades old show held in the North Beach area. Lots of fun. We thought we would take a cab but were pleased when the hotel offered to drive us in the hotel car. Nice touch! Sunday came to fast and it was time to checkout which we did with ease. My only real complaint was the hotel parking. $52.00 per night plus $14.00 in taxes. Ouch! Really! Really! The Union square hotels don't charge $66.00 per day for parking. I think I could have hired someone to feed a meter for less. Walking up and down those hills will either kill you or stregthen your heart. I'd like to think it is the later. Goodbye to SFO for this year. We will be back next year for number 39.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic”
Reviews.Author: Alan S
Reviews.Content: Historical charm in a perfect location on Nob Hill. The service and accommodations at The Fairmont are first class, and the breakfast buffet is just what you need to start off a of sight-seeing and walking around town. It is a convenient walking distance to many of the primary tourist destinations as well as right in the middle of several cable car lines. It was a bit of a challenge walking uphill to the hotel in the evening (we chose not to take the cable cars), but it certainly provided some additional exercise. And the views of the city from various parts of the hotel are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - True Luxury, Real San Francisco Experience”
Reviews.Author: MoveableFeastAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my husband on a business trip. Amazing staff, great room, beautiful view. Its close to everything, We will definitely be back. The polynesian restaurant is so nostalgic - my parents used to go there when they were dating in the 60's. The band floats out on a "barge" - just a fun place. We only had a weekend getaway, but this was really, really great.

Reviews.Title: “If you need to stay at the best place in town, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: baylorwhite1
Reviews.Content: I have been to San Francisco several times. There are more great hotels to stay at than you can shake a stick at. You can be comfortable in numerous locations. You choose the Failrmont because it is, simply put, the finest hotel in the city. My wife and I were warmly greeted, and found all elements of the service to be excellent. It was my wife's 30th birthday and the staff went out of their way to make it special for her. I'm a big service guy (as my other reviews indicate) and at the Fairmont service comes first. The rooms are comfortable, well appointed, clean, and well sized. Ultimately, you pay the price for really one reason. When you get off the cable car at powell/california or california/mason, and walk into that grand lobby, you know you are staying at the best. If you don't need to feel that, stay somewhere else, there are plenty of nice places around town.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JOD1501
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of September and were really pleased with the room and facilities. Being really picky, there were no bathrobes provided in our room. The hotel is located at the top of a very steep hill, so not ideal if you're not fit, but taxis are cheap enough (and cheaper than the cable car). We ate in Tonga restaurant in the hotel one night, and were disappointed and would not recommend it. It is a Hawaiian infusion restaurant and the food is very over-priced for what it is (USD25 for a basic stir fry). There are other hotels that are better placed down town or at Fisherman's Wharf if you want to be closer to either of those locations, but I would recommend the Fairmont as it's an iconic hotel - just avoid the restaurant and make the best use of pubic transport/taxis.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: iagray206
Reviews.Content: The reputation of Fairmont is sterling and at first glance it is easy to see why. The lobby is majestic and grand. The high-ceiling rooms are luxurious with well appointed furnishings and bathroom facilities. However, there are some gaps in the service. In our particular case we had booked a room for three which led to the extra occupancy tax (aka wrought). However, the usual queen beds were not supplied. Rather we had a twin or a full at best. Being naive, we assumed this was normal (if inadequate) and requested a roll out bed which was duly supplied and the porter tipped for. We were non plussed to find this facility was then charged at a staggering $35 a night! We protested and were lectured upon the bed sizes in the states. However, subsequent nights spent everywhere from the marriott to the super8 were queen sized in bedding! The receptionist agreed to only charge for one night. In hindsight we should have changed rooms, it would be hard to believe the fairmont was in the business of supplying inferior bedding to a Super8 motel! Furthermore all other accommodation came with complimentary Wi-Fi, the fairmont was inclined to charge $13 a day for this. Finally, no breakfast was included...again, everywhere else the standard toast, cereal, preserves etc was always part of the package. Sorry to bore the reader with details of the particular issues. The Fairmont is lovely, but feels arrogant in it's service standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great use of our Disney Vacation Club Points”
Reviews.Author: russell-benoit
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is beautiful, historic, in a great location, and has wonderful friendly staff. The food on the (granted expensive) breakfast buffet was wonderful, and we all ate too much of it. The view from the rooftop garden is beautiful on a clear day. We were on the 22nd floor, and had an unbelieveable view from our room. We kept the curtains open at night because it was just so beautiful to look at. San Francisco was our night light. We got great recommendations from the staff on places to eat within walking distance...a local small Italian restaurant around the corner (very good!), a restaurant down the hill in Chinatown. The Fairmont is within easy walking distance of Union Square (Nike Store a hit with our teenage boys) which has more restaurants as well. A staff member heard me asking in the hotel shop if they had earplugs, because one of our sons was snoring. The shop didn't have earplugs, but he volunteered to bring us some (for no charge)...and made it back to our room with 8 sets before we arrived. We had a car, and were doing a lot of in and out...the valets were friendly, knowledgeable,gave good directions, and the car always arrived quickly. My only complaint was that they told us breakfast was free when we checked in, but didn't tell us it was only free for two of the four of us. We had to straighten that out at the front desk. Still overall, it was a great use of our Disney Vacation Club points.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the 38 year wait!”
Reviews.Author: Unicorn50
Reviews.Content: I had always dreamed of staying at the Fairmont since I was a little girl, and it lived up to all my expectations. From arriving, the helpful door staff took my luggage and it was delivered promptly to my room. Check in was a delight and fast! With a suprise of an upgrade to the 21st floor of the tower with dual aspect windows over looking SF. Nothing was too much trouble and the concierge staff and Bell team friendly and answered all my questions with humour and knowledge. I had a beautiful chocolate box delivered courtesy of the hotel with a super letter welcoming me to the hotel. A truly memorable trip and worth waiting for.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: Adkitz
Reviews.Content: There are too many choices in his area for this hotel to charge for wifi and for access to the fitness room. I travel to San fran all the time and I will avoid this one and go back to the smaller hotels with the same size rooms but I get free wifi and fitness access

Reviews.Title: “Historic Dump - Only lobby is nice”
Reviews.Author: CloudTraveler13
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to SF for years...first time to stay at fairmont....so disappointed as it is a beautiful historic hotel, but rooms are not updated compared to similar categories hotel and staff does has no care about treating customers right.....multiple room change requests were given the same response..."if we change your room it's going to be as bad or worse as the one your in right now" ......never going waste my companies money or my time here again! Wish I had my $300 back...punch me in the stomach next time and take half my money, at least I can keep the other half!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Amber J
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the fairmont but beware the charge to park your car is 70/day. The hotel is gorgeous and the rooms are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: Hopefullylost
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first couple days of my honeymoon and was generally underwhelmed with the hotel. While the location is great, and the view from our room was great too, the over all experience was very bland and forgettable and the service of the doormen/bellmen was terrible. Upon arrival two bellmen actually watched us haul our suitcases up the drive and through the doors without even an offer of assistance. Not impressed. Overall, I left with the impression that this is a good business hotel, or if you are a senior citizen but if you are looking for more personal service and an overall more San Fran experience, spend you money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A great sanctuary in the middle of San Francisco but please drop the Breakfast Cover Charge”
Reviews.Author: TheRoadWarrior_69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont to attend the Salesforce.com Dreamforce Conference, and found it to be a great place to get away from the crowds and relax after the shock-and-awe experience of the conference. The front desk staff is truly outstanding, they worked with my travel plans beforehand, allowed me to check in early after a very late night/early morning flight, and were gracious. The problems I have with this hotel are as follows: 1. Breakfast Cover Charge - OK, it is not really a coverage charge, but gratuity is AUTOMATICALLY included in your breakfast tab if you eat in their dining room. Mine was $4.50 and all I ordered was a simple, middle-priced omelet. It gets better, there is also a BREAKFAST SURCHARGE - yes that's right, there is a charge just for eating in that hallowed dining room. Never heard of such a thing. Don't eat breakfast in the dining room unless you are own-your-won GulfStream rich or you have an amazingly high per diem for reimbursement of dining on the road. 2. Ray the bellman, you need an attitude adjustment hour. Customers make paychecks possible, they are not there to be ordered around.

Reviews.Title: “Expected 5 star, felt like 4 star....”
Reviews.Author: Ice_Weasel
Reviews.Content: Beautiful building. Excellent shower. Comfortable room. I was however disappointed in the following areas: * No refrigerator in the room for personal items. The mini-bar fridge has a sensor so anything thing removed is automatically charged to your room account. No space in the fridge for your personal drinks, candy, medicines. * No coffee or team making facilities in the room. There is a public coffee shop on the parking garage level in the basement. I have never stayed in a hotel / motel anywhere before that didn't have complimentary tea / coffee making facilities in the room * There is an ice bucket in the room and two ice-making machines on each floor. The two on our floor (6th) did not work. I walked to the 5th floor and found one of the two machines on that floor to be working. * The tariff did not include a complimentary breakfast, continental or otherwise. Shouldn't have been a surprise, but again every other hotel / motel I have ever stayed had at least a complimentary continental breakfast included. * Noisy. Other guests closing doors and talking in the hallway were loud, both early morning and late at night. * On checking in we were asked if we needed help with our luggage (we didn't) and then directed to the elevator. At a 5 star hotel I expect to have a porter take my luggage regardless and escort us to our room. Upon arrival the porter should place the suitcase on the stand and spend a moment explaining the features and amenities in the room. * Any staff I spoke to were courteous and helpful. But unless I spoke to them it was as though we didn't exist. No-one contacted us to check we were satisfied with our room, enjoying our stay, or if we had any questions. Even when we checked out, we were not asked if we had enjoyed our stay. I got the impression that the hotel did not care that we were there or satisfied. * Upon arrival we opened our own taxi door, hauled our own luggage up the steps, opened our own door into the lobby and found our own way to the check-in counter. I am quite capable of all this, but I expect more from a supposed "5 star" hotel. So it was a comfortable stay and central to many of the attractions in the San Francisco area. The issues I have described above did not detract from us enjoying our vacation. But for value I will be staying somewhere else next time I am in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary stay- very good, but not stellar”
Reviews.Author: jandollar
Reviews.Content: This was a first stay for us, and we were celebrating our 35 th anniversary. They were kind enough to upgrade our room to a Signature Tower King, with sweeping views of the bay. This was not a huge upgrade, just the next step above what we already paid for. While it was only the 5th floor, the view was indeed magnificent with a large picture window. We had unobstructed views od Coit Tower, Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, and beyond. Then the fog rolled in, giving us a view of gray. But, we can't fault the Fairmont for that. Plus, as the night wore on, some of the fog lifted and we could take in the city lights. Even only 5 floors up, we were far enough away from street noise for the most part. We could hear the clanging of the cable car bells (they run on both California and Mason Streets, so two sides of the hotel get the effect). But, they do not run that often, and we like the sound of the cable cars. We could not hear the grinding of the cables or the screeching of the brakes, so that was good! The room was spacious even though it was not a suite, and we liked the decor. Too bad there was no telescope in the room and the window was soert of dirty. The bed was comfy and we were able to connect my iPad to the LCD TV to watch Netflix movies. We were disappointed to find we were given a handicap room (no we didn't ask for one), which in this hotel means no bathtub and no shower stall. Yep, this was the full "roll in" shower with a seat accessible by wheel chair. Sort of like a hospital shower, made fancy with marble tiles. Not my idea of romance, but by the time we discovered it, we were unpacked and relaxing. Otherwise, I would have asked for a different room. I had read other reviews, so I knew to look out for this, but the mini-bar goodies are "wired" to be automatically charged to your room as soon as you pick them up. So no looky-loos on the snacks and drinks. They have them set up on a little teeter totter thing that senses the change in weight, and there literally is a wire coming from the pad to behind the TV. The one out in the open even has a little teddy bear in a box, I guess to attract any kids you may have brought along. There is another in the top drawer of the armoire with more snacks. You'd thing there'd be a warning sign on this attractive nusiance, but no. There must have been a price list somewhere, but I did not dig around for it. I didn't even open the fridge to see what was in there. I would think at the rates they charge, they could just have housekeeping keep tabs. Room service was expensive, as expected, but they add 20% gratuity, plus $5 service charge (as opposed to the more typical 15-18%). That said, we had room service for breakfast ($54 for two), and we were pleased with our meal. We had one order each of strawberries, mangoes and banana bread (house made), and a full pot of coffee. There were two large slices of the banana bread, plenty for two people. Sure, we paid more than we would in the Laurel Court restaurant downstairs, but we got to enjoy our million dollar view with our breakfast this way. We had dinner in the Tonga Room, early before the band began because we wanted to be able to talk during dinner. Rather than ordering entrees, we each had seared opa salads, shared an appetizer platter, and a side of fried "shaka" rice. We were given a volcano dessert complimentary for our anniversary. We had read that the food was not very good, but we enjoyed what we ordered very much. We loved the kitchy feel and the fake thunderstorms. The decor was well thout out and not at all tacky. Better than Trader Vic's I think. We got a poolside seat, so when it rained, we actually felt a cooling breeze from the falling water. If you cannot suspend your disbelief to enjoy the fun, I guess you are a snob or depressed. Whatever. The location was very nice, even with the very steep hills (the better to walk off those spring rolls!). We arrived by Bart from the East Bay, getting off at the Embarcadero Station. The Powell Station is closer, but they say the hill is steeper. We had lunch in the Financial District before walking up through Chinatown and on up Nob Hill. Since we were staying only one night, we only needed a small overnight bag each. So, overall, we thought the SF Fairmont was classy, historic, and memorable. But, it was not a perfect stay (handicap bathroom).

Reviews.Title: “Nice, fancy hotel”
Reviews.Author: facebook6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night. Very impressed. Great attention to detail, clean rooms, most important to me was the clean bathroom. And that's not expected from a hotel. Bed was super comfortable. Down side was no refridgerator in the room, no pool if your taking little ones, and no shuttle. take walking shoes ladies, not flip flops! Its a nice walk down to pier 39 but definently need a cab back up those steep hills. Taxi to union square is cheaper than the cable car. We paid $6 to get to the shops! Take an ice chest with your drinks. We will stay again, soon!

Reviews.Title: “I'm paying $230 a night and wake up to slamming doors and chatty neighbors each morning?”
Reviews.Author: Vinsured
Reviews.Content: Yes the title sounds a bit harsh, but it honestly ruined my whole experience at the Fairmont. It's beautiful historic hotel, a touch of class at every turn. The standard rooms are small but this is SF and that's how rooms are, but they are clean comfortable and have one of the best showers i've ever used....but the noise.... The rooms have large thick wooden doors, very classy but very annoying starting at 7am each day when people enter and exit. When the door slams it echoes throughout the hall. And for as thick as they are they are very soundproof. I could hear housekeeping and other patrons clearly right through the door. I also had a room with a door that was shared with another room (a split if someone got it) I could hear couple next door talking clearly as if i was in the room with them. Even better when they left and you could hear housekeeping vacuum and clean as if they were next to your bed. Like i said, it's beautiful and historic. But for the price I'd expect a quiet peaceful morning. I'll go elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Historic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mollymhoon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I like to spoil ourselves on every trip and go over the top with an amazing hotel for one night. This trip to northern California had us staying at the Fairmont. We love historic hotels and the Fairmont did not disappoint! The architecture is exquisite and something that you can't find anymore in newer hotels. We stayed in the original part of the hotel (per our request) and loved it. It was on the top floor and had 14 foot ceilings. All of the furniture and architecture was exactly what I was expecting for a hotel of that era in San Francisco. It was very comfortable on top of it all. Our room also had an amazing view of Alcatraz and the bay. We wandered all around the hotel and were struck by its beauty. If you have a true appreciation for history and architecture, you should stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: jndscuba
Reviews.Content: We booked the room online 4 months in advance. Upon arrival, it was not the room as described on the internet. There had been previous calls to the hotel itself confirming what the room looked like. It was a suite they originally tried to put us in but the layout was different from the suite we booked online. Management did tell us that each room was different and reiterated multiple times that this was an older hotel (does that mean unclean?). The room they tried to place us in was dirty. The carpet was dirty and the patio had obviously had many pigeons roosting the night before. Management was not interested in making things right, even though we talked with two managers and called their headquarters by phone. Management even agreed that the photo on the internet was not the same room (bait and switch) We had never been treated with such careless and "take it or leave it" attitudes. The lobby was adequate, although, some couches were stained. The service in the restaurant was slow and the food was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...away from the hustle and bustle.”
Reviews.Author: nrsimmons
Reviews.Content: Just got back from three nights at The Fairmont San Francisco. I stayed here with my three year old daughter. A short little vacation for the two of us. We stayed in the Zanzibar Suite, room 436. The room had a balcony and was very clean. I do not have any names, but the staff was very, very, very, very nice and went out of their way to help me in anyway they could. The hotel is located in Nob Hill which is away from all of the major SF landmarks. Not far, but just a chore because we had to take the car out anytime we wanted to go somewhere. I'd advise walking the city and the area around the hotel if you are up for it. Beware! The hotel is situated in an abnormally hilly part of SF. Since I know my three year old gets tired easily, driving our rental car was the only option. Another beware...valet parking at the hotel is $52 per night! Yikes! I knew this going into it, but I'm just giving everyone else a heads up. Overall, this was a fantastic hotel in San Francisco. I'd definitely stay here again and I will recommend it to family and friends. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Classic luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelloverLondon
Reviews.Content: We ended our US trip with three nights at the Fairmont. The hotel has an impressive lobby, excellent service, well appointed rooms and good restaurants. The concierge service was really helpful - they booked us tickets to see Beach Blanket Babylon (highly recommended) and a table at a R&G Lounge in China Town (good quality food). We ate at the Tonga Room in the hotel on our last evening - this was a really good fun restaurant with live music and even 'rainstorms' at regular intervals. One of the corridors from the main lobby has interesting history about the hotel - well worth a quick look. The only problem was that the hotel is right at the top of the hill - so quite a climb!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: holidayheaven53
Reviews.Content: Grand old hotel right at the top of the hill with lovely views and its great climbing up and down the hill or you can get the cable car right outside. We were welcomed into the hotel and checked in very quickly our room was in the older part of the hotel and was huge!! we had a nice view and a big bathroom, some of the furnishingf was a bit shabby and maybe could be replaced but the bedding and the towells were spotless and the beds comfortable. All of the staff inculding the cleaners bar staff and bellboys(especially Earl) were always smiling very helpful and informative. Sanfrancisco is a wonderful city and I will stay at the Fairmont when I next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vin004
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, historic hotel. I've stayed here twice. The room in the new tower was very nice with stunning views of the city. The room in the main hotel was just ok and a bit of a let down after the tower. I will insist on a tower room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby but that's about all!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaE
Reviews.Content: Booked for our honeymoon based on the Fairmont reputation. The room was average- no coffee making facilities, small bathroom. The shower was appalling, nothing more than a pathetic drip, as a woman with long hair it made washing it a nightmare! You could hear the hot water pipes banging from other guestrooms. I've stayed in many high end hotels worldwide with work for the last ten years, this was a let down. The location was ok if you didn't mind the 3 very steep hills back from union square- you do expect this inSan Fran but there are better located properties for the Union Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Classical Elegance atop Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: easytraveller68
Reviews.Content: I saw the Fairmont years ago when I had previously visited the city and decided that I would stay there when I finally made it back to San Francisco. I was not disappointed at all. It is a beautiful hotel that is in immaculate condition. With the exception of a disappointing check in the staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean surprisingly spacious given the age of the hotel, and the beds and pillows were the most comfortable I have ever experienced in a hotel. The location is also nice in that it is very quiet at night and the views of the city are wonderful....note: We also stayed at a hotel in Union Square and could not get any sleep for all the noise at night. Things to note: The hotel itself is located at the top of Nob Hill and as such do not expect to walk from the hotel to the wharf or any other locations in the downtown area from the hotel...it is simply too steep. Also, don't expect to take the cable car which stops very nearby the hotel. Every time it went by, it was jam packed with tourists and would not stop to let people on. We tried walking further down the route in the hopes of getting on sooner but had no luck. Thankfully cab rides are not expensive in the city and we ended up spending only a small amount more than if we had bought an all day transit pass and did not have to wait the 45 min to an hour for a cable car. If you stay at the Fairmont make sure you grab dinner one night at the Nob Hill cafe which is only two blocks away. Fantastic authentic Italian food at good prices and you do not have to travel into the city for once....just be prepared to wait outside for a long time for a table.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else, please”
Reviews.Author: Cardigan_kitsch
Reviews.Content: The one thing that you expect from a hotel is that you can sleep and that's where the fairmont really fails. I could go on about the location and grand entrance hall but the bottom line is that my husband and I had 3 terrible nights here. The room was small, the bed was tiny (smaller even that our double bed at home) however it was the thin walls that were the real issue. You could hear people in the corridoor and the elevator sounds clearly. On top of this the walls between the rooms were so flimsy that we were woken up by the sound of the people in the next room turning their lightswitches on and off! We could hear every single word that they said to each other too which felt like an invasion of their privacy. Even with the loud air con unit we could hear every room around us the entire night. When we mentioned this at checkout the lady behind the desk was not at all fussed about our poor experience which was a real let down since it was our honeymoon. Save your money and go somewhere else. What is the point of a hotel if you can't sleep there? The fairmont is not fit for purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of a great architecture”
Reviews.Author: Pabs_HK
Reviews.Content: Great exterior facade as well as for the lobby and outlets. The rooms are a dive; service is sh1t. Never staying here again ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great! A 4.5”
Reviews.Author: 1ColetteMarie
Reviews.Content: We went through work but it was 99% leisure. Entering the hotel was amazing with the architecture and large, gold pillars. The rooms were very nice, especially the up-to-date bathroom. Great view from the room and very quiet. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. It's doable to walk down to the pier from the hotel. My only complaints -- the carpet could use a good cleaning and every day after housekeeping cleaned we would find multiple hairs in the bathroom that clearly didn't belong to us. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Of course it's pricey but loved the history and service”
Reviews.Author: MBradbury33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to San Francisco for a couples get-away weekend and had a fabulous time. We had a chance meeting with my sister-in-law who lives in Denver but was in SF for a Napa marathon. She FourSquared at the Tonga Room when we were returning from Chez Panisse and we spent the rest of the night having beverages there and in the main lobby bar. The next morning we had coffee in the hotel's pastry shop and we jumped a trolly car for Fishermans Wharf and an Alcatraz tour. This hotel is historic, beautiful, fun, and centrally located to everywhere you'd want to be. I can't complain about the price because I just expected it since it was in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Redonkulous
Reviews.Content: Historic hotel without the stodginess. The fitness center was excellent. It's actually a private gym adjacent to the hotel that we were able to use by signing up for some membership program (free). That also gave us free in-room WiFi. The rooms were clean, quiet, and moderate-sized. But the real draw was the location-- steps away from the cable car stop, and a couple of blocks walk to Chinatown. Tons of great SF restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Your paying for a name”
Reviews.Author: TravelFoodBeachFun
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Hotel San Francisco The hotel is a 4 star hotel that I got at the rate of $207.00. Rates went up to $695. Parking was $52.00 p/n & breakfast in the main café in the mhotel is $30 per person. No coffee in the room so you are forced to purchase in one of the cafes. There is a $!5.00 charge to use the fitness center. My partner used the sauna and was very disappointed in how dirty it was, old and had broken fixtures. He has planned on showering & getting ready down there after his steam but couldn’t bear it. No free wifi unless you are a President’s Club member (I am but forgot to tell them at check in). Show them your foursquare check in & free room upgrade if available. The room 259 has no view. Because of my rate, I got this terrible view. I tried to change it but it was going to be $30-$75. The hotel was almost sold out so, they couldn’t upgrade. The room has very large ceilings, a walk in closet, small counter space in bathroom but it’s nice. I wouldn’t come back here if I was just using the room. The hotel is gorgeous otherwise and very historical. Be sure to go on a Wednesday so you can go to the Tonga Room which has a pool in the middle of the restaurant. The hotel is in a great location, 3 blocks down from China Town. We ate a R&N Lounge which was very busy and had good food, especially their spareribs. It’s located 25 minutes from the SFO Airport and about 15 minutes from the Golden Gate Bridge. There are two Fairmont Hotels, the other is in Ghiradelli Square and is three times the rate.

Reviews.Title: “breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: wanatue
Reviews.Content: people wait on you in an instant, front desk personel were very professinal and the place is just breathtaking, it has class and we could tell that is the way they keep it. We had a room overlooking the city and could see Alkatraz. This is a place we will never forget. If you like older hotels this is a classic, I checked out the history before we arrived and the place has alot of things that have happened and very famous people that have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO”
Reviews.Author: david s
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby, But beware Tonga Bar room is a joke, Buffett you can get a Jack in box, no replys from management on complaints, even room upgrades as promised, Presidents club is a Joke. Hotel is for sale and you wonder why? Tower Rest is closed and food needs a lot of help. Housekeeping very clean beds and towels. Front desk needs training on how to fix the bill when checking out, over one hour to correct 600.00 in over charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great classy historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: scubanini
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love to stay in hotels with a history. The Fairmont has been the host to every celebrity and political leader for the last one hundred years, the pictures lining the foyers are like a trip back in time! We we impressed with the great conceige.We had a beautiful room with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious hotel - beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: NZkiwiGAL
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the one used in the 1980's tv series "Hotel" Our room was beautiful and felt almost opulent. Bed was very comfortable. Separate bathroom was beautiful (marble floor and nice fittings) Everything was top notch. No coffee making facilities etc in the room though as I suppose being such a flash hotel they would expect that you don't want to make your own coffee but would want it made for you. There is a restaurant downstairs and a cafe serving nice coffee. A lovely surprise is the Free coffee they supply in the foyer between 4:30am - 7:00 am each morning for the guests that jog or go to the gym etc. Nice touch for us as one day we left early (6:15am) for a coach tour. Wi fi free only if you join up to their Presidents Club which was very easy to do. Location is ok... at the top of a hill (Nob Hill) so is easy to walk down to Chinatown etc, but you wouldn't want to walk back up! (Too steep) We cab'd to Fishermans Wharf as its a bit of a walk. All staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: B-CRoamWorld
Reviews.Content: This centrally located hotel was great and out of the hustle and bustle of some of the City's other districts. The public rooms were very comfortable and really enjoyed the palm court bar including the service and food at the bar. Note that this is the place to get a late night snack after the other restaurants have closed

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: crs10257
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, it was a great stay. The staff was always pleasant, the views were amazing, the bed was comfortable. Only 2 minor complaints; we couldn't get the room cold enough. I always like my room at about 60, but if you don't mind 65 or above then it's fine. The 2nd was the Tonga room, very outdated, food was just so-so. However the lead female singer was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but will try somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: Stephbuttonmoon
Reviews.Content: Was worth staying there because of the history of the hotel but a little expensive for what you get. We were in rooms in the new part of the hotel which could have been anywhere. On our next visit September 2012 we're gonna try somewhere different. Great photos in the halls of stars past and present who have stayed there. And to think Andy Bennett first sang "I left my heart in San Fransico" in the Venetian room at the hotel. You have Huntington Park opposite on Nob Hill is great to grab a coffee and people watch. Right opposite that you have Grace Cathedral, also this hotel is right on the line for Cable cars.

Reviews.Title: “Classic luxury atop nob hill!”
Reviews.Author: Theresafromnorway
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 19-24th Dec 2010. Originally booked a suite in the more modern Dobson tower, but it wasn't possible to open a window, so I moved to a deluxe room in the older part of the hotel. My room looked out over San Francisco Bay. I couldn't see Golden Gate Bridge, but I had a wonderful view if Coit Tower and could see Alcatraz in the distance. I had stayed at the Fairmont once before, in June 1991, when I was living in Morganhill, for the weekend, as I was running San Francisco marathon. I remember promising myself I would go back some day for a vacation. 20 years on, the Fairmont did not disappoint! The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas, with a HUGE tree and a full-size gingerbread house! People were coming into the foyer from the street, just to have their photo taken beside the tree. There was a feeling of being part of an olde worlde setting, in plush, beautiful surroundings, where service was given with effortless ease. The breakfast buffet was amazong, with a wide range of choice to suit every taste, and the letter of welcome in the room on arrival was a lovely touch. The concierge was knowledgeable and extremely helpful, and the whole experience was just unforgettable. If you are looking for a modern, impersonal place to stay, don't stay here. But if you are looking for something classic and special, with more than a hint of luxury, and you fancy stepping into the splendour of bygone San Francisco, then the Fairmont is the place for you. Would go back in a heartbeat - and intend to do so next year!

Reviews.Title: “My second time there but not my last!”
Reviews.Author: nellymty
Reviews.Content: I went last January to attend a Meeting but I also took my husband with me to enjoy the city of San Francisco. The hotel architecture is wonderful and a place to visit even if you are not staying there. The first time I stayed here I booked through Hotels.com and got a great spacious room in the main building. This time we got a small king size bed room but I asked if there were any other available room and immediately another room, with not a nice view but bigger. I also got the chance to see a room of a fellow who got a room in the tower and that was a view! Even it is not that close from Union square and is really uphill, you can always take a cable car and enjoy the ride! The service was amazing, they were always helpful and they got a rental car company in the building. The restaurant was great, I just had breakfast and asked for room service also. Regarding my business trip,The meeting was held there and meeting rooms are spacious and well equipped. If your planning to go sight seeing buy a card that includes muni and cable cars for the days you are staying., it is so worth the value! You can buy this card at Union square of in the Tourists Information office.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, would probably try the Mandarin the next time”
Reviews.Author: Wilderpoland
Reviews.Content: Pros Great view and location, Nice rooms, Cons Valet parking very expensive Slow check in No free wifi Would have rated higher but they missed cleaning our room the first day of three. When I called reception the lady was unfriendly and unhelpful, made it out to be my issue that we must have had the do not disturb sign out. Hotel gave wifi for free, which was not enough, as you can get free wifi signing up to join the Presidents Club.

Reviews.Title: “Living on past history”
Reviews.Author: Wakefield_Kid
Reviews.Content: The is a beautiful looking hotel, however the rooms are dated and can be noisy especially on the larger floors with constant slamming doors throughout the night. The tower section has less rooms which are quieter and larger with improved modernisation. The staff however are les than accommodating, the bell and concierge staff are the most arrogant and ruddiest hotel staff I have ever met . Overall I would say this hotel is living on past history with standards no longer met making it over expensive for the quality of rooms and service provided

Reviews.Title: “I have no idea why anyone gives this hotel 4 stars.”
Reviews.Author: AKN_10
Reviews.Content: Where to begin. The hotel is dated, overpriced, and tacky. I felt like I was staying in the hotel from The Shining. The rooms are falling apart--none of the appliances work, and my sink and shower were clogged. Seriously, I didn't want to touch anything because it all looked dirty. The closet is weird, too. I called to ask for laundry bags, which they said they couldn't do. Seriously, no plastic bags? They have those at a Motel 6. You hear every door open and close in the hallway. I would never EVER stay here again. Pay a little more and stay at the Four Seasons. You won't feel disgusted every time you walk into your room. Oh, and they screwed up my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel for exploring San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Zeusco
Reviews.Content: Situated on the top of Nob Hill this hotel still retains the grandeur of bygone years and the entrance lobby is well worth seeing if you are in the vicinity. We stayed here for a few days before driving north through Oregon and Washington State into Canada. Our room in the Tower had views out to Alcatraz and we would sit watching dusk fall over the Bay as the lights came on each evening. Hotel service was impeccable and our room was well appointed with a huge bathroom. Strong leg muscles are an advantage as the surrounding hills are very steep but Fisherman's Wharf is only a twenty minute stroll downhill and there are two cable car lines to bring you back at the end of the day. Union Square and Chinatown are ten minutes stroll away and there is valet parking available. We would recommend booking tickets for Alcatraz well in advance of a visit and enjoyed taking the ferry trip across the Bay to Sausalito and climbing to the top of Coit Tower to get wonderful views of our favourite city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: MohammedUAE
Reviews.Content: After a long trip we are glad to have stayed in the Fairmont, location was good, service was nice they looked after us, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: melsatchfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while we were in San Fransisco for our honeymoon. When you walk in, the sights (lavish decor) and smells (flowers galore) are very impressive. However, once we got past the initial beauty of the hotel, we found that it's beauty is only skin deep. We were nickel and dimed for just about everything here, our door had a finicky lock that only seemed to work well when an employee tried it, and the room had an odd layout, like they had tried to update it in the cheapest way possible. I will say, the service staff was very friendly and helpful. There is nothing terribly wrong with this hotel, only that it doesn't make you feel special or important, the way that a smaller boutique hotel could do. For instance, when reserving hotel rooms, we told everyone of them we would be on our honeymoon. Every hotel but this one put a bottle of champagne in our room upon arrival. Maybe this place is okay if you are on a business trip or if you have a lot of money to throw around, but it seems that it's corporate nature has made it too big.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: robertogiammanco
Reviews.Content: really confortable, nuce room, wonderfull hall. Lovely breakfast and perfect service. Go to the last floor, there is a wonderful view.

Reviews.Title: “quintessential San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaMom2boys
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel for enjoying everything San Fran has to offer! Spectacular views, amazing history, beautiful comfortable spacious rooms, lavish lobby, great bar. I really can't think of a bad thing to say. We were upgraded to a room with a view of the entire city, I could have just spent our weekend sitting at the window of our room! Yes, it's on a hill, so is the entire city! Just jump on the trolley car to get where you want to go, it's right outside. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in a prestige location but disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: K8tylou
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon. the reception and lobby are very grand. the breakfast was fab, lots to choose from. location in Nob Hill is great as only a short walk to most areas. would definately recommend. only downside was our standard room was small.

Reviews.Title: “Old Gem..Jem”
Reviews.Author: barking1RedondoBeach
Reviews.Content: Make sure you stay in the Tower Rooms, the old part is charming but not at all modern plus the views from the tower is much better. Had High Tea next to the Harp which was great. Great location close to many fine restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hilltop retreat”
Reviews.Author: Fredtheneedle57
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days here as a base for attending the four Wagner Ring Cycle operas at San Francisco Opera House. It was pretty close to a perfect hotel for us. It was built by the Fair sisters (their actual name) around 1900, using their father's silver-mining money, and is the first of the Fairmont chain. It survived the great earthquake of 1904, largely because it was built on solid rock, so you can sleep easy in your bed! It has a classic exterior and interior, and was beautifully restored by the famous California architect Julia Morgan (who also designed the Hearst Castle, San Simeon). The lobby is one of the greatest in the world, and worth a look even if you don't stay there, built of solid honey-coloured marble (real not faux). The breakfast room/bar has been restored back to its gorgeous original state, although the stained-glass domes no longer let in external light. There are several delightful 1930s murals illustrating circus acts in the Circus Room (an old bar I think). There is a large roof garden with palm trees etc from which one can see Fisherman's Wharf and Alcatraz. They have their own bee colony! There is a Polynesian-style bar which is a famous SF nightspot and has been around a long time (more than 60 years I think). Many presidents and other dignitaries have stayed at the hotel, and some of these occasions are shown in a photo gallery. The original charter of the League of Nations was signed here. The hotel is probably the highest structure in San Francisco, on what is called "Nob Hill", yet it is only 2 blocks to Chinatown, and a 20 minute walk to Union Square or the Ferry Terminal. Two cable car lines and several bus lines stop within a block of the hotel. We went to some fabulous restaurants, not too far away, of which the top three were 1.Masa's, 2.Michael Mina and 3.Jardiniere (the latter being conveniently close to the Opera House). The Slanted Door (modern Vietnamese fusion) in the Ferry Building also gets honourable mention (and is much less expensive). We breakfasted in the hotel every day: although it is a tad expensive, we thought the fine food and service and the relaxed setting were well worth it, and they don't mind if you linger and read a paper or do a crossword. Top museum visits were MOMA and the Museum of Asian Art, both must-sees for culture hounds.

Reviews.Title: “Short trip to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: mtangulo
Reviews.Content: Nice "high end" hotel, slow check in, nice polite staff, good location, No coffee maker in room. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pjb75
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with gorgeous views of the bay! Friendly staff, good service, good location. This was our second visit to San Francisco and our second stay at the Fabulous Fairmont! Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Go on, treat yourself!”
Reviews.Author: hughmason
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were meeting up with a couple of very standing friends. They came from Australia and we came from England. Lots of our friends who had visited san Francisco before suggested nice hotels, but we settled on The Fairmont for no particular reason. When we arrived, it was just such a lovely experience, the lobby is a good size and old fashioned enough to be opulent. Our friends arrived from Australia at 11am, not a good time as the hotel would not allow them to enter their room until 3pm, a real minus point for anyone travelling long distances and needing a rest and something the hotel should address, it is very off putting to be so tired and denied a room for 4 hours! Other than that, the hotel is a great experience. The rooms are well furnished with all the amenities you could need and the breakfast dining on a par with anywhere else i have stayed in around the world at this price. We did not eat our evening meal there so i cannot comment, but one place to dine in San Francisco and must not be missed under any circumstances is Gary Danco's, but book weeks before your trip as it is fully booked every night without fail, in fact, book there for every evening, the menu is so comprehensive it would take a month to try everything. Back to The Fairmont. Situated at the top of Nob Hill and with cablecar access right outside the door going to Union Square or Fishermans Wharf or Golden Gate Park, it's positioning is perfect. Just one thing to try during the day, hire a bicycle and cross The Golden Gate Bridge, carry on to Sausalito and catch the ferry back to Fishermans Wharf, but put on sun block on your face as the wind, even a gentle breeze, can give you a very red face in the morning. Next day try the Natural History Museum in the G G Park, between the museum and walking in the park, that could be a 2 dayser, but go there on a trolley bus, it stops right outside gate 8. Union Square shopping is great (if you like shopping) and Chinatown is another experience. Lombard Street has to be walked down, just to say you have done it, and walk back to the hotel sometimes just to work up an apetite for afternoon tea and a shower before taking the cablecar to Gary Danko. You can tell my trip to The Fairmont was such a joy, the bed was out of this world too, mind you, I would have been dissappointed if it wasn't!

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont is history - great history”
Reviews.Author: MCHBurgess
Reviews.Content: After 20 years, we returned to San Fran to celebrate our honeymoon trip of 1991. Where we had stayed in a small boutique hotel the first time, our graduation to the top of the hill (Knob HIll) was absolutely outstanding. This is the original Fairmont. Elegant, rococo, sophisticated. The hallways are lined with the pictorial history of the hotel, and we got a slight shiver from the romance and the passion of a great hotel with millions of stories to tell. The rooms are equally charming. The front desk and concierge smooth and polished. We knew nothing of the Tonga Room when we arrived. In fact, just going for a walk around the block, we chanced upon a side door near the rear of the hotel. Peeked in. A south seas motif, with a large pool of blue water in the middle. It reminded us of the Polynesian Room at the old Ports of Call in Toronto in the 60's crossed with the Tiki Room at Disneyland. It promised a bit of fun, and likely tourist food to boot. Wrong on one front. It WAS fun, the place was packed, and the food was marvellous. And at 9 pm, the reflecting pool (for that's what we thought it was) came alive with music and a band floated along it on some kind of barge. As it turns out, the Tonga Room is the old basement swimming pool area which, in the 50's, had a cafe added around it, so that bathers could stay poolside and enjoy a bite and a drink. This was such a successful idea that the restaurant was expanded and the pool became a thematic centrepiece instead of a place to swim. The Tonga Room is actually famous, and maps of San Fran show it - without mentioning the name Fairmont. Although it's atop Knob Hill, and the streets in every direction are steeply downhill, the rear of the hotel is on Powell Street, and you can catch a cable car right there to go either downtown or to the wharf area. In the third direction you can get a cable car on California to take you to the Pier 1 area on the Embarcadero. If you're inclined (or 'disinclined') you can walk along Powell down to the wharf area and it's all downhill all the way to the water and an Irish Coffee at Buena Vista. We have enjoyed many Fairmonts around the world, but this is the Old Lady and she is a beautiful Grande Dame.

Reviews.Title: “best in p-town”
Reviews.Author: jerrydor
Reviews.Content: has it all! the resort is so clean has pool bars ,great view,great staff

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Great view”
Reviews.Author: desertdad67
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a tower room, very spacious and clean. Our room had a fantastic view. Check in was fast and the desk staff friendly. Our beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping left us 3 towels each day, even though there were 4 in our room. So each night we had to call for another. The towel was always promptly delivered. The location of the hotel on Nob Hill was good for exploring the city. Mere blocks to Union Square and Chinatown, also on the corner of a trolley stop. No problem getting a cab either--they were plentiful outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: JaneStoller
Reviews.Content: As most Fairmont properties this hotel had excellent service and has the best location.

Reviews.Title: “Great job Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: R_Cog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont in SF as the first stop of our Honeymoon, and we were so well looked after. We were very kindly greeted, and after a long flight (diverted to Sacramento, don't ask!) we were very impressed and grateful to be upgraded to an amazing Tower King room. We had a great view, down towards the Financial District. The room was immaculate, spacious and just perfect. Our bags were brought up, an ice bucket was readied... We had breakfast twice in the hotel, once as room service as a treat, the other in the main restaurant. Both meals were superb. Service again was exemplary. The Tonga Room is a good laugh for Happy Hour, certainly a good way to spend a few hours, and yes their Mai Tais are pretty good indeed! Receptionists and Concierge were really helpful and knowledgeable - definitely ask for advice on restaurants, transport etc. I could go on - but let's just say we had a wonderful time and will do everything we can to make sure we stay here next time we visit San Francisco! Thanks to the Fairmont and all of your staff for getting our Honeymoon off to an incredible start.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Ryder78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Honeymoon and we were upgraded to the Bankok Suite. The hotel room was very clean, beautifully appointed and the views from our suite of San Francisco and the rooftop garden were amazing. The location was great, a short walk or tram ride from Union Square in one direction and a 15 minute tram ride to the Pier 39 area in the other. The only downside for us was that the hotel is very expensive to eat and drink in, as can be expected from a hotel of this quality in upmarket Nob Hill. This wasn't a huge problem however as there are many other options for food nearby if you don't want to spend the big bucks for hotel grub. In particular, Sears on Powell St close to Union Sq was a great spot for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and stuffy”
Reviews.Author: ColefamilyCommack
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised we weren't charged by the sheet for toilet paper used. if you thought Starbucks has expensive coffee try their cafe a mile from the room first thing in the morning and wait for minutes to spend $5 for mud.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, will return.”
Reviews.Author: bmcclure
Reviews.Content: This is really a beautiful hotel and in an excellent location. We booked a signature view room but called and asked to be upgraded to one of the main balcony suite rooms.
