There was a gap in the seal of the door so the light from the hallway shined through all night. We went down to the Tonga room and ended up walking away after no one ever came to seat us. I called one evening to have a cab ready to take us to the Symphony because I’ve had experiences with some cabs in other cities not taking credit cards. I was told it would be no problem and there would be one waiting at a specific time. After watching the bellmen hop around assisting everyone coming in and leaving the hotel but us, I stood at the end of the street to flag down my own. Which is not a problem, however if that was going to be the case I shouldn’t have been told otherwise. Ordering room service one night was a complete waste of the overpriced menu food I could have prepared myself; with the exception of the chocolate cake which I must say was phenomenal. I do wish it had been more clear and literally mentioned to me about the room service charge per person with gratuity included when I placed the order. Maybe that’s naive of me and you're thinking I should have read the fine print, but again this was my first time traveling to any other city besides the state I live in and I expected to be taken care of. Which I don’t feel is too much to ask. Although these were not a necessity to me, I also found it odd that such a higher end facility would not already have wifi and parking included; when even many 3 star hotels do. Just because one makes enough money doesn't mean they should be taken advantage of and sucked dry. I was just really let down with the ever so mediocre experience when I was expecting to have a happily memorable stay there, a fabulous place to call my own which I could continue to stay each returning trip, and a definite place to refer to those close to me. I will absolutely be staying somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Eh...better off somewhere else next time.”
Reviews.Author: JAYWELDON
Reviews.Content: It was overpriced however expedia made that not matter. It has a great location. It's an old hotel however so the usual can be expected. Bad plumbing, no electrical outlets. WIFI is 13.95 per day. THere is no laundry service. Hardly anyone in the hotel speaks english as their first language. The coincerge is overworked and hardly ever available. Make sure you do your planning ahead. You can walk to virtually everything but be careful because it's all hills. I recommend the Sight Seeing Tours in the Double Decker Buses or $35 a piece. It's definitely worth it and you can get on and off at all of the places you would want to visit in downtown San Francisco. The cable cars are $5 a piece one way. Make sure you know which direction you want to go though! The coincerge told me to just jump on one and it would take me where I wanted to go....NOT TRUE! After a $5 dollar ride down the hill I had to pay another $5 dollars to take me back up the hill in the "correct" direction. Overall San Francisco lives up to the hype though. It's a cool place but don't think you are going to be able to have fun on a BUDGET. It's a pricey place and stay at one of the "brand" hotels so you get the amenities at no extra charge and where the hotel staff is a little friendlier because of their corporate structures. P.S. There is no laundry service at the hotel. They outsource it so expect to pay TIME AND HALF if you need something the next day. P.S.S There is no pool and parking is $50 dollars a day. Don't pick up anything in the room that looks like food or beverages. It's spring loaded and will charge you automatically. I feel sorry for someone who tried to clean out the fridge to put in their own stuff =) We walked a block to the liquor store and got a bottle of awesome wine for $20 dollars instead of the same bottle in the hotel menu for $200.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel ....excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travellxyz
Reviews.Content: Blown away by the elegance of the lobby. Definitely a hotel from days gone by!! Room was very spacious, view from our room was great, bed/linens were extremely comfy, bathroom was also large with up to date amenities. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable, and was able to assist us with all aspects of our trip, from local transportation, sightseeing, restaurants and changing airline tickets. Would definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm in a Great Location (but choose an outward facing room)”
Reviews.Author: A_Travel_Opinion
Reviews.Content: Wanting a classic SF hotel, we had a room in the original building facing outward. We weren't disappointed. High ceilings and classic features but modern upgrades. The bedroom was somewhat small for today's standards, but not for the era in which the hotel was built. Large walk-in closet. Ok view--the original building isn't tall. Great lobby, fitting for the hotel's history. Tiki lounge was kitsch and fun for a dinner and drinks. We would pick the Fairmont again but would choose the newer Tower, a high-rise with great views of the city. If you stay in the original building, don't pick the inward, courtyard facing rooms if you want any kind of a view. There's absolutely nothing interesting to see, only other room windows across a roofed courtyard. Little light and a little dreary.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: fed83
Reviews.Content: Elegant hotel with spacious rooms. All the amenities that one would expect with one exception : no WiFi in the rooms. The lobby had WiFi but the rooms have only wired connections. Location is great with all 3 cable cars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Has seen better days, years ago....”
Reviews.Author: traveller20102
Reviews.Content: I'm very surprised to see so many good reviews for this property as I do not think they can be competitive to other 5 star properties in SF. Our room was small with old carpets, chipped furniture, dust all over the room and the paint is peeling off from the window frames.....The walkway to the room is actually an experience, since some off the doors (leading to the back of house I guess) are in the worst condition you can imagine, which reminded me on Airport motels...All this was topped by the breakfast which included the most disgusting buffet presentation I have ever seen in a 5 star hotel (I don't even know why we haven't left immediately, maybe only because of the lack of breakfast options near the hotel), none of the items was even of average quality....there is a chef preparing eggs in the middle of the restaurant, the lady in front of me was asking very kindly for scrambled eggs without putting too much butter/oil in the pan, his reply was seriously: I can't do it whith less oil, so either you stick to it or you will not be able to get any eggs at all!!! The wait staff wasn't better, most of them seem to have retired 30 years ago, which I guess was the time this property was still living up to his standard. Do not bother to stay there, many much better places and real 5 star hotels are just down the road.....

Reviews.Title: “hotel has pasted the best days”
Reviews.Author: DWGermany
Reviews.Content: the room was quite old fashioned, old equipment and quite noisy, the air condition does not allow any sleep. not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this lovely, grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluebell5031
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a grand, traditional feel to it but with an air of opulence. Loved sitting in the huge foyer with a coffee just people-watching-especially as President Obama was attending a huge function in the grand ballroom! Great excitement but didn't catch a glimpse. We paid to upgrade to a corner room in the new tower which had views of the bay and the city. It wasn't a massive room but was large enough for two with a lovely bathroom, beautiful bedlinen and soft furnishings and light colour scheme. It was my favourite room and hotel of our usa trip, well worth paying for upgrade. We liked the location, San Francisco isn't too huge so can walk or take trams. Ate in the main restuarant off the foyer one evening. Meal was very good, only negative was one waiter trying to do everything himself and looking rather harassed! Didn't try the Rainforest restaurant in basement, not our thing! I loved this hotel. Staff were professional, efficient and not unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Grand elegance”
Reviews.Author: marydomb
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated, the Fairmont exudes luxury and grandeur. The lobby is stunning and expansive, the staff impeccably attentive, and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. The location is good - be warned it is a hike up and down to get anywhere though you are very close to the Powell cable car - I wouldn't say ideal. If you want to feel pampered this is the p,ace to go.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Stay.....”
Reviews.Author: princessxxx
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel . heavenly bed . huge rod iron balcony. excellent prestine location on top of nob hill. close to china town union square, cable cars, singapore suite, when booked in advance great deal. only drawback if I had to say one is the $55 a day parking fee. I am looking to stay again for a whole week.. wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Leslie6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont in Nob Hill on a recent vacation. The room was very nice with beautiful city views and decor. The staff was very helpful with any needs we had and the location was a walk from restaurants. You can take a cab to the Fisherman's wharf area or walk it (about a mile). The only thing we did not enjoy about the Fairmont was the restaurant Tonga. Food was average and expensive. We would definitely stay at the Fairmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and a great stay on Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: traveler21820
Reviews.Content: To conclude our holiday in the U.S.A my wife and I treated ourselves on a 5 days stay in the Fairmont Hotel in San Francisco. A hotel with a history, which you can derive not only from the impressing lobby but also from the numerous photographs of celebrities that stayed, filmed or performed in the Fairmont. The Fairmont Hotel is a majestic building on top of Nob Hill, on of the few buildings that survived the 1906 Earthquake almost undamaged. When we entered our 'Tower room' we where astonished by the views over San Francisco and the Bay. Astonished to a degree that my wife, who has not only problems with heights but also with windows that can't be opened, felt rather uncomfortable. I decided to ask for a room with windows that can be opened and were, without hesitation, upgraded to a superb suite with a balcony on the backside, unfortunately without a great view. A couple of days later my wife decided to control her 'vertigo' to the utmost and surprised me with a second removal: to the Tower room with bay views again! Even now the staff was kind, understanding and cooperative. The Fairmont is located near Powell- and Californiastreet so you can hop on the cablecar any direction you like, if desired after a great breakfast in Cento [a kind of Starbucks, belonging to the Fairmont]. The Fairmont Hotel was superb place for us to spend a wedding anniversary in San Francisco , thanks to it's kind staff, everyone included!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: hbbrigham10
Reviews.Content: This was a very beautiful, well kept hotel. We loved our stay there, San Fransisco is a wonderful city to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great views”
Reviews.Author: missD07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is grand with some great history. It has spectacular views atop Knob Hill. It's just a little difficult to walk back up to the hotel if you're wearing heels. Better to catch a tram or taxi back. Our hotel room was lovely and spacious with a great view of the city. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful too. A beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old san francisco on a steep hill”
Reviews.Author: sn1ckerdoodle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, with a rich history. Many movies were filmed here. Features a very famous tiki bar, "The Tonga Room." My room was great. I had a view of the bay including Coit Tower and Alcatraz. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious with nice toiletries. Since I was staying for business, I liked the comfortable task chair and large desk. My only complaint is that the hotel is not very convenient to the rest of town. Being at the top of nob hill, it is well situated for a weekend of shopping or fun in the city. But for a business trip, the hill is too steep at the end of the day...

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: KB002
Reviews.Content: A stunning hotel. I had a Deluxe room in the Tower building with a fantastic view of San Francisco. Location was perfect. The room was very spacious, especially the bathroom which had both a shower and tub. Of the Fairmonts I have stayed in, my room here was by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmum3
Reviews.Content: A beautiful historic hotel with very friendly staff who were always willing to help. THe cable cars stop outside so it is very easy to get to and from Fishermans wharf and union square which is a quick 10m downhill walk. The beds were very most comfortable and the pillows heavenly! POssibly not the best place to stay with young children who would prefer to be around the wharf but my 10yr old daughter and I loved it!. The hotel does have an 'old world' feel to it but that is where its charm lays. The rooms were very spacious and the large luggage room was a great place to store and hang our clothes without crowding the room. Definately reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing...!”
Reviews.Author: WoodwayGreenwich
Reviews.Content: Staying in the Fairmont for 3 nights at the start of our 2 month honeymoon, we couldn't have kicked it off any better!! The location is perfect, with amazing views over the city. Arriving after a 10 hour flight, we were checked in quickly. Our room (8th floor) overlooked the garden, but there was a business party there with music being played so being so jet-lagged we asked to move rooms. We were upgraded to a room in the towers (15th floor). It was brilliant!! We had panoramic views of the city and didn't want to leave the room!! Excellent all rounder. Would definitely recommend it and hope to go again!!

Reviews.Title: “25th wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: newdaze
Reviews.Content: We were married in San Francisco in 1985, and had not been back since. I used to live 3 blocks from the Fairmont Hotel on Nob Hill from 1972 to 1976, and always admired its magnificence. Whenever family and friends would visit I would take them there for ice cream, in the old fashioned ice cream parlor, and then we would ride the outside elevator for a spectacular view and a drink, way up high..! Alas, these features are no longer there, but the cable cars still stop at the front and back doors, the view from the rooms are wonderful, and there is a coffee shop, the Cento, with excellent coffee and pastries, to start your day. Somethings just don't change. The location is the best...Chinatown right down the hill. Polk Gulch, downtown, the wharf and Embarcadero, all within easy reach!

Reviews.Title: “Most Beautiful Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: Travelmad1955
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont was the most beautiful hotel I've ever stayed in. My husband and I went there to celebrate our anniversary. We stayed in the original portion of the hotel on the 5th floor. The rooms were beautifully appointed and very luxurious. The bed was super comfortable and I have a bad back. The only problem was that on the second to last night of our stay we were awakened twice, first by guests on the west adjoining room who were apparently having some kind of business meeting then the guests on the east adjoining room started having a major fight and I had to call security. It was pretty bad! The hotel offered to move us to a different room which we graciously accepted and they put us in a tower room which was a corner suite. Fantastic views! Although we plan on going back, we will definately stay in the tower next time for all of our stay as apparently the walls in the original portion of the hotel have very little if any sound barrier. We actually suggested that they might want to call Mike Holmes of "Holmes on Homes" and get some suggestions from him as to how to fix the problem. All in all though our stay was excellent and the staff were top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Historic Hotel of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: love2travel28146
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Fairmont for 5 nights. We thoroughly enjoyed this grand, old hotel. It really gave us a sense of what old San Francisco would have been like. We booked a standard 2 queen bedroom on expedia and got a great rate. My husband contacted the hotel directly and requested a room with a view since it was my 40th birthday. They gave us a room on an upper floor with a great skyline view. The room was nice (adequate), and the view gorgeous. We enjoyed the lounge for cocktails on several occasions and ate once in the Tonga Room. I would recommend the Tonga Room for the appetizer menu and happy hour drinks. We loved the location of the hotel. It is right at the intersection of all 3 cable car lines, allowing easy usage. We enjoyed dinner 2 nights at The Nob Hill Cafe ( a short walk) and had drinks/appetizers one night at the Top of the Mark next door. If you want to be close to the hustle and bustle, stay in Union Square, but if you want to stay in one of the "grand landmarks" of the city, stay here! We would definitley return here!

Reviews.Title: “Over rated!!”
Reviews.Author: hikerprincess
Reviews.Content: We were booked with Vermont Biking Tours for an extended weekend at the Fairmont. Our room was tiny and faced a cement wall, we noticed water dripping from the window edge, condensation form the air conditioner. We called and ask for an upgrade. We were more than willing to pay, but nothing other than a room by the elevator was available. The noise beat out the leaky air vent. After dinner, six of our group tried for last minute cancelations but no luck. We had stayed at the Hyatt Embarkadaro the prior weekend for half the price and a beautiful room with a view of the bay. On future visits this is where we will return!

Reviews.Title: “So beautiful and stately, too bad it trips over its own feet”
Reviews.Author: RoweColaw
Reviews.Content: Nothing can really beat a 5 star gilded age hotel. The sheer beauty of the apointments, furnishings, and ambience cannot be beat. Even our room, in the "tower" (a nineteen fifties or sixties mess, you know the kind--- bad windows, a "modern" box) was well appointed, lush (separate shower and bath, marble floors, two closets...), and had a view to die for. The service staff was astounding--- pot of coffee from room service in 3 minutes flat! Seriously! Waiters, bussers, bartenders, all top notch. The down sides? A few. The room could have used to have been cleaned well sometime in the past year. A quarter inch of filth (not dust, grunge) on the baseboards was just a bit much. This hotel is ungodly expensive for everything. Ungodly. One example: they even have the unmitigated gall.... and I do call it gall.....to charge a 15% "surcharge" (yes, really) for breakfast which takes you to $40 PER PERSON before tax and tip for the roundly average buffet. The St. Regis in Princeville, with stunningly better food options and a view to die for, isn't even so proud of itself. On top of this, they were running loud construction every day during breakfast. So very charming. The front desk staff is haphazard and not particularly engaged. On our checkout day I stood around and waited until 12:45 for an overnight priority delivery which was there by noon, but apparently no one could be bothered to actually check the mail, and I ended up having to leave the package until I swung back through the city 17 days later-- and after they had finally called fifteen days later to admit they had it. Probably the most astounding was on our last day, at the mediocre and surcharged breakfast, where we had the misfortune to be seated next to the General Manager and Regional VP of this very Fairmont hotel. Not only was the man loud and foulmouthed (I lost track of how many times I heard the words "sh*t" and "j*s*s chr*st"), but was airing every "back of the house" issue you could imagine-- I felt so sorry for the staff and others he and his subordinate were addressing, running down, and generally evaluating in public that it was just pitiful. Hint, Mr. Klein, most guests of a 5 star hotel don't groove on pottymouth and bad manners over breakfast, and have NO INTEREST in your staffing, mechanical and other issues. All in all I would say this is a lovely place to stay and hemorrhage money if you have the means, but don't expect a world class experience-- except for the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: caymanshelly
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Fairmont on Nob Hill. The area it is in is very nice. If you are a walker, you'll get plenty of exercise walking up the hill to the hotel. We took cabs or the cable car which is right outside the door. The rooms were on the small side, but nice and the bed was comfortable with nice soft pillows. There was a nice walk in closet with shelving and a safe that could hold a laptop, We only ate breakfast there and it was a buffet with limited ala carte items because they said that they were doing kitchen remodeling. The buffet was good. You could get omelettes or waffles too. The continental breakfast was only $4 less than the full breakfast, so we pigged out! There is a little coffee shop on the lower level where you can pick up coffee and pastries if you don't want to do the expensive breakfast----or if you want to eat less. The lobby is beautiful--old and elegant. The people who worked there were friendly and helpful. We would enjoy staying there again. Got a special deal on the hotel website that included $50 a day food credit --granted $50 doesn't go far there, but it saved us a few dollars. Don't miss walking down to the Cable Car Museum which is close by--we found it very interesting. Free internet if you are a President's Club member, plus we got a free NY times every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great History, and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ebaysarah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont in May of 2010 for a part business/part leisure trip. This hotel was close to many of the different neighborhoods and was on a corner where 2 street car (trolley car) lines intersected - very convenient. The hotel was beautiful, I loved walking the hallway and reading about the history of the hotel - both in the "real world" and it's history in the movies. The staff that I interacted with were always helpful and courteous. We did all the major sight seeing while we were there - Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, etc.., and we fell in love with San Francisco and the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, beautiful, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: lbznyc603
Reviews.Content: What a GREAT hotel. Everyone should stay here when visiting San Fran and if you're a fan of the Fairmont chain. It's elegant, beautiful, classy, breathtaking, comfortable, and in such a great spot in San Francisco. Staff is so very helpful and will bend over backwards for you. Views abound from every room I feel like and it's easy to get to all the spots in the city from here. Great hotel bar and ambience in general. Definitely staying here again if I visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy”
Reviews.Author: FraserB
Reviews.Content: I can't believe i left this place off the reviews i posted earlier. We got a fantastic deal on Expedia on this hotel about half price. It was out last night in the states before flying home to the UK. What can i say the staff were great the room was v good for the money and our 2yr old daughter was well looked after. Our daughter was at the "learning to clim stairs" stage and this place was just the best dad. Its right at the top of knobhill, we walked down and back to Fishermans wharf and it really wasn't far. The food in the hotel was great even the room service was above average. All in a great hotel with fabulous history great staff and a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great historical hotel minus the service”
Reviews.Author: ma11245
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont, SF with family and friends. I love the history of the hotel and how it dates back to the early 1900s. However, with a name like "Fairmont", you'd expect classy service to go with what I understand is their flagship hotel. I was completely wrong. I read on one of the reviews that the place is just "ok". I would have to agree 100% Although the place is impressive, you are not getting the service to go along with this. During recent visits to San Francisco, I've stayed at the Ritz Carlton, The Omni, St. Francis, and Mandarin. Of these four, the two that stood out the most and far exceeded expectations were The Ritz Carlton and The Omni. Ritz is Ritz, what more can you say. As for the Omni, it's a smaller hotel, but their guest service ranks right at the top. Rooms are equally as well kept and clean as the Ritz Carlton, and the food is very good. I stayed at the Fairmont with several relatives and friends while in town. It was nice to be at the top of Nob Hill, something different for a change. However, I had an incident in the room where the wires seemed to be dangling from underneath the desk. I could clearly see it was not connected. The wires were on my lap while using the desk, that's how low. I called front desk and asked if someone could take care of this. They said someone will be up there shortly, within 30 min. I waited and waited. I gave it an hour thinking maybe they're backed up or something. I called again. This time the guy on the phone said "I show no request for the wires..." What?!!! Not too pleased with this, I said, "can you just have someone come up here to at least fastened this properly, so it doesn't always hang down onto my lap?" Okay, so I waited after he said "I'll send engineering right away." I waited... and waited. I finally called downstairs and asked for the Manager. I got the front desk manager. Funny, he sounded just like the guy I spoke to 30 min. earlier. Hmm. So the manager apologizes and says, "did they fix your toilet?" What?!!!! In the end, I once again explained the situation, only this time, I told him, sorry, but I'm just going to tape this or something because it's annoying with the wires hanging down. When I checked out, I thought, "this is such a nice hotel, but boy do they lack the overall service a hotel like this should provide." If it's for a night where you don't mind spending the money and don't care if you need the staff for anything, I'd say go ahead and stay there for the experience of this hotel. But if there's anything beyond staying at a place with a bed, I'd highly recommend the Ritz Carlton or the Omni. Both just down the street. I was very surprised with the Fairmont's Management. Very under trained. Inexperience shows so, so much. Michael

Reviews.Title: “Old Grand Dame, but lacks the facilities”
Reviews.Author: adrah
Reviews.Content: Hotel is grand and majestic, classic fairmont, but the service level on check in even for Fairmont President club member is forever. It took us 15 minutes to wait in line with everyone else just to get check in. The gym is very tiny and it located in the extreme corner of the hotel, so expect to walk for 10 minutes to get there ( a good workout by itself) and through the lobby and all the other guest in your sports outfit. Once you get to the gym, you will probably have to wait, cos its very small for a large property like fairmont. Also, beautiful view from the hotel, but a hike up and down if you need to get anywhere. bear that in mind. The room service is pricy and the service level is only ok. The housekeeping is good. Overall ok experience.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic fairmont!!”
Reviews.Author: NeilBelfastN/Ireland
Reviews.Content: just back from trip to states with 92 friends and acquaintances , first stop for 3 nights was the fairmont. Was a bit unsure , going by the reviews , I don't know where those people stayed I was in one of nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. Beautiful room with fantastic bed and pillows , wonderful bathroom , the lobby was welcoming and comfortable ,the drinks in the bar delicious and the service friendly and profressional.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel- Still Grand”
Reviews.Author: gynechiatrist
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at the Fairmont while attending a conference at the Mark Hopkins, across the street. I booked my room through expedia and got a "king with exterior view". one of the reasons that I chose the Fairmont was that the rate for this room was significantly less than the "conference rate" at the Hopkins. I arrived and was placed in a second floor room on the front of the hotel and and in the original section of the hotel. I arrived after midnight and was offered bell service but declined. I easily found my way to my room. WOW! This is the largest hotel room in which I have stayed in a large city. I am a 6 ft 3 inch guy and often feel cramped- but not here. There was an 10 foot closet and a large marble bath. It was great. The bed was extremely comfortable. The sitting area of the room was large- with a desk and chair at which I easily worked. The seperate chair and side table were comfortable for reading. Room service was utilized late one evening when I was tired and was excellent., but as usual, costly. Temperature controls were excellent. And while I did not have the best view, it was more than enough to not feel cramped. All the street care lines crossed outside the hotel- so hop on and off were easy enough. While the coffee shop is excellent with Illy coffee- it also served free in the lobby in the early am. I picked up pair of cups each morning on the way to my conference across the street . The Hopkins manager asked if the coffee was better at the Fairmont- and it was. While there are many negative reviews listed here for this hotel, it proved to be what I needed- when I needed it. And all the demanding spoiled fellow Americans-get a grip.

Reviews.Title: “Room needed a good clean!”
Reviews.Author: AlbertanMariner
Reviews.Content: We arrived by taxi but no help or assistance was offered so we dragged our heavy bags up the steps into the hotel. Check - in was fine in fact the guy was very friendly. We had a room on the fourth floor in the old part of the hotel overlooking the terrace. First impression was good but on closer inspection it really needed a good clean, thick dust on the shower head it hadn't been touched in quite some time, the bedside tables were also quite dusty, the glasses in the bathroom had been given a quick wipe but were quite grubby. The shower itself was ok but not great and the bathroom was quite small. As others have mentioned No COFFEE maker, there is a mini fridge but try taking something out and its automatically put straight on your bill even if you don't consume it. I happened to have a quick look at trip advisor the night before and learned that if you join their presidents internet is free, this saved us $50+ as we stayed for four nights, best to this before you go as once you are their you have to pay for internet to get on the internet to join the thing. Bed was very comfortable but not great room insulation, we were awoken one morning at 5.00am to hear a couple in a nearby room having a full blown argument. The banging door up and down the hall are quite annoying too. Overall not impressed, the place needs a facelift and a lick of paint.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service bad value disappointed”
Reviews.Author: decosterhorses
Reviews.Content: I usually leave good review but I have little good to say about this hotel. Service was horrible. We were charged for items ( more than$150) that we did not use and had to argue to have it taken of the bill. The concierge knew nothing and only offered tours they made money of. Light in the bathroom did not work. High price for in room Internet. High price for breakfast. They have a buffet which they told us first it was $30 later another family member $25. They have a little cafe but the coffee and hot chocolate was bad and cost a lot for an extremely small size. Go to starbucks down the street or a local breakfast place. You will get a better quicker and cheaper breakfast. Rooms were ok but bathroom was small. In conclusion, I was not impressed by this hotel and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I don't think there could possibly have been a nicer place to have spent our 10-day 25th Wedding Anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: cks4301
Reviews.Content: We read a lot of reviews that had negatives mentioned. Let's take them one at a time..... "No free internet". Join the Fairmont President's Club, for free, and the internet is.....FREE! "The on-site exercise facility charges a daily fee". Join the Fairmont President's Club, for free, and the exercise facility is.....FREE! "Parking is $50/night". True, that's the same in Chicago, New York, or any other large city. However, an unlimited usage MUNI pass is a great bargain. We bought a 7-day pass for $26/ea. Cable cars are $5 on-way, busses/trolleys are $2 each time. You can do the math and see the savings. Leave the car at home, and rent one only on the days you really need one. You can grab the Powell-Hyde cable car, go to the Hyde end of the line, and Hertz and Avis are within 2-blocks. We rented a Mustang drop-top, on two seperate days, for $140/day (rental fee, taxes, etc.). That rate was with a reservation. The Fairmont is located perfectly--all three cable car lines pass within feet of the hotel. If the cable car doesn't get you to exactly where you want to go, a short bus ride will. The only downside are the onsite restaurants. The Tonga room is an over-the-top joke. We heard, from the locals, that it was going to be shut down and turned into something else. It can't happen fast enough. The Laurel Court? All I need say is that the weekday breakfast buffet ran my wife and I $75! Walk a few blocks to Lori's Diner for breakfast, and go to Chinatown or North Beach for dinners to die for. We stayed in the Tower, 15th floor. Absolutely beautiful view, day or night. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for that special occassion.

Reviews.Title: “Living off its former glory. Housekeeping leaves a lot to be desired as well as customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sheryll
Reviews.Content: Never having stayed at a Fairmont Hotel before and having signed up on their President Club we were really looking forward to our three nights stay at the Fairmont Hotel in a Signature King room in the NSTower. As a fan of the TV Series Hotel from many years ago I was keen to see the hotel the show shot its series in. Well what a disappointment. On arrival we were greeted at the door and our bags unpacked and taken into the foyer. Geat start and a wonderful foyer with beautiful architecture and the old world glamour. As our room was not ready we left our bags and headed out to San Fran. Upon arriving back at the hotel my husband went back to pick up the keys to our room as we had checked in earlier in the day. The elder gentleman who served him was very disinterested and in fact at one stage said I have to go out the back and I will be back in a minute, almost ten minutes later he returned and said here's your keys, no apology for the wait - nothing. My husband was not impressed. Upon arriving at our room the room service breakfast trolley in all its disgusting glory was sitting right next to the door of our room, not a particulary nice way to enter your hotel room. The room itself (Room 1007)was quite nice and well appointed and we had a great view of the San Francisco Bay, however, housekeeping had not vacuumed the room very well as there were bits of stuff all over the carpet. Our bags were delivered by a very nice porter who explained about the features of the room and we asked him to remove the offending trolley of left over food from our door. Starting to unpack we noticed there were no robes or slippers in the room, so we rang down to the front desk complaining about the food trolley, requesting housekeeping come up and vaccum the room and also asked about robes and slippers. We were advised that that robes and slippers are put in at night with turndown (funny I have never found that in other hotels - but we gave them the benefit of the doubt). The robes and slippers arrived shortly after that and not at turndown. They also then sent housekeeping back up to vacuum the room and offered us two bottles of complimentary water for our inconvenience (big deal) in hindsight we should have just asked for another room as after this introduction to the hotel my husband was not happy in the room. Going down to the bar for drinks the service was quite good and we then decided to cross the hall and have dinner. My husband was in dress shorts and a smart polo shirt, (as we had been out all day and it was not a fine dining restaurant and we wanted a quick meal before retiring for the night) when he was told he could not enter as he had shorts on, but we could order from the same menu back over in the bar, which we did. However after being turned away we were not happy to see half way through our meal a family eating in that dining room with the man in shorts. Calling one of the restaurant staff over to query this when my husband in better dress shorts than the other gentleman had on I was advised that the other parties luggage had gone missing so they made an exception to their no shirts role. I advised them that if it was good enough for one guest it should have been good enough for all and that we should not be discrimated against in this manner, they apologised and offered to relocate us into the dining room, we refused on principal. On the positive side the room was nicely apointed and the bathroom was of a good size with separate bath and shower and a separate toilet area, however, the skirting boards on the bottom of the vanity basis were missing from under the vanity - not very good for a hotel of this nature. On the second night during of our stay at 11.30 pm the fire alarm went off. Well we were not sure what woke us and then had this droning sound, after a few minutes in which we expected if it was a fire alarm to have notification my husband went outside and found other guests wandering the corridor as well not sure what was happening. Upon trying to ring down to reception the lines were engaged, so we all just stood around not sure what to do until another guest came out and said false alarm. Not great if in fact it was a fire. Would I recommend this hotel NO, would I stay there again - a resounding No. For a hotel supposedly of the Fairmont Quality it certainly left a lot of be desired when in fact housekeeping and some simple customer service skills could have made our experience a lot nicer. We have since cancelled our Presidents Cup membership and will not be staying at any other Fairmont Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Famous old hotel is still elegant and lovely”
Reviews.Author: Opinioned_traveler
Reviews.Content: I was shocked at how nice our room was at the Fairmont - it was huge with beautiful bedding very clean and very ornate The hotel is grand and elegant Great location

Reviews.Title: “You should see the Tonga Room...”
Reviews.Author: longboardsurfer
Reviews.Content: You might not want to eat there. The hotel is really spectacular from the moment you enter the lobby. The room is a classic tiki bar with simulated thunderstorms, a lagoon ,thatched roof overhangs, a one of a kind, kitchy place and it may be removed to make way for a condo project. My wife and I took our 18 and 19 year old kids and one of their friends to see the room. The drinks arrived in glasses that were hot like they had just come out of the dishwasher and every drink had a chlorine smell. The ice melted quickly. The Mai Tai which they are known for was pretty mundane. We had a pina colada and a blue Hawaii and we'd give them both a "C" grade. We checked out the happy hour buffet, about $10/person and passed as it was fruit, egg rolls, chow mein and it just didn't look appealing. Instead, we ordered appetizers off the menu. They were just okay and not worth the price. I'm glad they got to see this classic bit of pop culture from the past. I've got to wonder that if they addressed the bar and food issues and raised the quality to match the prices, if the Tonga Room wouldn't be on the endangered list.

Reviews.Title: “Grand elegant Hotel with a fascinating History”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay15
Reviews.Content: We loved it here! We stayed in the main building with huge wide corridors and enormous bedrooms. Huge comfortable beds and all very clean. Not quite 5 Star but close enough. The Corridor of photographs showing the famous people who have stayed and performed in the hotel is worth a visit and the foyer is really elegant. We had breakfast in the cafe at the back of the Hotel as am sure the hotel breakfast is very pricey. All very centrally located and hotel is situated right on top of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, to stay great location”
Reviews.Author: msbadgeruk
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, a little posh but worth the dollor, great location downtown sf, transport and all facilities near by. hotel very clean and organised.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been mad if I'd been the one paying”
Reviews.Author: ymonster
Reviews.Content: My husband attended a huge conference at the Fairmont, and I tagged along for a mini vacation. The hotel is beautiful. And there is nothing in San Francisco that matches the lovely flags lining the front of the hotel. Other pros: Good cafe in the basement for breakfast. Tonga Room is fun for drinks and appetizers. Cons: Location isn't great if you're interested in exploring the city; doors in the main building are REALLY loud when they close, so avoid it if you're a light sleeper; but the real problem is this hotel's service: it's is poor, particularly given the Fairmont reputation and price. 1) My husband joined the President's Club to take advantage of free internet service in the rooms. Personally, I don't think a hotel of this quality should be charging $14/day for the internet. But my husband had trouble accessing it (probably because he was new to the President's Club). When we checked out, instead of taking his PC number and taking the charges off the bill, the woman at the front desk spent 15 minutes telling him that he didn't log in correctly. Finally, she took the charges off. 2) Upon check out, we called the bell desk for help with our bags. We weren't leaving San Francisco until that evening, so we wanted to store them at the hotel. The bellman told me that we could just leave them in the room... he would be right up to get them. Guess what? When we returned that evening, the bellman on duty (not the one from the morning) couldn't find them. Turns out that they were sitting in our vacated room ALL DAY. And to add insult to injury, the bellman took my husband over to the front desk and explained that we had never checked out properly or this wouldn't have happened. Since we spent 15 minutes with the first rude front desk person to get a new receipt, we pointed out how that was incorrect. And again, instead of just apologizing, the bellman and the front desk employee went on and on about how we shouldn't have left without a claim ticket. Certainly not superior (and in my mind, not even acceptable) service for a top tier hotel. Thank goodness my husband's employer was paying for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Is overrated”
Reviews.Author: roswell_co
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for four nights and were somewhat disappointed: Refrigerator was out of service, glasses were not washed and two days later disappeared without being replaced; not very sound proof (banging of doors in the morning and loud radio/TV in the evening). Bathroom was very small and the sink had cracks. In addition the internet was expensive (14$/day) and also the price for parking was stiff (50$/day+tax). (Parking fee can be halved if you park your car in the public garage across the street). Check out was very slow (10 minutes to take care of one person) Positive: Room was clean. In view of all this we would give to this hotel one star less than advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we would expect from a Fairmont - almost”
Reviews.Author: christopher_norland
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our 8 day visit to San Fran because we had enjoyed every other Fairmont we had stayed in (Vancouver, Montreal, Tremblant). This one did not disappoint. It has a real sense of history, as if it's a part of SF's own heritage. Lobby is just superb, and a tourist attraction in its own right. We had a room in the tower (20th floor) with great views south towards downtown and Union Sq and right across the road to the "Top of the Mark" bar atop the Mark Hopkins Hotel. Location could not be faulted, in one of San Fran's quieter districts, but only a few blocks from bustling Union Square. Our room (Deluxe, with 2 queen beds) was beautifully appointed, clean, and spacious (there were 3 of us). Staff were friendly and courteous. In particular Tom Wolf was a great concierge (and the original one in USA..!!) and got us great seats at the AT&T stadium. Breakfast in the Laurel restaurant was fantastic, but very expensive, so we ended up getting take-outs from the Cafe Cento (also part of the Fairmont) for most days. The bar had a lovely ambiance, very welcoming, never over full though always full of life, with very comfortable chairs and settees - a great place to unwind after a gruelling day's sightseeing down (and up!) San Fran's hills. Otherwise, only downside was 1) that there were no coffee/tea-making facilities in our room (first time I have ever stayed at a hotel in USA/Canada without such facilities....which I always use), 2) there were no arm chairs or settees in the room (have always had these in previous Fairmont deluxe rooms), and 3) the Nob Hill location is superb, but lacks the abundant choice of restaurants in other parts of the city (though Chinatown is only 3 blocks away). But these were of relatively minor importance in relation to our overall experience of what was undoubtedly one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Beautiful Lobby”
Reviews.Author: d_volman
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for my wife and I. We came to the city to get away and it created a great spot that was easy to access very comfortable. The room was nice and well kept. The staff were all friendly. The parking was $57 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive historic hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Snowflake girl
Reviews.Content: Love the location. In SF there are a million hotels to choose from this but offered for us the best central location to go everywhere yet it was not in the hub of the tourist trap / congestion of Fisherman's wharf or in noisy Downtown. This Fairmont is a quiet, luxurious, attentive and well staffed hotel that offered a spacious room with all the ammenities but do not mistake this as an inexpensive stay. Other considerations were a number of the boutique / SF line hotels but opted for this as it really was a nice quiet place to unwind after a long day sight seeing. Request a room in the renovated Crown Tower - large rooms that are both modern and very well maintained and clean. Plush carpets, super comfy beds and huge marble bathrooms. If you go online and register for free with "Fairmont President Club", there are discounted room rates / specials and as a member we had free high speed wireless in our room for the duration of our stay. When here try to stop in one evening at "The Tonga Room" for an indoor rain storm (developed well before the Rainforest Cafe idea - so awful !) that has rain falling from above to what was once the hotel's indoor pool. This tiki bar is so totally kitschy but I love it and rumour has it that they are considering closing it. Keep an eye out for the memorobilia that lines the hallways of famous guests, events and movies that have occured here.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, but tired”
Reviews.Author: donnjean
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the Fairmont. We checked in about 4PM and a housekeeper was in our room when we entered. A bit later I noticed that we had no bath towels and I went into the hall and asked a housekeeper who told me to call the front desk to request towels. A bellman just happened to be near and said he would let them know. We we returned to our room a few hours later, the towels were in place. The bathroom didn't seem to be very clean and there were empty hangers with no robes. The beds were very comfortable. There was not coffee/tea maker in the room. The overnight parking was $57. We did find a very friendly bellman at the desk in the lobby who recommended some chinese food for delivery. Good location right off California St.

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Transier
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the tower on the 23rd floor... great view, very comfortable bed, loved the huge tub and separate shower; we didn't mind the trek to the tower at all. I didn't realize the history of the hotel when I booked it... fabulous to see all the pictures of the hotel through the decades. Great location, though remember that being "atop Nob Hill" means you're always walking up on the way back to your hotel (unless you use the MUNI of course). Great hotel, great location, will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel with History and Class”
Reviews.Author: drummingtosca
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at the Fairmont San Francisco. We picked it because of its central location near Union Square and Powell Street and its sense of history. We were not disappointed. Being a President's Club premier member, I was able to get a free upgrade to a fabulous suite and third night free, which made the stay a fantastic deal. The hotel lobby is beautiful, with lots of comfortable chairs to lounge in, making people watching a very enjoyable activity. The bed was extremely comfortable, and big. The Frette sheets and the nice fluffy towels in the bathroom were great extra touches. The service at the front desk was a little uneven. We had some really friendly service at times, but just lukewarm responses at others. That didn't matter though, because we will always stay at the Fairmont whenever we are back in San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont As Expected-Fantastic In Most Ways”
Reviews.Author: CanuckRookie
Reviews.Content: A few points after staying this week-end in San Francisco at the Fairmont The hotel is stunning if you like historical beauty. The hotel is gorgeous throughout. Our room in the Tower on the 19th floor had a great view, with a big bathroom etc. Location is fine if you are able to walk, and if not transit is at the door. We walked all over the city wth our young baby, and thoroughly enjoyed coming up the hill at the end of the night The staff for the most part were fantastic. We did have an issue on the Saturday night, as a function occurring in the Crown Room created the feeling of being in a night club. I phoned and spoke with an operator who put me through to the manager. She did not offer to do anything for us, and said she would have engineering look into it, which in fairness to her, is all I asked. We had no interest in moving as my baby was asleep, and we were exhausted anyways. Fell asleep despite the noise. All other staff including concierge for questions were fantastic. Most of the complaints I have read can be alleviated by a few easy steps: Join the Presidents Club, it is simple and easy, and best of all, free Your WI FI is freee in your room, you can access the gym for free, and they will even provide you with gym clothes to work out. It was on my way to the gym early in the morning that I noticed coffe and tea at the concierge desk. I believe this is provided before the restaurants etc open, but not sure. When it wasn't there I brought up coffe from Cafe Centro, which is much cheaper than the ridiculous room service prices Overall, if you understand you will be in a hotel that is over a hundred years old, and will be a bit noisy etc, and don't mind walking a bit uphill, and you join the PC, you will enjoy your stay. However, if your looking for ultra-modern, you need to stay elsewhere. For us, it worked great and we would go back

Reviews.Title: “Historic, stunning and just perfect”
Reviews.Author: norwaytravler
Reviews.Content: The hills in SF were abit steaper than we thougt- so the walks back to the hotel were hard, since the hotel lies on top of nob hill. But hey- it only makes you stronger- and there is a cabel car stop right outside! Apart from that, this hotel has it all! From the moment we entered the hotel, we just held our mouth open: WOW. Beautiful impressive lobby, with lots of sitting space, excellent staff- our room on the 18th floor where great. We had 2 queens, and it was plenty big enough for 3 people. High sealing,large windows- beautiful views...ah, want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: shannamll
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed it. The room we stayed in was spacious and nice. The lobby is beautiful. My only complaint was that our room was at the front of the hotel and we could hear the bellmen blowing their whistle for the cabs. Otherwise, we really enjoyed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel-Dining experiences not so great”
Reviews.Author: Couji
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I came to San Fran and checked into the Fairmont. Front desk staff were helpful and concierge was nice as well. We got a beautiful room overlooking the bay with a view of Alcatraz. All the criteria so far that you come to expect from a Farimont were met. We decided to go to the Tonga Room the first night for dinner. Service staff were not approachable to converse with, it was more of an order taking experience than a "Hi how are you". The food was not really up to standard either. With all of the beautiful restaurant options in San Fran, I would choose to eat outside the hotel. The breakfast the next morning was not a good experience either, granted we got to the breakfast buffet as they were closing, but all of the items were cold. It really should not have been served to guests at $40 per person ice cold. I wish I had said something at the time. Again, eat off property. Otherwise we had a great time in the hotel, beautiful courtyard and rooms. Wish there was a swimming pool and can't believe that they only offer WiFi in the lobby. We stayed at the Best Western in Bellingham the night before our flight and they offered Wi Fi in the rooms. After climbing up to the top of Nob Hill due to cable car lines, it would have been refreshing to take a dip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: MrsSDunstable
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for 10 nights for our honeymoon and it was just a brilliant stay. Fishermans Wharf and Union Square are both a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel, as is Chinatown, it is very easy to navigate around the area too. Fantastic restaurants and fast food places nearby also added to the wonderful stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to enjoy the city and walking to attractions rather than taking taxis or public transport, although the cable cars run literally from outside the hotel so no problems getting around for those wishing to experience the unique cable cars. The hotel itself is fabulous, the staff were extremely helpful, friendly and always greeted us with a genuine warmth. Our room was a standard double so we expected it to be on the small side but it was bigger than most of the king-sized places we've stayed in in the UK! The room was also very clean, the bathroom was spacious, clean and the bathtub was huge! I would recommend the Fairmont to anyone looking to stay somewhere classy yet comfortable and within walking distance of some of San Francisco's best sights and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Our First Time to San Francisco...”
Reviews.Author: enmichels
Reviews.Content: This was our first time traveling to San Francisco, and my first time traveling to California. First, since most people only write about the hotel, I want to write something about the city for those of you who are also first time visitors. The airport is large, and very busy, but there are a lot of cabs to the hotels, it was $40 each way. The location of the hotel is pretty good, however, if I were to go back I would like to stay in the Union Square at the Drake or JW Marriott, or the Fisherman's Wharf at the Hyatt. You are about a 5 minute walk to Union square, but believe me it is a walk, the hills are so steep here that we preferred to take a taxi. The Trolleys are located right behind the hotel. We took the trolley to the Fisherman's Wharf, it is $5.00 each person, but it is a hassle, they only stop at certain locations, and there is never enough room. We just took a taxi again for $10.00. So if you are staying at this hotel to be close to the trolleys (like I did) I recommend another hotel closer to the hot spots. Room: We had an exterior room, the hotel was sold out when we were there due to the 4th. The rooms are average size, very comfy king bed, small bath, nice view from window of the Bay Bridge. We signed up for the presidents club online so we were able to use the internet there for free which was great. Cleaning staff was amazing, we even had turn down service nightly. When we checked in we noticed our mini fridge was empty, so I called immediately to let the staff know, hopefully we are not charged for anything, I am still waiting for my monthly statement. Weather: Pack accordingly, it was all fog, and a high of 60 degrees! I am glad I brought long pants, and sweaters! Napa Valley: We rented a car for the day and headed to Napa Valley, it was 85 degrees there and only 45 minutes away. We traveled through Muir woods (very cool) and across golden gate bridge. I recommend going to V.Sattui if you like sweet wines, I bought a Moscato there that was to die for! On the way home we took the Oakland way, there are a lot of restaurants there, and then we went over the Bay Bridge home. Union Square: So many stores and restaurants, but very very expensive. Everything in San Francisco is expensive, we spent over $1000 for 2 of us in 3 days. Also there are a lot of people living on the streets in union square begging for money, I wouldn't have felt safe unless I had my boyfriend there with me, this was not something I am used to. Fisherman's Wharf: You must go to Pier 39 to see Alcatraz and the seals! PS. Do not eat at Joes Crab Shack, it was gross. Height and Ashbury Street: It is about a $20 taxi ride there, and it is full of young hippies, but the stores are amazing, I bought some really cute tops there. Alamo Square: This is where the Full House home is! But besides that nothing else, its right by height and ashbury street and an expensive ride for a picture (probably a good idea to see if you have a car) Car Rental: We rented the car to see Napa, we got it from enterprise on Mason st in Union Square, we waited about 2 hrs for our car so they upgraded us to a Mercedes which was nice. Parking at the hotel was $50, and since we only had the car for 1 night and we left the next morning we dropped it off at 9pm with the valets at the hotel next to enterprise for $30, everything worked out great. Overall, I would probably stick with Napa Valley, it is much warmer, and not as many street people everywhere, I felt a lot safer there. I am glad I was able to travel to San Francisco but I would probably just visit there instead of stay there. Hope this helps, feel free to email me!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, with only a few minor problems”
Reviews.Author: dcarson4
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here while visiting San Francisco. We loved our stay there, with only a few minor exceptions. When I originally started planning our trip to SF I checked rates for the Fairmont and found it to be too expensive, so I booked another room upscale hotel in the city. The week before our trip I checked rates again and found a great rate on the hotels website. With a AAA discount I was able to get a room in the main building for $153 a night, but opted for a larger, standard room in the tower for $171. I thought that was a great rate. At check in DH decided to upgrade us to a premiere tower room for $50 more a night. It was worth the money, as we were on the 20th floor with a view of the entire city. The room was lovely and the bed was amazingly comfortable. The bathroom was large, with a large shower and separate soaking tub. The only down side was that there was very little counter space. The service was amazing. We used the concierge desk several times for making reservations as well as various suggestions for travel around the area and shopping. They were always very helpful. Also, upon checking in, we noticed there was only one bathrobe, so we called and asked if we were supposed to have two. Within five minutes there was someone at our door with a second robe. Also we had drinks in the Tonga Room, and it was great. Only a few complaints. As others mentioned, there is no coffee maker in the room, or coffee conveniently available. A pot of coffee from room service was $20 plus all the service chages, gratuities etc. In the morning, while dressing, I would just like a cup of coffee to help me get going. I don't want t spend that kind of money and I don't want to get dressed to have to go looking for coffee. Also, I joined the Presidents Club in order to get free internet otherwise it was $13.95 a day. In the desk, there was a wireless router, but the signal was so low I could never connect to it. There was also an ethernet cable/connection, but it would not work either. I found a 24 hour help desk number and contacted them. They walked me through what I needed to do, but it never worked. He suggested that I might need a new ethernet cable and said he would contact the front desk and have a new one sent up right away. We waited for a long time, but no one ever came. I finally found one of my own in the bottom of my computer bag, and was able to connect with it. We were never able to connect wirelessly. I do not recommend the Sunday breakfast buffet. We decided to try it, even though $30 each seemed a bit high. We figured it would be wonderful. While it was okay, it was definitely not worth the money. The buffet did have lots of good fresh fruits, and some nice baked goods, but the main dishes were just not great and had a small selection. The selections of hot dishes were eggs benedict, French toast, oatmeal, potatoes, bacon and sausage The French toast was dry and stale, and the eggs benedict, looked pretty dried out as well. We opted for the omelette station instead. The omlette was okay, but not something I would have again. They did offer Belgian waffes as well, but we did not try them. The breakfast price included coffe and juice, and we ordered nothing extra, but by the time the bill came, with all of the surcharges added on, including a 15% breakfast surcharge (What?) it was $75.75 for 2 people. Really outrageous for a mediocre breakfast. Also, we did notice a small bit of wear and tear on the furniture in some of the common areas, but overall it was in good condition and still a beautiful hotel and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel, but in need of an update”
Reviews.Author: Gianna01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmount San Francisco while touring Napa and the coast. I stayed at the Fairmount ten years ago and found my stay there to be excellent, so I went back. Well, nothing in that hotel changed in ten years! Its a beautiful hotel, with a historic past, amazing lobby, clean rooms, clean common areas, but it is in need of a renovation - specifically, the rugs and some of the furniture in the lobby, which was worn. Also, the breakfast buffet is very expensive for what you are getting. Other Fairmounts offer a more lavish breakfast. The concierge is very good, but they are hard to get on the phone. The housekeeping was excellent. No complaints there. The location and view is beautiful from the top floors of the hotel, bay view. The only drawback is that it is a bit out of the way, and you have to take the trolley (which is expensive) or a taxi (which is not as expensive, but also expensive) to go anywhere. so, location is an issue. Overall, it's still a classic, a great hotel, with a great past, and well worth the visit if you are looking for a traditional, classic, historical hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with lots of extra charges!”
Reviews.Author: nancy354
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and great location. Exquisite bed and linens. Fantastic view from an upper floor. Exhausting to your wallet to be charged for everything, including basically tap water bottled with the hotel logo! No coffee/tea maker in room. No handy coffee shop nor complimentary coffee in hotel lobby in the morning. Even the wifi not really free! (Charge is $14/day unless you have a friendly front desk tip to join the "President's Club" and get it for free!)

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: LabelleLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for 3 nights at the beginning of June and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in a great location and is only a 5 minute walk down to Union Square. We didn't eat in the hotel but did have cocktails in the Tonga Room which were good. The bed was incredibly comfortable which made it difficult to get up in the morning! The only complaints I have is they charge $15 each for use of the hotel gym and as we only wanted to wake up and shake off our jet lag by going for a run on the treadmill, we just went for a run outside instead, which was actually a lot nicer than being inside. Also, as with other guests, we found it a little irritating that there was no tea/coffee making facility in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellersyul
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel and enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel is grand with loads of old world elegance. The room was one of the largest we have stayed in. The food and service at the Laurel Court were outstanding. The one negative note was that upon arrival, nobody came to help us remove our suitcase and bags from the taxi. Service at the reception desk could have been more personal.

Reviews.Title: “A classy way to finish route 101”
Reviews.Author: JamesSharpe
Reviews.Content: We had a suite on the top floor of the hotel. From here, being on one of the highest peaks in San Fran gives you a stunning view of the bay, Alcatraz and the bridge. The staff are pretty discrete, dutifully going about their service without hindrance to you, just making sure you’re very very comfortable. The cocktail bar is stunning with 15 meter high dome ceiling and fancy paint work that makes you feel like a king. Right outside is a traditional cable car which are expensive to ride but pretty fun, you seem to dice with death each time you use it.

Reviews.Title: “As good as expected”
Reviews.Author: Speedydotc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the start of our fortnight in California. We had room on the 17 floor looking out over the bay - grea view of Alcatraz and Golden Gate. Room very comfortable and only item missing was coffee machine! Mini Bar rather expensive too!! Staff at breakfast really friendly - even though we had to queue first morning. Make sure you have breakfast included in your room price so you dont have to pay. Conceirge pretty helpfull. Ate in the hotel "themed" restaurant - house band not up to much but the locals certainly enjoyed the dancing!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful Fairmont stay”
Reviews.Author: SunSeekerMA
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at the Fairmont San Francisco. We had a lovely room with a great view of the city, soft comfy beds and wonderful service. The hotel has a great old world feel coupled with modern amenities. The lobby is gorgeous and the hotel is perfectly situated. Yes, it sits on a steep hill but the cable car picks up right outside and runs in 4 directions. Plus we found the hills to be great exercise after eating such great meals in San Francisco. The front desk, concierge, bell staff and parking attendants were all attentive and excellent. The only down side at all to our stay was the $57 per day parking fee which includes at 14% tax! Wow, is this Sweden? Clearly if you are staying only in the city a car is not necessary , but we took day trips to Napa and to the US Open at Pebble Beach so a car was necessary. Although there is a Hertz at the Fairmont (pick-up only) we found that even with the parking and renting for 2 extra days, it was less expensive to rent at the airport. We were also glad we did because we overheard the Hertz desk saying they had no cars available. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location, and Lobby!”
Reviews.Author: 1865Smith
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the second leg of our vacation for four nights. The hotel is gorgeous and sits on top of Nob Hill with great views of the city. We upgraded to a Tower Room for better views of the city for only 30 dollars a night. The room was huge, great bathroom, great views of downtown San Francisco, and a really comfortable bed. The lobby is absolutely gorgeous. We spent some time at the Tonga Room for drinks which was nice and had nightly entertainment. The concierge recomended great restaurants and guided us through the city. We loved our stay here and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicole1117
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to San Fransisco last summer and booked the Fairmont because we got it for a great price. The hotel is huge and has a really interesting history which you can learn about by reading the articles and looking at all the photos along the hallways. The location is in a beautiful neighborhood - right at the top of Nob Hill. We walked, bused, or took the cable cars everywhere we wanted to go. On a few occasions took a short cab ride, but that was just us being lazy. The rooms are really nice and the bed is super comfy! Great bathrooms too. We ordered room service one night - The food was good, but definitely pricey. I recommend eating at a little restaurant around the corner called Nob Hill Cafe. Sooo good and so close! Overall, we loved this hotel. If we ever return to San Fransisco we will DEFINITELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great HOTEL on Union Square”
Reviews.Author: JBigJhonny
Reviews.Content: 1st Class Hotel, Great Service, Food, Entertainment....etc

Reviews.Title: “Best Service EVER at any hotel I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: LesP1
Reviews.Content: Everything was first class (as I normally find at Fairmont properties), but the service went well beyond what I expected. Phenomenal experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and lux, but a little jaded by previous night across the street!”
Reviews.Author: DAL504
Reviews.Content: I had to extend my recent trip to SF by a day but couldn't secure the rate I had the night before at the Mark Hopkins and found a special at the Fairmont. I moved my stuff in the morning and felt that while the Fairmont had done renovations, they weren't as well done as at the Intercontinental. The room was spacious enough and had a lot of original moldings (and a huge closet) but it didn't have that super fresh feeling - it felt a little like an old apartment building and was a little...musty. It was relatively easy to overlook, and perhaps had I stayed here first, I wouldn't have noticed as much. The other thing that I found annoying was that while they had a top rate gym (a Club One), it was not complimentary for guests. THAT was annoying. I never understand why the more expensive the hotel, the more it seems like there is a nickel and dime (well, more like Franklin and Grant) mentality for any services. It wasn't a terrible hotel - there was definitely charm galore, and it is beautiful architecturally, but I guess I was spoiled by it's neighbor across the cable car tracks!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Body Snatchers”
Reviews.Author: KerryAz
Reviews.Content: My memory of the Fairmont has always been that of grace and elegance - I don't know what has happened, but apparently it has been attacked of the hotel service providers snatchers. Me and my colleagues have never met so many rude, nasty, lazy and arrogant staff members all in one hotel! We spent all of happy hour swapping stories of the terrible and rude service. From the front desk, to reservations to the valet who told us to go get our car several blocks away - and he was quite put out when we explained to him valet meant he would be getting the car. Horrible experience - don't stay here until they get a complete management and staff replacement. Honestly I don't know what is happening to the place but it is bad.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, over rated & over the hill”
Reviews.Author: Aaayron
Reviews.Content: Upon checkin, my wife and I were treated to what has to be one of the most gorgious hotel lobbies ever created. In the spirit of other classic hotels of the world, The Fairmont lobby will take your breath away. The anticipation of entering our top floor suite was as great as the disappointment when the door opened and a musty, dusty, moldy odor of ancient carpeting, furniture and draperies combined with a hint of the plumbing backing up, made our toes curl. Before we could express our dismay, the bellman had already gone without even waiting or asking for a tip. It's like he knew that we were going to hate the room. We called down to the front desk only to be told that the only room in the hotel available, was an inside standard rooms. No view and only a queen bed. (Only suites have king beds.) The standard rooms are very small. Probably, the reason for no king beds. The bathroom was only big enough to physically contain the camode, sink and tub. But, the standard room was more updated. The bad thing was that our room was right next to the housekeeping supply closet. So, in the middle of the night, when someone wants some towels or something, we were awakened. Even after several complaints to the front desk, the staff made no attempt to be quiet during the night. For the money, this place is a complete ripoff. I can stay at a hotel with a nicer, larger room for half the price. If you do not care what things cost, you won't mind the inflated cost of the room or $30 per person for the breakfast buffet, plus 15% gratuity that THEY ADD to the check (for a buffet). The service from the staff was actually OK, with the exception of the doorman. When we were leaving, he watched me struggle with our luggage down the stairs while he was chit chatting with another employee. As I got the bags to the cab, he finally came over and asked if we needed any assistance. I said well, not anymore. He did not like that and basically advised me (with extra attitude) that I should have waited at the top of the stairs until he arrived to help. I said I had a flight to catch and he should go and finish his conversation with his freind. Anyway, it's nice to pop in and check out the beautiful lobby, but save yourself some money and stay in a nicer room somewhere else. UPS store in the basement for sending purchases home was nice.

Reviews.Title: “OMG, WHAT AN AMAZING HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: msghosthunter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just spectacular. We splurged and got a suite with the best view in the city. We could see Alcatraz and the bay like it was just outside the window. Our king size bed was just as comfortable as our bed at home. The service was outstanding and the food wonderful. I can't say enough this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: NVRam123
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in a suite in the main building-we were upgraded to a signature suite upon check in for no apparent reason-love that! The suite was huge - 2 rooms with a large wrought iron balcony looking out towards the tower. We were very impressed by the room. We had room service dinner that was very good as well. The location of the hotel can't be beat, you're on top of Nob Hill with beautiful views, tons of things within walking distance, Grace Cathedral right there plus the Mark Hopkins and Huntington Hotels. At the Fairmont SF you really feel you're in SF not just another Hyatt or Hilton in any city. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Big Old Place with Respectable Suites.”
Reviews.Author: ExpectGreat
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel and have stayed many times over the years. It is not trendy or stylish, and the most recent makeover chose odd colors, but the suites are spacious and comfortable with great views, the Nob Hill location is excellent, and some of the staff try hard though the service is always inconsistent. For the price, a great value, though parking is a fortune and valet can be very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Winedinetravel
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is simply fabulous, so beautiful, rooms are luxurious and very large, especially in the older part. Best place to enjoy San Francisco from. But when do luxury hotels start offering free wireless like every other small inn/hotel or motel?? Great Stay, can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Always #1 Choice in SF"”
Reviews.Author: BDfromDC
Reviews.Content: Another wonderful stay at the Fairmont, high atop this beautiful city. You can't beat the cable car access, with two lines crossing right behind the hotel you are minutes from Union Square, the financial district, or Fisherman's Wharf without being in the middle of all the crowds and noise those areas include. Like staying in a castle. The new Cafe Centro offers a lower-priced dining option. Only suggestions I would make is a more helpful door/bell staff and in-room coffee makers. Don't miss the Tonga Room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Zero sleep”
Reviews.Author: mangomark
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to be staying at The Fairmont. The building is fantastic and full of character and you get a great sense of home when you step in. The service from all hotel staff is superb and they make you feel really welcome. Location is at the top of Nob Hill so perfect for getting around, albeit steep walks down hill from all angles. The trams pass right by the hotel though so just hop on if you don't feel like a bit of tough leg exercise! And I mean tough sometimes if felt like you were leaning right back to walk downhill. Places to eat all around so no problem there. The room I had was huge with vast high ceilings and a great view of Alcatraz. I had no problems with the room at all, it was superb. The big downside is that the soundproofing is non existent and all night you can hear guests talking in the corridor, either on their mobiles or to each other.
